review: Horrible experience with this medication with first dose. Gave me a headache, nausea, felt disoriented, brain fog, heart palpations, fatigue, and feelings of sadness. Went to ER. Doc prescribed me a different antibiotic. Told me not to take that medicine again. A $10 prescription turned into a $200 ER visit!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Absolutely horrible. I also as someone here mentioned never experienced any side effects from drugs until I took this one. First dose was ok. Second dose I started feeling very nauseous to the point I was very sick, I haven’t even been this sick when pregnant! Bad diarrhoea and feeling weak. I started thinking what it was as the symptoms of the UTI come on suddenly and I was perfect prior to it. I stopped immediately and today feeling much better but still weak as after having flu. Bad stuff, DON'T TAKE IT!!!!!

I’ll try to make a long story..short. I had a CT scan in December 2021 for kidney stones. My lungs were normal at that time. This month, I was prescribed Nitrofurantoin for an UTI. On the 3rd morning, I developed flu-like symptoms. Nothing leading up to it, no scratchy throat, etc. Just suddenly, I was very ill. I could have left the UTI untreated and still would have felt better than I did on this prescription! I was out of work for 4 days. Also, I took a Covid test AND a flu test..both were negative. I had another CT scan scheduled ( for the kidney stones again) on the last day of dosage. (Btw- I informed my urologist and he told me to immediately stop taking it) My test result came back with Pleural Effusion unilateral/left lung only. Today, I had a follow up X ray for THAT scary issue. No pleural effusion..gone. Yes, my UTI is gone too. Was all this all worth it? NO! I will never, ever again take this medication. If you want to risk it for the biscuit, go for it.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This drug nearly did me in. Vomiting and stomach cramps, general malaise. Pounding headaches and diarrhea. Idk why my doc picked this, it was brutal.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I'm day 2 taking macrobid for UTI. My epigastric region hurts so bad. I took alkaseltzer chews to help and it does immediately for a few minutes. I suffered so bad yesterday. Today I woke up ok but I took the Macrobid with food and I slowly started back up. I don't know if I can go through this for 5 more days. My STOMACH.....arrgghhh

I'll tell you, when I first took first pill it did heal my UTI, but the side effects caused my body to body  to feel heavy, fatigue, bad headaches, side pains, and drowisness.  You need to eat heavy b4 taking it, but still I get drowsy.

I am 18 weeks pregnant and was told I had a slight UTI. I took one pill at noon yesterday and the side effects were immediate. Nausea, chills, vomiting, tiredness, and stomach cramping. I called the pharmacist and they said those are normal. At this point I’m in tears from the pain and nausea so I go the emergency room. It was so bad I thought maybe I had a kidney infection. My heart rate at the ER was through the roof.  They took me off the nitrofurantion right away and prescribed something else. I only took one pill at noon yesterday  , it’s been almost 24 hours and still feel just as bad. Nausea, loss of appetite, emotional, stomach cramps, gassy stomach, and chills. Would not recommend to anyone!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):So after reading  all of these reviews I was terrified to take this medicine. However I did take it and on day one I felt lightheaded dizzy and a little nauseous when reading the reviews some said to eat with it a lot. Make sure you eat first then take it and eat some sort of bread items. Once I did that symptoms cleared up. Made sure I ate 3 good sized meals a day. However day 4 I started getting back and muscle pain. But, when compared to a UTI I would take that any day. So word of the wise EAT good meals and you should be okay. I kept waiting for the fever and headaches but didn't happen.

I have taken this medicine in the past.  And it has worked very quickly.  Only side effect that I ever had was nausea, so taking it with food is a must if you have a sensitive stomach.  But this time was totally different.  A little after four hours of taking my first pill, I noticed that my palms started to itch.  Then my heels started to itch.  Thirty minutes after that I started to itch all over and started to develop hives everywhere on my body.  So strange how a medicine that you never really had problems with before, can turn on you.  Do not be afraid to take the medicine.  Just keep some benadryl on hand incase it is ever needed.  I learned the hard way.

This medication is terrible. I was prescribed this med for a UTI. I had urinary discomfort after having sex but decided to just keep an eye on it, take vitamin c and cranberry pills and drank a lot of water to see if I felt better. A week later after having sex, I woke up peeing blood. I immediately went to urgent care where they prescribed med for 7 days twice a day. Even though it got rid of my UTI.   I was experiencing really bad anxiety, racing thoughts and I just overall felt unsteady 3-4 days while on it. Which I never experienced before taking this med. But I continued to take the med because my UTI was feeling better. It’s been four days since I finished the medication and I am still experiencing dizziness, I feel dazed all the time, extremely fatigued, blurred vision, I just feel zoned out. I’m hoping that this med did not cause any permanent damage I’m hoping that within a few days I will feel back to myself. I do not recommend this med at all.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I must be allergic to this.  Aches, shivering, headache, exhaustion.  VERY rough night.  Last time had pain and burning on the soles of feet.  Dr. thought I was nuts and told me take a Covid test which was negative.  I have never been allergic to anything before.  Weird.  It is now marked on my chart to steer clear of this drug for me.  Giving a 2 because it DID help my UTI.  Now on Cipro, we'll see.....
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed macrobid for my uti and it's worked the best out of every other antibiotic I have been prescribed.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m 62, post-menopausal, and have suffered with recurrent UTIs for over 16 months. After getting recent in-depth DNA testing from MicrogenDX which showed E. coli, E. faecalis, and Klebsiella, the only 2 antibiotics that treated all 3 bacteria were Macrobid and Fosfomycin. My PCP decided to try Macrobid and prescribed 3 weeks of it at 2 per day. After only 4 capsules, I was far sicker than I’d been with the UTI. Drug sensitivity runs in my family on the women’s side but occasionally there are drugs we can tolerate. This wasn’t one of them. I felt as if I’d been poisoned - severe nausea, chills, diarrhea, weakness to the point of being unable to walk, racing heart, and what can only be described as not even being aware of my surroundings. As soon as I discontinued the Macrobid, the side effects began to slowly dissipate. Now all I have left to try is Fosfomycin and I’m hoping against hope that I’ll be able to tolerate it.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took 3 pills and it made me sick. Headache fatigue and overall felt awful ended up sleeping because I felt so bad almost like a feverish feeling.  I wanted to try and and see if I could take it but it just made me sick.

I was prescribed this for a UTI, 2x daily for 3 days (6 total pills). A few hours after taking my 5th pill, I experienced the most severe stomach pain and bloating I've ever felt. More concerningly, my arms and legs started to tingle and eventually my lower arms seized up entirely and went numb. I could not move my hands or fingers for at least five minutes, and I also struggled to speak. I am a 23 year old female with no previous history of anything like this occurring. I ended up calling the ambulance because it was so scary -- thought I was having a stroke. Ended up being completely cleared; nothing was 'wrong' and the medics diagnosed it as an anxiety attack (I have never had an anxiety attack or clinical anxiety of any sort). After reading other reviews where something similar happened to other people, I am certain this antibiotic had something to do with what I experienced. I have been completely fine in the week since I finished the pills. It did cure my UTI though.

Well, Least I aren't the only one who Googles medicine before taking it. Anyway, I'm a 19 year old female who has severe anxiety. My doctor told me I had the start of a UTI so she prescribed me 2x 7 Days Nitrofurantoin. I've usually was given penicillin but this time was different. I took it late cause me and my mom was at McDonald's getting supper (she bought me a McFlurry) I saw you could either eat something or drink milkto not have an upset stomach. Well that isn't my issue, My issue is an annoying headache. I've only taken 3 of the pills so far and so far my only problem is a headache and dizziness and a few eye issues. (I drunk some milk which calmed the headache down a bit).

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Blurred vision, dilated pupils, red irritated eyes, headache, sore/dry throat, pain in right side. I'm hoping my vision returns to normal this is day 3 now of blurred vision feels like when you have your eyes dilated only much longer and more frightening wondering what effects and how long. I am feeling anxious the vision problems are not helping with this. I'm concerned and thinking this is a dangerous drug and maybe the dosage too is too high or just simply a dangerous drug. Oh, I still feel the UTI symptoms too. I was in the first half of my prescription when this started, I've called the doctor and have not heard back I plan to call or go tomorrow.  Please use caution if you are prescribed please use care if you are prescribing it and pharmacist please go over that this does indeed have dangerous side effects.

Horrible side effects for me. I had no idea this drug could affect lungs, if I'd known I would never have taken it as I have had breathing problems in the past. I had a mild UTI, and was prescribed 3 day course (2 tablets per day). Shortness of breath and discomfort in lungs happened almost immediately, and was very distressing. My ventolin inhaler made almost no difference - I almost went to A and E. I was also extremely lethargic, palpitations, and tingling/numb hands. Then mood swings, weird angry outbursts followed by nearly a whole day of crying!! Absolutely horrible, but so glad I looked up this drug and realised what was happening. No UTI any more but a huge price to pay for that!!

I got prescribed this medication to a to a UTI. On day one I didn’t really think much of the medicine because I took it a little bit before eating some food so I figured that the nausea was coming from not taking it immediately with food. Day two I took the medication with food but I had nausea and just feeling of unwellness and was a little spacey. On day three that’s when I got a rash right after I took it my arms were itchy my face was hot and itchy. I started to have a heart palpitations so I took a nap but the headache was so intense I wasn’t able to go to sleep. The nausea was horrible and I just had a knot in my throat like I felt like I was gonna throw up. This is when I realize that this medication was really making me feel incredibly horrible. I would not recommend this medicine to anybody if there is an alternative medication I would use it because this medicine makes you feel so sick….

I’m the type that hates taking medications but after seeing some positive reviews on here I decided to take the first dose. I felt good all day until later that night before the next dose. My heart was beating really fast. So I decided not to take the next dose and maybe try it the next day. The next day I felt so sick to my stomach, weak, fast heart beat, could barely function, very tired. Black stools. It was horrible. I decided I’m not going to take anymore. I only took one pill after 3 days I still feel like crap.. I will not recommend this

I had my first UTI and was prescribed nitrofurantoin 100mg 2x a day. I felt better after a day, took the full 5 days and then 6 days later started back with symptoms.  The symptoms are not as bad as when it first started, so I don't know if it it just wasn't enough or if the infection came back.  I'm on Cipro now. Hopefully this works.  Other than that there were no side effects.
Had a bad UTI and was prescribed this, I’ve taken it about 3 times and every time I experienced heart palpitations.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid 100gm are very good for UTI 7 day course, no side-effects.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Ok so I have been struggling with UTI's for years now and have always had Macrobid prescribed I never had an issue with it. I am 31 now and the first couple of day's I was fine as usual but on the 5th day so much diarrhea, nausea and I'm so tired. This is the worst reaction I have ever had to this. IDK why my body is reacting this way after so many times being ok with this drug.  Just be cautious this can happen. I'm done. I'm not taking my last 4 pills I rather go back to the doctor if my UTI returns

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Day 5. Bright blue lips, and fingertips. Could hardly breathe. Made it to the fridge for water added salt. Some recovery. Urgent care the next day. Agreed it was the Macrobid. Pulmonologist>>>ground glass image in lungs. May or may not recover. 3 months later CT scan improved. Really screwed up my lungs. DO NOT USE IF YOU HAVE ANY LUNG ISSUES.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was having severe pain in my upper right abdomen and in the back. Went to the ER they sent me home, ended up getting worse, I went back 5 days later dr prescribed me this. 100mg of it and I was told to take it twice a day and eat before taking it. First day I was sicker than ever in pain, came home after 5 hours in the ER and the pain did not go away (suspected maybe I had an STD like chlamydia/gonorrhea or trich) but the doctors said everything was negative so they said it was just a bad UTI. I told them I was allergic to sulfa meds and they reassured me I would be fine on this. 2nd day I am fine with the first dose and 2nd dose I begin to feel numb, my belly still hurts, my back too. I began to have this confusion that will not go away!!!! Dizzy,Nauseated, my thoughts are not making sense, I'm sweating, I begin to hallucinate and I am not doing good. My family is worried and they're saying "you're not making any sense!" And my heart had been rapid. STAY AWAY from this.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have been a nurse for over 20 years, have never had drug allergies. Day two on macrobid it begins for me.  I get severe body aches, 101 fever, vomiting. I have been through this twice now, not believing my own truth the first time because it is so very odd! It’s definitely the drug. You’re not crazy. I was bed ridden with fever and sweating it out with doses of Advil… my bed was soaking wet.  I treated the symptoms and after 48 hours after dose three (I stopped after that) I’m left with a headache but much better. It’s a side effect, I believe. The antihistamine I took didn’t seem to help… and none of this makes sense as an allergic response. I’m still shocked as I feel I’m immune to this type of thing. Haha. But my UTI seems to be gone! A lot of suffering for this one.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):When I had my first UTI I was prescribed with Bactrim. Later found out that I was allergic to it, developed some hives and rashes. Then my Dr switched it to Microbid. It was great, did not develop any side effects. UTI was gone. 3 years later, I develop another Uti, I told my doctor that I prefer to be prescribed with Microbid since I responded very well the last time I took  it. But this time is different, I started to develop almost all of the side effects. I feel so weak, nauseated and dizzy all the time.  Lost of appetite and my vision turned out a little funny. But my UTI was  better except that the side effects just got me this time. I would say that Microbid is a good drug for UTI. As we age our body reacts differently to drugs, and indeed medications/vaccines are not a one size fits all.
Chills,  banging headache, diarrhea, throwing up, orange urine.  Had to stop after 3 1/2 days.  What a horrible worthless drug.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid is a great medication. It is very strong but it works.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Had a horrible allergic reaction to this medicine, throat swelled shut and hives. It was truly terrifying.. Be careful.
Nitrofurantoin made my UTI worse. Did not help me at all

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had bad side effects from Macrobid. Bad enough to where I ended up in the ER. I was prescribed Macrobid for 7 days. By the 3rd day I began getting rashes all over, heart palpitations, head pressure/headaches, and vertigo that lasted over a week after stopping the medication. The ER suspected me having a blood clot in my lungs and so I had to do multiple exams. In the end, my doctor prescribed me with a different antibiotic that you take one pill and you are done. Never again will I take Macrobid, as prescribed by my doctor.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):My mom began to have a continuing cycle of UTIs in her mid-60s.  Her doctor put her on Macrodantin originally to treat the UTIs, but ultimately had her take it continuously as a preventative.  Because of dangerous known side affects with this drug she should have had a chest x-ray done every 6 months.  Her doctor kept refilling her prescriptions w/o ever doing the chest x-rays.  After several years at the age of approximately 67 she noticed that she was having problems with taking a deep breath and she could no longer yawn!  She made an appointment with her primary care doctor and he took a chest x-ray.  Unfortunately the x-ray showed massive scarring in her lungs and she was diagnosed with Macrodantin poisoning.  She  immediately stopped the Macrodantin and was put on oxygen 24 hrs/day.  A  week later she collapsed and was rushed to the hospital. Three days later she had a tracheostomy, 4 days later she was transferred to a major hospital's ICU and a week later she was dead.

I was really scared to take this because I have a huge fear of antibiotics, but I’ve read it’s much less dangerous than Cipro and doesn’t affect the gut flora as much.  I tried to do home remedies but the UTI just wasn’t letting up, so I asked the doc for the safest antibiotic. Was prescribed this twice a day for 5 days.  This is been around since the early 50’s I read.   I started feeling better right away…only experienced slight muscle pain for a day, maybe it wasn’t even from the antibiotic.  Noticed I had a little gas too.  I was super scared but had no adverse reactions aside from what I mentioned, and who knows if they were even related….don’t suffer anymore- take the meds!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):First dose: weakness, fatigue, mild nausea, headacheSecond dose: weakness, fatigue, fever, moderate nausea, chillsThird dose: EXTREME nausea, vomiting, fever, weakness, chills and hot flashes, chest pain, diarrhea, literally felt like i was going to die! Finally realized it was the medicine after the third dose, more intense side effects immediately stopped when I didn’t take the next dose but it took me three days to recover from the loss of fluids and feeling weak. My doctor switched me to a different med and felt literally no side effects. Will never be taking this ever again no matter how many UTI’s I get in the future.

I was prescribed nitrofurantoin after I had taken trimethoprim for 7 days without any improvement .  After 1 day of nitro I felt much better and symptoms improved . I have taken it with food and had no problem.    So far I have nothing bad to report about this drug , it has been a great relief to me as trimethoprim did nothing for me snd I felt awful while taking that

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this years back and didn't like how it made me feel. But thought I would try it again as I did have a cold last time. Omg the pain is from my fingertips to toes, my problem areas eg my back ,hip, shoulder feel like I've been in a crash, I can hardly move. Sickness and can't eat much. I'm bloated and my headache is blinding,  That is after 3 days. Never again. But what works for one doesn't for another. I'm the other, never again.

OMG seriously I read this after the Dr switched me to nitrofurantoin !!!  I had a terrible reaction to amoxicillin, surprisingly! After reading the reviews I was more afraid of the side effects then the amoxicillin! OK, sooo I had zero problems on this antibiotic after reading the terrible reviews and it finally cleared my UTI ! So moral of my story, probably only for myself is each person reacts differently

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I did fine for the first two doses, and had relief with the UTI right away, but by the second day and the third dose I started having unexplainable anxiety. So I have asked my prescriber to change my antibiotic. I tend to get anxiety with certain medicines so this isn’t very surprising for me.

I've taken this med twice in the past for UTI. It was very effective and I had no side effects. However, I took it last week for the first time since starting anastrozole (estrogen blocker for breast cancer). After my 3rd dose, I developed a severely irregular heartbeat. I continued taking it because I didn't realize it was the cause. The irregular heartbeat lasted for 36 hours. Within 12 hours of stopping the medication, the irregular heartbeat went away. No one believed me because that's not a "known" side effects, but it was way too coincidental for the meds to be unrelated.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Doctor prescribed this drug never again will I take a pill without reading reviews. I suffer from COPD I took this pill for 4 days. Slowly my breathing got worse didn’t think it could be pill suddenly I felt dizzy so laid  down for a while. I had chills fever a headache like nothing I’d experienced but worst of all I was struggling to breathe. I needed to go hospital but was frightened because of COVID. Drank loads of water through night thinking I was going to die it was so bad. Next morning better able to breathe my oxygen level getting higher. It took 48 hours before I got back to my old self. Just be aware of this drug

I was prescribed this medicine from Urgent Care due to me having a UTI. The first 2 days of taking the I notice my heart beat had change and on the 3rd day of taking this medicine I was in so much pain I couldn't even roll over in my bed. My back, joints and muscles hurt so badly. I discontinued the medication and as the days went on I notice my airway closing up, my chest became really tight, My heart rate was elevated and my blood pressure was high. I went to the ER was given treatment. The doctor himself that was treating me told me he had a really bad allergic reaction from this and I'm still dealing with blood pressure issues from this medicine.  I would advise anyone not to take this poison because it can ruin your life.

DO NOT TAKE! After only 2 days of taking it, I feel like I was hit by train: dizziness, headaches, stomach aches, heart palpitations (90/min sitting down!) and fever, but the WORST is that I’ve developed neuropathy: numbness and tingling in hands and feet, burning, pain. I’m praying that it isn’t a permanent damage since I’ve stopped immediately and that the nerves will recover, I’m scared of this poison!

Well, I took this antibiotic for a UTI 1-2 hours After taking this, my body broke out in red hot severely swollen raised hives, my entire body was itching like crazy. I ended up having to go to the hospital to be put on an IV of fluids, a steroid, and a shot of Benadryl. This has literally never happened to me before with antibiotics. NEVER AGAIN!

Took for a UTI, eliminated the infection. Weeks later, started having SEVERE diarrhea with no known cause. After all tests came back normal (no parasites, bacteria, viral infection, etc.) - ended up having to have a colonoscopy performed to further investigate the issue.  Nothing. Result was general Dysbiosis. Had to reset the gut bacteria levels (xifaxan 14 days then visbiome for 30 days).  I have now lost more than 20% of my starting body weight and had to take a month off of work from the stress / distress / havoc this drug has caused. At the same time as the digestive issues started, so did tinnitus -  I’m certain it is a result of this debacle as well. Brain MRI results pending. I highly suggest to stay away from this drug.

I was prescribed Macrobid for a urinary tract infection. Two doses twelve hours apart for five days. Easy dosing, easy to remember to take. I caught my UTI symptoms very early, and started the antibiotic. Within 24 hours, I felt 100%! I had zero side effects. I am in my mid fifties, and almost all prescriptions cause side effects now, where as before I never really had any of them. I am surprised that at the end of day four of taking it, I have had none!

My experience with Nitrofurantoin has been nothing short of a miracle. I did read up on this medication before taking it. I have to admit I was a little leary of how I would react. I was diagnosed with a UTI, and had strong ammonia smelling urine, but no symptoms of a UTI. So I didn’t think I had one. Blood work showed a UTI from e-coli. It comes from poop, is what my doctor said. I thought I was wiping right, but must not have been. Anyway, the first dose took the smell of ammonia away. I am very happy with this antibiotic. Hopefully this will help others,  considering taking this medication. I have felt a little tired, but that’s all.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Was prescribed this for a UTI - read the reviews here and became absolutely terrified to take it, to the point where I refused for awhile. UTI got worse and eventually I got over it, took it and... Had no side effects at all and my UTI has gotten better. PLEASE, take the negative reviews with a grain of salt and try the medicine. I took it with a small bit of food morning and night and it was perfectly fine. Will definitely use again as needed.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Well I must say this antibiotic has been effective in treating my UTI. After two doses my symptoms were gone. That being said the side effects have been rough. I’ve experienced headaches, fatigue, slight fever and chills and gastric distress. I actually feel worse than I did with just the UTI but suppose it is worth not  getting a full blown kidney infection and all that goes with that. I’ve taken Tylenol and rested. Rested a lot!  Luckily it’s only a five day course and hopefully I’ll get my energy back.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I don't usually comment on Internet threads but I have to say, if you have been prescribed this drug, see if it works for you before being scared away. There are reviews saying to avoid at all costs and reviews claiming zero side effects. All well and good but the only way to know which way it will work for you is to try it. I was prescribed it this week and have taken two pills so far. I won't be taking the rest. I've spent the night feeling nauseous and have woken up this morning with stomach cramps, a bad headache, weak arms, hot flushes and fatigue. I feel weepy and sick and I just want to go back to bed...which is kind of impossible because I have an 18 month old. Incidentally, her night was disturbed (we're still breastfeeding) and I can only assume it's something to do with the antibiotic because the crying and screaming was very out of character her. I'd say try the drug and if you get side effects, jack it in and ask for something else. I won't take this again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Don't take it. I see comments below recommending it because they were also afraid - but I say don't. I've had UTI's often growing up from being in the pool long periods of time. There are other medications that help. I had side effects which are the worst abdominal pains, nauseousness, headaches, blurred vision - basically everything that the negative comments are stating below - but the worst part was the back and abdominal pain. It felt like a skin burn, someone squeezing your organs and somehow pinching them at the same time. I took 2 days off work literally bed ridden, messaged my doctor and she advised I go to the hospital. I hate hospitals bc I'm afraid they'll run up a bill with tests just to tell me to stop the medication. So I tried that and didn't take another dose after the 2nd dose on the 3rd day, it wasn't until 20-24hrs after that I felt like myself. I decided to try another dose and within the hr I felt all the symptoms again. I messaged my doctor all of this and she was able to prescribe me something else.
Ineffectual - no difference, although some in pain reduction when urinating.  Still bladder empties when I sit up.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This pill sucks but it sucks less than a UTI! My side effects: nausea and total fatigue, stuck in bed, no energy, a bit depressed. It is definitely the macrobid because I wake up feeling fine and then take the pill with yogurt/breakfast and then I feel horrible. But when I have a UTI I am stuck on the toilet which is much worse than being stuck in bed. The only thing annoying to me is that after the UTI goes away I'm still slightly sick from the macrobid for days.

I have suffered with UTI's before and since the menopause.  In the past Trimethoprim was prescribed and knocked it on the head straight away.  However, this has been withdrawn from prescription and only Macrobid is prescribed.  Not one time has that ever worked for me for whatever unknown reason but the doctors won't listen.  Two months ago I had a UTI and - yet again - I could only get Macrobid.  3 days later with no remission in symptoms and the infection had spread to my kidneys.  I have never felt so ill in my life!  The Doctor then put me on a strong antibiotic for 7 days - 4 a day.  Maybe my body for some reason is resistant to whatever is in Macrobid but why take away the alternative that works and stop the infection before it gets more serious!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I didn’t read the negative comments because I knew they would make me anxious. I just started taking the pills & hoped for the best. I had absolutely NO side affects at all. I know there are a lot of bad reviews but you have to keep in mind that most people only log bad experiences, not good. Because I have pharmacophobia, I wanted to come back & ease your mind. This pill is very well tolerated & you don’t need to fear. Take it. It will make you feel better. You don’t have to be afraid.

I had a bad UTI many years ago and was given the stuff that turns your pee orange for pain and a sulpha antibiotic. All good. So I assumed this script was the same deal. I guess this is a synthetic drug out since 2016..I did not know that nor did the doc or pharmacy tell me. I have no allergies and never had to stop a drug due to side effects.Well after 4 doses in 2 days I thought I must be dying. As I have had the 2 worst nights of my life and a headache so bad I can barely see. Full on body convulsions...muscles tensing and releasing that I've never felt before. Nausea . Unable to keep anything down..not even yogurt. Going from feeling like I have ice in my veins to feeling like my skin on fire every other hour. Finally a few hours ago I lay there shaking and rocking...crying !. What the heck is this stuff. I was given 14 pills. I've taken only 4 and I'm done.. it's been 12 hours since my last dose and my body is finally relaxed enough for me to read

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):My experience with Macrobid was not a very good experience. On taking it first for 2 days of 7 day course it seemed to be working , on the third day I experienced chills and fever, feeling sick also and having no appetite. Persevered with the antibiotic and then had to go to A & E as I noticed a rise in temperature, shivering and feeling very unwell. Not to be recommended at all1/10

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid saved me from my first UTI. I got a terrible one (my first one ever)… blood in urine, bladder spasms, swelling, frequency, abdominal pain, and burning. Went to an urgent care and got prescribed 2x a day for 7 days. The only side effect I felt was slight nausea after taking the pill but then it went away maybe after 2 or 3 days after the course. I remember after just one day of the medication I felt way better. I’m writing this because there’s so many scary reviews on here and I get really bad medication anxiety I want others to feel more at ease!

Omg, I can't attest to effectiveness. I had a UTI, and was prescribed this after I was told this would be more effective. My stomach cramped up so bad the first night, very dehydrated. I'm pretty sure I have jaundice.I felt nausea like I had flu bug.I discontinued on day 3. Had enough. I know that having a UTI was a excruciating experience but feeling like I'm being poisoned by nitrofurantoin isn't better...I just want to comment my experience. I didn't finish treatment.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have a UTI and the   Dr Prescribes macrobid I am freaking out never took this medicine before reading about side effects and reviews really scary stuff I am on my 4th dosage I notice on 3rd dosage (eating before med and drinking a bottle of water) after 15 minutes I feel brain fog extreme weakness and fatigue blurry vision in my body heaviness in my chest that I have to lay down head and headaches I monitor my blood pressure and it drops a little but does go away after about an hour and a half after I take the medicine but it takes a lot of water before it does but I was told by the Dr. to complete the medication. I am wondering if this is safe to complete? Should I stop? What do all of these symptoms mean? What is it doing to my insides that create these symptoms will this be harmful dosage? it has helped my UTI but I am afraid I am hyper sensitive to medications I think I am more concerned with getting sepsis if I don't complete it so I will continue the treatment and pray through it

Horrible , after first pill I felt a little off. I made sure I ate first and that didn’t help. I took it around 12pm by 5 pm I felt like a zombie, dry mouth and eyes & pins and needles through my whole body. Now it’s 10:19pm I have the worst headache of my life !!! Have to wake up at 6am for work and I’m already calling my coworkers to see if anyone can cover for me cuz I know I can’t make it. Won’t recommend nobody take this

My go-to antibiotic for uti’s. Always provides relief within hours, which is desperately needed when a UTI starts. Makes urine look radioactive during the treatment. States this clearly on leaflet. No side effects for me.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m on these tablets at moment, and they been causing me to be sick, chest pain, diarrhea and also acid, I have no idea why these tablets are on the market I was feeling so much better yesterday until I had to have one!…

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Content warning: Vomit.I'm an 18 year old male. I've been taking Macrobid for a few days now. I feel nauseas at random times and extremely nauseas when I think of eating. I just threw up after buying myself breakfast. Didn't even eat it I was just getting ready to. This has happened a lot over the past few days and I would run to the bathroom every time I thought of eating. I get a random tingling feeling in my feet and around my body and feel very warm when indoors. I feel like throwing up right now. However, I don't have a UTI anymore so at least there's that.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Taking this medicine was the worst experience i’ve ever had in my life! I took one pill around 3:00 and had consistent stomach pain for hours I thought I was dying honestly, I raced home from work and had my mom take me to the hospital where they told me I was having an allergic reaction to macrobid and it was making my kidneys swell up. I do not recommend taking this medicine and I’ve read many other horrible reviews on this medicine I don’t even know why they’re still giving it to people…

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After some of the reviews I had to respond! Great relief after less then 48 hours on this medication. Only side effect I had was a slight faint headache that went away after taking Tylenol( which happened with in first 24 hours on medication). No more burning pain and less frequency of urinating within 24 hours. Which I wish I didn’t wait as long as I did to get treatment. I was prescribed 100mg twice a day and I have learned when they say take medication with meals you should( even if it’s toast).

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):In my experience, this is a super effective drug that needs to be taken with care. I was prescribed 100mg twice a day, and it zapped my stubborn UTI in a day and a half. The label should say Take With LOTS of Food! I didn't eat enough during the first day, and experienced the dizziness, fatigue and nausea that so many here are reporting. I've never felt anything like that - I was basically incapacitated.After that, I made sure that my breakfast and dinner were larger than normal, and that I took the pill halfway through my meal. I didn't experience any side effects at all after making that change.Please keep this mind as you read these horror story reviews!

So I was planning on writing this great review to help ease the minds of anxious people because i felt pretty normal the first 2 days besides lack of appetite and mild nausea off and on.. but on the 3rd day I felt sooo awful! The dizziness and nausea were unbearable. I felt like I had some kind of flu. I’ve been in bed this whole time. I have a phobia of throwing up so I’ll do anything in my power not to, and I didn’t. My doctor prescribed 100mg 2x/day for 5 days, but after telling him how I felt, he said it was fine to stop at 3 days if my symptoms were gone, and if the infection comes back he’ll prescribe something else. After reading so many horrible experiences, I will never go in this medication again. It seems too risky.

I am in day 7 of a 10 day course taking it twice a day.  From day 1 I didn't feel right.  It did clear the UTI however I have felt horrible since day 1.  I have the worst headaches and nausea.  Yes I take after a full meal.  I also have migraines so I thought I would take my migraine meds.  That didn't help at all.  Went to bed with a ice pack every night and when I took a nap.  Within 5 min the headache was back.  I have no appetite, and light hurts my eyes.  I was prescribed this after I got a UTI from a catheter from surgery.  I have decided not to finish the rest of the meds.  I am miserable.  I also have shortness of breath after I take it for about 3 hours.  I thought it was my asthma, but my inhalers didn't work.  At least it treated the UTI, but will make sure this goes on my allergy list.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Before I say this, I believe it will depend on how your body deals with the pill. It may or may not be bad for you. I was prescribed Bactrim at first for three days, but right before my last dose, I got a call from the doctor letting me know I need the macrobid. HORRIBLE five days. I don’t usually have side effects-at least nothing too bad, but these made me feel weak, and nauseated. I had to work to catch my breath. My chest seemed heavier. I must’ve been experiencing a panic attack, but it was awful. I never want to have to take these again.
the first time was great but the second time the infection came back. after days

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Worked great for me. No side effects except increased urination. I always eat with it and drink lots of water. I felt so much better after 48 hours of taking it. I also was prescribed macrodantin as a teen because I have urethral kinking and had a lot of issues and never had problems with that so I was hopeful this wouldn’t affect me either. Super thankful for this medication since I rarely get uti’s anymore but when I do they are extremely painful. I don’t why some people react so bad to this med but I think it’s a miracle

I only took one pill. It gave an allergic reactionBurning, itching horrible, shortness of breath too. I stopped taking it. I've been with this horrible allergy for 2 days. Taking Benadryl as often as I am allowed to.
This is so much better than taking Keflex! Keflex takes 7 days to start! Macrobid (nitrofurantoin) takes 2 days to start.

Just like you all, I read all the reviews before taking this med and was pretty nervous. I am prone to getting UTI’s frequently and this one was pretty bad. In the past my Dr always gave me ciprofloxacin and it worked like a gem but he said they’re transitioning to nitro because an issue with the other. This medication worked great. The UTI burning went away in a day and half and I just finished out the 5 days. The only side effects I had were dark yellow urine (even when I was hydrated) and a bit of constipation for the first 2 days and that went away after the course. Again, this worked great for me. Please try it.

Literally stopped taking this med this morning, started off with just cloudy urine and low pain after taking this needed an ambulance as my body would not move and I could not get any words out very terrifying and a weird reaction to this med… still in a lot of pain and now have blood in urine too :/ put on trimethoprim as of today really hoping that works

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Bad !!! Side effects, migraine after each capsule started 3 to 4 hours of taking it, 8 blocked vessels in eye!!!, bad headaches, mood swing, spaced out, weakness, don't take !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):DO NOT TAKE THIS!!!  DO NOT TAKE THIS!!! After the second pill - I had diarrhea that would not stop and eventually turned into burning watery stool. Severe stomach cramps, fever, chills, nausea, dizziness. I stopped taking the macrobid after 3 pills but my diarrhea did not stop. I could not eat or drink anything without going to the toilet. I fainted for the first time ever while trying to get back to my bed. I went to the ER for dehydration and the dr prescribed Zofran. Macrobid is now on my allergy list.

I had a UTI and was prescribed this medication. I took my first pill with food and within 15 mins started feeling sick. My stomach felt weird. I got up and went to Target. I felt OK driving but as soon as I got out of the car I felt sick to stomach. My stomach hurt A LOT! I couldn’t even walk. I went home and stayed in bed the rest of the day.  The stomach pain was awful and it lasted for over a day. I only took one pill and never again. This is now listed in my medical record as a drug not to be given to me. I’m sure this medication is safe but some of us are just more sensitive to it. If you take it and feel fine then that’s great. But if you start to feel severely sick then stop taking it and call your doctor.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Worst antibiotics I’ve ever taken. Don’t get me wrong they cleared my infection but I had a lot of the side effects and I’m only 30. I very rarely get ill and I had severe headaches on them, sickness and dizzy spells, my head felt like it kept heating up and my wee changed colour. The headaches and sickness were constant. However I think the infection has gone. I’ve had much kinder antibiotics In the past.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed 100 mg of this medication Macrobid for UTI and each time I take it, I feel worse off. I am either experiencing a fever or chills and I am extremely nauseous for hours on end with a loss of appetite. I am also having symptoms of indigestion and constant diarrhea. This is an awful medication and in the wrong hands, practitioners may be prescribing this to the wrong type of patient. I have 1 more day left to take this and I don't think I can. It debilitates me.

Went to clinic start of UTI, no pain or fever yet just frequent urgency to relieve myself.  Prescribed nitrofurantion  100mg.  Took first on Wednesday night.  Developed high fever, 103.5 headache dizzy, shaking, chills could barely walk.  Spent two days ill and it hit me I am allergic .  Called clinic I went in, another UTI test. After 3 days on nitro my UTI had progressed was taking aspirin every 4 hours to keep fever down. Could barely stand and was not able to drive since first dose. Clinic sent me to emergency room for blood tests.  I had a  simple UTI.  They changed my med to sulfamethoxaz tablet after I begged not to finish the nitro.  Immediately I returned to no fever,  felt fine.  3000 worth of emergency.room..  all due to nitrofurion.
username: Do not take if allergic  penic

review: I have reoccurring bacterial UTI's and have taken many antibiotics and have suffered side effects from cipro and Bactrim. I was very concerned about taking this medication after reading about all the liver and pulmonary side effects. I had no choice but to take this since the augmentin wasn't working but I AM SO HAPPY I DID. I have zero side effects other than some very slight nausea. I felt relief after the first pill, I'm on day 4 now and I feel so much better. Seriously a miracle drug.Please don't be afraid to take this medicine, if you have a confirmed UTI, this will knock it out!

You absolutely need to make sure you eat something at least a half hour before taking this medication.  I learned the hard way but by day 3 after making sure I ate I’m feeling much better and no side effects.  I had very bad UTI that I ended up in ER with and this is what dr prescribed after many tests.  I have 3 days left and will continue taking until done.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This drug has made me so ill. I took the first dose and began to shake and shiver with  terrible flu like symptoms and throbbing headache. I didn't sleep all night and could barely get out of bed to go to the loo. I took another one in the morning and was violently sick and collapsed. Absolutely terrible reaction. Phoned 111 and stopped taking them. Still in bed the following day. Absolutely horrible. Avoid at all costs.

Only felt relief on day 2 and 3. Last day, 7, was scary same as another reviewer. Felt a little tingly at work and left early. Driving home my calves and feet and elbows to hands got so tingly and tight, felt it in my face a little bit too. It got so bad that when I let go of the steering wheel to wiggle my fingers they seized up and I could not unclench them. I had to pull over and pry open my fingers and call my husband and and ambulance with my phone on the ground holding a finger out against my leg, I could not hold the phone. Was about 45 minutes til my hands would open and then my fingers would shake when extended. I was not dehydrated as I was drinking tons of water for the uti. Left the hospital 5 hours later at least knowing it wasn't a stroke. I have never experienced this kind of tingling with tightness and clenching. It was worse than when your arm falls asleep.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took 1 pill and I’m so sick I have a UTI  I’m  not taking anymore

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):The side effects I have experienced, as follows:- Stomach pain- Nausea- Vomiting - Tiredness- Overall ill feeling- Some diarrhea In conclusion this is the worst antibiotic I have ever experienced and I am still recovering after 48 hours of not taking. 1 in 100 people will suffer horrible side effects.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I could not finish this medication it made me so nauseous and nothing would help.  I could not work or take care of my kid while taking this I was so sick.
Nausea, vomiting, fatigue, headaches. After 2 days I'm done

After one day of this medication I was sicker than I was before I took it.  Then it took 24 hours to get out of my system. I recalled the  Dr and had pharmacy to put in my records never to give this to me again.  This was the worse experience of my life. I had vomiting diarrhea and was unable to keep food down unable to even sleep and  terrible taste in my mouth

I just got prescribed this medication to me I didn’t even know I had a UTI but apparently I do without any testing. I thought I did so they just prescribed me this medication second time taking it and I feel nauseous that’s the only thing I’m experiencing is nauseous but I don’t wanna throw it up or anything reading these comments make me a little nervous about this drug

Two days after taking this medicine I could not get out of bed I started having bad cramps, coughing, ear infection. Now two week I lost my smell & taste running fever chills. I had a COVID test which is negative.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took this medicine for 4 days for UTI and didn't work for me, but everyone is different I hope it works out for you

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I did not even know I had a UTI. No symptoms or pain. Ten days after having labs done. DR.'S office calls and tells me I have a UTI. Go to pharmacy and pick up antibiotics. I am 66 and healthy. Never had a UTI in my life. Never do I get sick except for occasional flare ups of IBS. I am on this med and I look 6 months pregnant. I started to think maybe I had stomach cancer. I am so happy to find these reviews.  I am not happy that I was feeling just fine and these pills took me out for 5 days. Will see Doc in 2 days hopefully it was worth the misery. Because I really don't know if I had a UTI.

I would definitely listen to the reviews. I have never once had a reaction to medication like this. The morning of day three is when I had to pull over my car because I thought I was having a stroke and my friend rushed me to the ER. The day before I had weird arm cramps, abdominal cramps and headache but thought it was due to a possible UTI - then while driving my head felt extreme pressure, my vision blurred, my jaw started chattering, both my arms had numbness down through my hands and my speech was slurred. I am an extremely healthy and athletic 31 year old with no pre existing conditions. When I went to the ER all of my tests came back normal and they sent me home. I immediately stopped taking the medication and continued to have these random episodes over the next few days that were less extreme. A week later I am still weak and tired, my primary doctor told me it could be a week to two weeks to work it way out of my system. I’m worried it did permanent damage!

So I don't like taking drugs of any kind and really didn’t want to take this, especially after all the bad reviews. But here’s what I did. My UTI was definitely full on, but I caught it early so decided to just take 1 pill per day instead of two. The first pill made all the burning go away thank goodness. But I took it at night with minimal food. BIG mistake. I suffered headaches, nausea and fatigue all the next day. Sucked. But then I started doing this and it made all the difference: eat a full meal, take the pill  with 1,000mg of vitamin C and a glass of water, then eat some bread and drink more water. Take several vitamin C pills throughout the day too. If you have a UTI, supplement all this with d-mannose, horsetail capsules, and straight cranberry juice. Everyone is different but I got the bad symptoms until I did this, so it’s worth a go. I felt zero nausea and zero headaches today.

Oh wow. Worst experience ever. I went to the walk-in and was prescribed this for a mild UTI. I did a urine sample, my only issues were lower pelvic cramps and pressure when I would urinate (ended up not even being a UTI). I took one pill the first day and felt fine. Took the next dose in the morning and then it all hit me. Extreme dizziness, tiredness, the most intense headache, horrible lower abdomen cramps and a general feeling of out of it. By day three the cramps got so much worse, thought I had bowel cancer or appendicitis! Went back to the clinic and all of the touch tests didn’t indicate anything. I finally realized it was the Nitro so I stopped taking them and the cramps eased slightly, no more headache and dizziness after 24 hours. I still have some mild abdominal cramps and now lower back pain. My doctor said it can take up to two weeks for this medicine to work its way out of your system. Will never take this again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):On day 4...had only the headaches at first. Then just mostly weak and tired.  I haven't had a period in 3 years, but I have one today with major cramps and stomach upset.  Worst part is the burning sensation of the UTI is no better even after 4 days.  Not finishing the course.  Would not recommend!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I just had a course of Macrobid and i can honestly say I have never felt as poorly. I had a raging fever Temp 39.03 palpitations and chills. Loss of appetite and exhausted. I didn't finish the course and feel better 48hrs later. I wouldn't recommend these tablets to anyone.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve had a constant headache and nausea that is very similar to a migraine since day one of taking the macrobid. Cold sweats and dizziness comes and goes just before the evening dose is due then cycle begins again. Dose 3 resulted in severe stomach cramps comparable to food poisoning paired with non stop diarrhea. Feel like vomiting but managing to keep the broth I’ve been having down.  So far it’s been a nightmare. I’d rather have a UTI and a raging yeast infection.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is by far the worst medication I have taken and its ruined my birthday weekend. I started feeling very fatigued with stomach ache on day 1, but I didn’t think too much of it as I was also on my period so symptoms didn’t feel too out of the ordinary. By day 2 I had lost my appetite, and became so nauseous and dizzy I couldn’t get up. Day 3 I was feeling a little better until a couple hours after my morning pill when I got a twisting hunger type of pain in the top of my stomach, the kind I’d imagine you’d have after not eating all week. It was excruciating, and it was only after I ate that I realised it was no hunger pain. This made me very nauseous and weak for the whole day. Now I am day two off the course, it’s my birthday and I have a new addition of chest pain and headache on top of the other symptoms. I’m considering going to ER that is how awful this medication has made me feel. The worst part is my UTI symptoms came back on day three after ceasing on day 1.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I started taking Macrobid by the second pill major stomach pain set in.  I couldn't get up, muscle pain was unbearable. Called Dr he said he doesn't think it was pill. He said take it with heavy meal so I did one at night again then by 2nd dose stomach pain set in. I so want to cry. It also caused lower back pain. I'm done. I just need for these side effects to go away.

I love this med! But you MUST take it AFTER a meal, Then it won't mess up your stomach and don't get heavy side effects. I only get side effects (nausea) if i don't eat before. And don't forget to drink plenty of water!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I am taking Microbid for a UTI.   I usually don't take this but my doctor prescribed it this time.   I have been feeling extremely tired since the last 3 days of taking it, also have chills and diarrhea and just not feeling good.  I have never had a reaction to Bactrim or any other antibiotics before.  It has to be this medication plus my UTI is not really cleared up after 3 days of taking meds.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Upon my 1st and 2nd dose, I was lethargic. I could barely keep my eyes open. Was nausea and just all around didn't feel right. But it helped with my UTI after the first dose. On my 3rd dose now and not feeling the past symptoms....tho my tummy has been very bloated throughout taking this med. I don't know if I'd take it again, considering these side effects.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I also was extremely sick taking this medication. Ironically it happened twice - the first time I was able to stomach the whole dose but recently I had to stop after the second pill and switch to bactrim, and then had zero issues. Macrobid left me fatigued, headaches, dizzy, aches, pounding heart, and I even threw up. Felt like the start of the flu but worse! Will never take again

Horrible HORRIBLE experience. I was first put on Pivmecillinam, but turned out to be allergic. So now I´m taking Nitrofurantoin 75mg twice daily for a course of 5 days. On the evening after taking the first dose I started to experience pins & needles all over my body. Even in the under eye area! Stupidly, I thought it must be a coincidence, but the feeling would become more and more intense, and now involves a lot of pain as well. So far, I had 4 doses, it's getting worse and I'm super anxious. I did consult a doctor, I was told to continue taking as prescribed, but will most likely stop.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):BEWARE: I’m glad that some of you had a good experience with Macrobid.  It does seem to be really good for a stubborn UTI.  My UTI is better after 3 doses, HOWEVER;After dose 2 (with food) my hands & feet swelled and began to have significant joint pain.  Then came leg pain, bad back pain (kidneys?) and a headache in the back of my head.Became SOOO tired and weak.After dose 3; crazy, out of control chills, increased weakness & hours of inability to take a good breath.  All night long I had terrible trouble breathing, could barely walk to the bathroom.  Was in bed for 18 hours. Got up for 5 hours feeling only slightly better and went back to bed for 12 hours.  Now day 3 since first dose & I can’t do anything.  Breathing is better but now diarrhea has set in.Just beware of the beginning of symptoms so you can be prepared to stop taking it.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Terrible experience with this med, I had side effects of exhaustion to the point of being unable to move and major stomach upset. Had to switch to bactrim. It might be fine for some people but I had an awful experience. Didn’t even help my UTI either.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Terrible experience with Macrobid. Severe fatigue and nausea and it didn't even help the UTI. Switching to a different medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Within 2 hours of taking Macrobid  I had side effects of  vomiting, passing out, shaking with cold, sweating , retching for 15 hours horrific side effect and still 24 hrs later still feeling rough weak sickly

The side effects which for me were paralysing nausea and depression.It basically prevented me from being able to tolerate fluids or food, fluids being essential if you have a nasty UTI (urinary tract infection). On a short course of three days it was ineffective long term as the symptoms came back. Was prescribed it again and against my better judgment took this antibiotic for another 24 hrs before feeling so bad, had to stop. IT really does make you feel very sick and nauseous.I have asked for this to be removed from future treatment options on my notes, a toxic antibiotic I would not wish on an enemy.

nitrofurantoin did not work for my UTI, it was too weak. I'm on my second week of UTI nightmare, currently on Keflex. Would definitely advice to not repeat my mistake and go for an urine culture before taking an antibiotic

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Let me guess...you have a UTI and you’re researching the med the doctor prescribed. You’re slowly starting to panic because all the reviews are telling you not to take this poison. I was in the same spot. All I can say is: take the med. I took each pill with food. First dose after McDonalds because I was a nervous nelly and if I was going to take this awful pill it was going to be with a treat. Second dose was after I ate a McFlurry I had saved. I also took it various times with a bagel, spaghetti and Taco Bell. Before you judge me, it’s the weekend so I did in fact have McDonalds and Taco Bell. After the first pill I had a headache. I had some gas-type discomfort and a little bit of bloating but that’s really it. Within 4 hours or so I was feeling relief and no longer breathing fire out of my urethra. I promise it’s worth it to take away a hideous UTI. Don’t be scared by these reviews please! You will be okay. And take it with a McFlurry.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had terrible UTI symptoms, to the point where I was almost in tears. As soon as I took one dose of Macrobid, within minutes I got relief. I took the second dose of the day soon after and soon after my symptoms were relieved. By the next day, symptoms were nearly gone.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):The reviews of this antibiotic scared me so much and the crazy part is, I’VE TAKEN IT MULTIPLE TIMES BEFORE! DO NOT LET REVIEWS SCARE YOU, EVERYONE IS DIFFERENT. I personally had hardly any side effects when I took this two times a day for a week. I had a headache here and there, but I suffer from frequent migraines/headaches anyway. After the first dose, I had some stomach pains and night sweats, but that may of just been my anxiety taking over. Unfortunately, it did not fix my issue, but I am not even sure if I truly had an UTI, just a suspected one (I get them enough that I would assume it was one.) Normally, it does help so I think my issue goes beyond a UTI. JUST TAKE IT WITH A MEAL AND WATER, you will be fine.

I was prescribed this for a UTI. I have taken it before but I can only take 50 mg as 100mg is too much for me. By day 2 my head was pounding and had pain in the liver area, stomach bloated and feeling of a full rectum. Very very uncomfortable. My eyesight was blurred too and very sleepy. I only took 4 tablets and stopped I felt so ill but not sure if the UTI is fully cleared up so very reluctantly I have just taken another one. Wished I had seen these reviews earlier as I don’t think I would have taken it today! Won’t be taking anymore. I know this didn’t happen before when I took it. Oh well will have to see what happens.

I was prescribed Nitrofurantoin for 5 days at 2 pills per day. I went in for a UTI and I am on my second day now. The symptoms of the UTI are almost completely gone but the side effects are really annoying. I am barely able to stay away right now and i have a headache and feels like everything is spinning. also felt very weak and lightheaded.

I am one the people who've had little to no side effect from Nitrofurantoin for a urinary tract infection. The first day which was 2 pills at 100 mg gave me the chills and a slight headache, the next 2 pills gave me the slight chills and a headache. I took 2 tylenol and I was fine, the minor side effect did not deter me from continuing the full 7 day regiment administered. Everyone's body reacts differently to medicine. I did not want to take the chance of developing a kidney infection because I stopped taking the ordered dose by my doctor.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This Macrobid is a great antibiotic in my opinion, I had a horrible UTI with all the typical symptoms for 2 days. I took AZO, OTC pain meds, nothing would touch it. I was prescribed Macrobid and within 4-6 hours most of my UTI symptoms were almost completely gone. The side effect of mild nausea that I found went away if taken with a meal. Do not let these reviews scare you. The relief this antibiotic gave me, I would take it again with no hesitation.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):So this is my 3rd time on these tablets this year first two times was for a UTI this time for a kidney infection. The first two times no side effects at all. This time I’m on day 4 of taking these and I feel dreadful dry mouth stomach ache/cramps/pain diarrhoea and this morning I woke up and felt like I had flu, with  fever, chills and severe aches and pains from the stomach down. I’m going to have to continue taking them due to having a kidney infection I did ring my doctors but they refused to change my antibiotics. This is just my experience everyone is different but I definitely wouldn’t take these again and I can normally take any tablets and have no side effects.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After finished taking macrobid I now have dark urine. Should I be worried?I also drank coffee today.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):No one should be taking this drug.  I was prescribed this for kidney infection when I have chronic kidney disease on 22/4/21? I will be alerting doctor who prescribed this that they nearly killed me.  Was prescribed dosage of 100 mg 4 times a day, for 7 days.  Took it till 27/4/21.   Made me feel like I was dying with extreme chills and fever, excruciating back pain, whole body aching, diarrhoea, abdominal aching, gave me asthma and filled my chest with fluid,  was very weepy, extreme anxiety, difficulty walking - felt like walking through cement, dizzyness, retained fluid and dropped my kidney function significantly.   Was too sick to realise it was the tablets until last day, stopped them and went to another doctor 28/4/21, who wanted me to go to hospital to go on IV etc.    Stopped taking the tablets, started a different antibiotic yesterday 28/4/21 and have started to feel better already.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid is an amazing antibiotic IF your UTI responds to it. I think majority of negative reviews here are of people who were allergic to Macrobid, those with extremely rare side effect or those that had bacteria Macrobid wouldn't work on and thus causing the UTI to get worse/kidney infection. I was terrified to start my 2x day 5 day course of this antibiotic because I am allergic to Cipro and very sensitive towards antibiotics. The ONLY side effects I had were nausea and heartburn from my first pill BECAUSE I didn't eat enough with the pill. I didn't even had dark urine or orange urine. But here are my tips... Eat a lot with the pill, like pasta/bread/cheese and drink a tonne of water. I drank 4L Per day while taking this. I also took a probiotic which helped with the heartburn. My symptoms stopped after 2 days...the pain and urgency to pee. I finished this course 2 weeks ago and it worked amazing. I would take again if need be. A+

Suspected UTI but not confirmed. None of the following symptoms I had before taking these awful meds: Shallow breathing, nausea, shooting pains in throat and neck, major spine pain, body tremors, pains in my armpits, brought up blood from my throat for months, peeling skin on my neck, pains in my rib cage. My whole body was in major distress and discomfort. All I had when I went to the doctor was a bit of nausea and a bloated tummy.5 months on, I still have terrible spine and back pains. I have intermittent shooting pains in my throat and neck and I armpits. It seems I can no longer engage in any light exercise or even a gentle stroll will bring on the symptoms, so I am being tested now to see what on earth has happened to me. I suspect this drug has started an autoimmune disorder or possibly has left me with some long term damage. Who knows. I just wish I had waited to see how I felt before calling the doctor.This drug is too dangerous to play Russian roulette with. Take it off the marker now! Please!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I am taking this now for a UTI! I saw how bad the reviews are and honestly I have little to no symptoms while taking it. The only symptom I have been getting is a headache but to get rid of my UTI it’s worth it.

I was prescribed nitrofurantoin for my UTI, while on them I felt incredibly nauseous and had severe headaches. When I'd finished my 7 day prescription (x2 tablets a day) I didn't feel well at all overnight, the next day I had to call 111 and had the ambulance come and check on me as I was having cold sweats, high temp, high BP etc. All they did was suppress my infection, but not fight it. I definitely wouldn't take again, as it didn't do what it was supposed to, but also made me feel horrible while I was taking them.A big thumbs down from me
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Very scary bad reactions. Heart rate jumped, fever and chills,Then nausea and throwing up many times. Shortness ofBreath- reallyScary.
Has worked as stated for me with no side effects. Turns my pee a weird color but I don't care. It gets rid of my UTI.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):My daughter in law took this medication the beginning of January and got sick, so sick she was admitted to the hospital. They took all kinds of tests, sent her home not able to figure out what as causing her symptoms. Within a week she was turning yellow with jaundice and so so much sicker my son took her back to the hospital by that night she was air lifted to a hospital three hours away. Her liver completely shut down, she was lucky to have received a new liver within the week, total transplant. So at 35 with a one year old at that she still can’t even pick up yet, she has suffered greatly. Her transplant doctors told her they believed it was this drug. Check it out, way down the list of thing that can go wrong would be Liver tissue death. Now this drug may help some but I would not use it!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):For the first dose I was fine. Second dose I only woke up to take med n back to sleep. When I got up  the second time that day I realized I am having flank pain on both left and right sides of my back which went away after I urinated. Then I was having a debilitating sharp pains under my rib cage(liver)  which was horrible. I couldn’t do anything most of the day besides try to hold the tears back. Then the headaches started and the feeling  of being out of it .  I decided to take  800mg of Motrin I ate still, my pain was  about a 5/10, I had NO sleep. That night for some dumb reason I took my 3 dose this is the second time  I am  having sharp pains in my liver. I have consumed insane amounts of water to try and flush my system but its not working so hopefully my UTI will not come back because my doctor is insisting on not prescribing me anymore antibiotics

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed Macrobid 2x a day for 5 days after a terrible allergic reaction to Bactrim (anxiety, heart palpitations, chills, 103 fever, full body rash). I had no side effects from Macrobid other than head fog which disappeared 2 days after I was done with the pills. I took each pill with a meal and glass of milk and had no nausea. 100% recommend for a UTI that’s easier on the body than Bactrim.

Diagnosed with UTI and was prescribed Nitrofurantonin. Read reviews on multiple sites, and was freaked out by the overwhelming negativity and various horror stories. I was initially hesitant to take the drug because of this, however, I’ve begun taking it and so far it has had little to no adverse effects, apart from a possibly unrelated headache (which cleared up right away with ibuprofen). And even 4 hours into treatment, some of my symptoms were lessening. Take with food and water, and all should be well. Don’t listen to these reviews meant to scare you. The doctor knows what they’re doing, and the proper medicine will almost always work. Stay safe :)

I was prescribed 100mg twice a day for 7 days for a UTI, my first one at 59. The onset of the UTI was my symptoms became rapidly very painful for me, and I was hurrying to get my first dose of Nitrofurantoin. I felt relief after 2 hours, and after 6 hours all those horrible symptoms were gone, could this really be?  Now I have to finish the 7 day course, I am on my 3rd day. I have had not any major side effects so far, I am taking it with at least two cups of water (with or without food, and no food is not an issue for me), but 2 hours after that I will eat something small, at least a yoghurt with live cultures. If I don't eat, I will get nauseous, which happened me on my first day.

Currently on my 3rd day of nitrofurantoin. UTI gone but boy this is a tough antibiotic to take, or maybe my tolerance has reduced as I get older. Seem to have all the side effects and feel generally awful. Headache, dizzy, drowsy, very nauseous, bloating, dry mouth and slight breathlessness. Also burning body all over and itchy! Got given a 5 day course as it was over a weekend and doc wanted to be sure I got rid of infection. However, whether I can grit my teeth for another 2 days is very debatable. May stop after end of today ( 3rd day) ..... advice?

I started taking Macrobid 5 days ago and at first I was shaking from nerves of taking .I was so hesitant to take but did and to let y'all know it was not bad at all. I had only slight headaches. But I'm ok now. I suggest this med for anyone who has a UTI.

Took my first capsule last night for UTI, started feeling relief within 2 hours. Took another capsule this morning and just took my second daily capsule. Have had absolutely no ill effects from the drug, I take it with meals as directed. Was feeling better today but UTI symptoms have really kicked back up this evening. I've been very dehydrated lately so I think that didn't help the UTI. Have been super hydrating last 2 days, hope UTI feels better by tomorrow.  I'm told it takes 2-3 for symptom relief so I'll give it another few days. Have seen all the negative reviews on here, just wanted to post from someone who isn't having any issues with the medication. Just take with a meal, make sure you're well hydrated.

I was very scared to take this after reading the pamphlet and the reviews here so I opened up one capsule and divided the inside in half and added it to a cup of cranberry juice after having eaten a meal. I drank it slowly and tolerated it well. 12 hours later I did the same without issue. Well the next day I took the whole pill again after eating a meal and oh god that was a mistake I guess. I am so nauseous I can't deal with it. I don't want to be sick because then the medication leaves my system. I'm standing in my bathroom with my head out the window as I write this. Will tell my doc not to give me this ever again but I do as of this writing anyway plan on attempting to finish the course.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):Scary experience. I started to get very ill few hours after starting the medication, nausea, headache, vomiting and sensitive to light. 2 days later a gp told me I may have flu. I went home, went to bed. So weak, low fever, chills, could not get warm, still vomiting, horrendous headache. A few days feeling same I noticed a rash on my body.  Went to emergency department by ambulance.The antibiotic had caused acute liver failure. I had been on day 5 of a 7 day course. Lucky enough the doctor in the hospital put the connection together and medication was stopped. It took a few months to recover from the fatigue especially but I'm lucky to be alive also. Another few days at home alone I would probably have passed out. I was delirious most days so they were blurry and confusing. No more macrodantion for me. Even have an emergency bracelet if I need to travel outside Ireland.

I've taken nitrofurantoin about 3 or 4 times in the past 2 years. First time was for a very bad UTI and it made me feel better instantly after the first dose. I was only prescribed 3 days worth and the infection had not totally cleared so had to go back for some more but after that it went. The second time I had a UTI I didn't get seen to soon enough and I was feverish - they prescribed nitrofurantoin but at that point it had spread so it wasn't strong enough so was put on cipro. The latest UTI I got seen to straight away and the tablets are making me feel nauseous for about 1hr after taking my dose and generally queasy/stomach and bowel upsets. My advice is to take it with BIG meals that line your stomach to avoid the nausea. I'd recommend the drug and remember you will always see more negative press than positive!

I have been prescribed a 3 day course of MacroBID by my GP for a UTI found through a urine test.I was pre-warned of the side effects but I took the plunge and took my first pill yesterday at 7pm after a substantial meal, felt ok and slept well.  Took my second pill after breakfast this morning.  I’ve have felt more fatigued as the day has passed.  I feel dizzy and jittery and slightly breathless, almost feel like I’m hyperventilating which is causing the dizziness, I know I’m not, just feels like I am?  I have a mild headache but not bad enough to take anything for it.   I am concerned that another pill will worsen my symptoms but have decided to risk it and have just taken my 3rd pill.My UTI symptoms have improved greatly, only a slight sting/heat in my wee, no bladder pain or discomfort as yet.I’ll see how I am tomorrow but fingers crossed I’ll be ok.

Was prescribed 4x a day for 5 days. I'm on my 2nd day so far so good regarding my UTI treatment, pain when urinating is very mild to almost none at this point. Side effects: Headache, mild eyesocket pain, mild nausea. I noticed the side effects are worse when taken on an empty stomach, so please take this medicine after a meal. Also, my pee is slightly yellow greenish during this medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve had a bad reaction twice to the drug , it’s now on my records not to be given it, non stop being sick, a really pain full headache that does not respond to any pain relief. I ended up in A&E first time, then was given it again and had flu like symptoms,  and the worst bit by far again the excruciating headache. Today I feel a little better, my eyesight has gone funny, like my glasses are not working properly and it  was fine prior to taking the drug. Alarmingly these are on the side effect list !!

Was prescribed a three day course of nitrofurantoin for a UTI. I usually take trimethoprim, and knew this was different, but thought nothing of it. I took the first tablet after dinner before bed and didn’t notice any immediate issues; then I woke up the next morning feeling extremely lightheaded and shaky. I took the second tablet with breakfast and within minutes I was on the bathroom floor. Horrific vertigo, room spinning, pounding heart, so sick I was gagging over the bath. I was terrified. This acute phase took about an hour to pass, then I continued to feel rotten. It gave me bladder spasms worse than the UTI, breathlessness, body aches and extreme fatigue (just as it did many others on here). I was switched to trimethoprim for the next two days, but a day after finishing my course I still feel fatigued and breathless. I slept for 14 hours last night. Please read up before taking this medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve had my fair share of UTIs and I was put on Macrobid when I became resistant  to Bactrim. Macrobid always cleared my UTIs right up with no side effects. I won’t take any other antibiotic! This current UTI hit me like a truck and boy was I suffering. Not even AZO was working. It took around 5-6 hours after the first dose to start feeling better again. The only thing I can complain about is this time I feel nauseous and have a headache, though the headache could be from not drinking coffee. It’s annoying but honestly would rather feel this way than having the pain of a UTI. I also take D-Mannose along with it which helped a lot. For those who don’t know what D-Mannose is, I HIGHLY recommend you look into it!

I was prescribed this for an infection most likely UTI. First day taking it extremely tired like cold and super sleepy. In addition, I had a headache and nausea. Oh it didn’t stop there! I also have body pain all over like I’ve been tossed about and really vivid dreams or should I say nightmares.Would say my stomach feels better but with all these other side effects is it worth it ?

Male. No sexual freakout stuff. I got first ever UTI. I didn't know what it was, never had it. I peed during commercial of Superbowl.  I also had no alcohol but yes, a lot of sweets, Specifically chocolate.  I think that caused it.  Next day was tested. Yes. Some e coli bacteria.  Ok. I get 100mg (14 tablets). I took 2 a day and by day 3 it was gone. NO smell or burn. Took the remaining tablets on schedule. I'm ok with is. Just didn't realize a big surge of sugar would cause that.
