Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):NEVER TAKE THIS DRUG!!!After taking my second dose I developed VIOLENT vomiting, diarrhea, severe body aches, extremely high heart rate, low oxygen and shortness of breath, fever, chills and an inability to move with severe fatigue.   It’s now 42 hours after my last dose and I am better.  We are in a pandemic and having all these symptoms which sure did scared me.  I do NOT EVER recommend this drug to ANYONE!  Horrible!   I’m obviously not the only one.  I wish I had read the reviews before I took this Med!!!

No side effects, taking for e coli UTI which came back after finishing a 7 day course of suprax which didn't work. Makes pee yellowish like a highlighter. No thrush or diarrhea like other antibiotics. Will update and end of treatment I'm on day 3 and feel better but will check back in after 7 days.

I was prescribed macrobid for a UTI for 5 days. On the 4th day I stopped taking it. I just want to say I never have side effects with any prescription until this one. I am able to tolerate pretty much anything. I was in and out of the hospital for 2 days. I thought it was the end of me. I felt like my lungs were being crushed and had to go through multiple tests to find the cause. My symptoms started the same day as the pill. I am currently still recovering and its been completely stressful and disruptive. I won't be taking this medication ever again.

I went on my first dosage of this drug for a seven day trail to treat a UTI as another drug I was taking wasn't working. I had terrible nausea but was consistent. My UTIs have been a massive problem for me getting up to 2 a month. I'm currently on a 3 month prescription of this drug which is causing me significantly more trouble than the first time around. I'm two weeks in and have never felt faint in my life, never woke up dizzy or felt so sick. The first week of taking this drug was literally awful. Every morning I would wake up to the room spinning not even being able to sit up in bed. I would have to wait half an hour sometimes more before I was able to surface and get on with my day. My nausea and lost of appetite went hand in hand, with certain food items I could smell would make me want to throw up. From something like sausage cooking, to the smell of pasta would make me feel sick. Because of this I have basically been living off of buttered toast as I can't stomach anything else

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I'm in my early 20s only ever had a UTI as a baby and was prescribed macrobid over the phone without a urine test. I was given a 3 day course, twice a day. Within hours of taking the first pill I felt so much worse than originally. I felt constantly sick, had really intense abdominal stabbing type pain and was ridiculously run down and drowsy. These symptoms seemed to clear up by day 3 of taking the antibiotic but it has done nothing to help my supposed UTI. Believe this could be an error on diagnosis or too short of a treatment time but the medication itself makes you feel like absolute shite.

Started taking these for a UTI a couple of days ago and I have felt unwell ever since. Keep going hot and cold, anxious to the point of panicky, feel lightheaded and tired but the nausea is the worst symptom, similar to constant morning sickness. Aches in my legs too now. Doesn’t seem to be clearing up the infection either! I’m coming off it tomorrow!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took this medication for 5 days, twice per day with food. It made me dizzy, gave me indigestion and terrible stomach cramps. My biggest problem came about a week after finishing the course, I now have diarrhea everyday despite taking a probiotic. Doesn't seem like it is getting any better and it is very disruptive to my life. I don't think I would ever take this medication again just because of the diarrhea.

Have had UTI for 3 months. Bad, in hospital, hallucinations. I'm now on antibiotic  at 2 a day for 7 days then 1 a day for 30 more days. No side effects yet I feel so much better. Just maybe a slight headache....

I had an bad experience with this Drug macrobid...I was treated with 5 days worth of Pills and each Day I took my Dosage I never got any relief and my UTI did not go away...Also please make sure who ever your Doctor is are you go to a emergency room make sure they do a Culture test on the urine sample. That's the only way they really going to know what bacteria they have to treat you for. They just gave me a random antibiotic. So today I went back because I am still having urgency and pain and I demanded that they do a culture on my urine sample. So I have 3 days to wait for the results. Hope this turn out better for me and this UTI clears up for good...

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I thought it was the end of me.  Macrobid is one of the worst experiences I have ever had.  I could hardly walk, I was short of breath, I felt confused and weak and had bright red cheeks.I think they should be removed from sale.My friend had also had  UTI a few weeks before and told me how poorly she had felt when taking the antibiotics.  I rang her to see what they were called, and yes they were Macrobid.  How can these be allowed to be prescribed to the general public, it's shocking. I only took them for 1 day, was frightened to take any more

This medication did clear my UTI with only mild nausea and dizziness. HOWEVER I had severe mental health interactions. There are no listed interactions with the Duloxetine I am on so I didn’t think twice about taking it but after 2 doses I started to develop severe paranoia to the point I left work and hid in my living room for 3 days! It was only after I finished the course of medicine and the effects went away that I realised the connection. Wouldn’t recommend for those on Duloxetine/others with mental health concerns.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have taken 3 Macrobid pills so far for UTI. I am achy in back and neck and have a headache. I have also had chills and maybe a slight fever. UTI is feeling better already but not liking the side effects of this medication. Trying to determine if I should call doctor and ask for something else.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):On day 3 of macrobid,  no major side affects other than fatigue and muscle aches, no nausea etc, my pee no longer smells but I am going the loo more than usual since on the tablets, much better if taken with food, I felt rough on one occasion when I hadn't eaten enough, all in all I expected to get a few side affects so its not been too bad, whether it clears the infection I'm yet to know.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Had a UTI that keflex could not treat. I could tell it was getting worse. Got Macrobid, a few hours after the first pill I felt better. I did take it with food, and lots of water. The only symptom I experienced was headaches. Took all the 7 days worth of meds and it wasn't bad at all. I was super scared to take it because of the reviews but I was like ....you know what everyone's body is different and I didn't want the UTI to get worse. So if you got this medication please take with food and drink a ton of water.
Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I am on macrodantin 5 days now at still the pain is there hoping by day 7 it will be gone

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I went to the doctor for complaint of an UTI. The doctor prescribed Macrobid for 5 days worth, twice a day. It definitely worked for the UTI within 2 days but I had severe side effects...sharp abdominal pains, urine turned dark orange, no appetite, headaches, terrible nausea, left shoulder pain, back pain, tired, almost felt like my head was in the clouds. When I finished the medication, I felt worse. I felt like I wanted to cry. I felt confused, still no appetite, I didn’t feel like myself at all. Stomach cramping pains still with a distended abdomen. I literally almost felt like a walking zombie. I’m still getting abdominal cramps and swollen abdomen. I need to see my doctor. I’m never taking this medication again.

Was told to take nitrofurantoin for 7 days for a UTI. My most severe side effects occurred in the beginning but subsided as I took more medication.Pill 1 - Fatigue and severe headache after napping and slight nausea, but no more urgencyPill 2 - Moderate headache, fatigue, diarrhea; almost no pain (to me, it felt like contractions in the bladder) towards the end of peeingPill 3 - FatiguePill 4 - No symptomsPill 5 - No symptoms; back to solid bowel Pill 6 and on - No symptomsBy the last pill, I wasn't sure if the infection had entirely gone since my bladder was still "sore". I used to be able to hold my pee for hours (I know I shouldn't), but I couldn't hold anything in for about 2 weeks after finishing my meds.I'd advise anyone taking this to just be wary of the possibility of headaches/malaise and try to push through it by sleeping it off to see if it goes away. Also, you have to take it with a whole meal, not just a light snack. I found that eating more seemed to lessen the side effects.

In less than 1 day of starting this medication I could hardly walk.  The weakness and tingles in my legs were unbelievable, especially my left leg. My trunk was weak and I had difficulty sitting up. My resting heart rate was like I was running. Even my breathing was more difficult. I experienced, Profuse Diarrhea and nausea too.  Thankfully I went to my doctor right away and determined it was the medication and she stopped it immediately. I ended up in physical therapy so I could regain the ability to do simple thing like bending over and touching my toes. Before I started the medication I was in the gym 1-2 hours a day.  I paced a  10min mile for Ave of 3-5 miles or I would swim 3200meters (2miles) in an hour. Then did a total body group work out. A year later I am still not back to my baseline. Please report any adverse reactions to the CDC, this effort may help save others from an experience like mine

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was feeling lousy from my UTI and I was prescribed macrobid and I had zero side effects..!! I'm hyper sensitive to any pill I put in my body, so I was nervous at 1st. But I woke up the next morning and the UTI pains and nausea were gone! I felt and am feeling SOOOO much better!! I feel back to normal, if not better! Thank God!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed macrobid for a very painful UTI. I had taken it once before for the same reason but couldn’t remember how it made me feel. I was prescribed it twice a day for 7 days. This time it took a few days to begin working and I was thankful to have also been given an analgesic to help with the pain since this didn’t resolve that. It made me feel incredibly bloated, tired, dizzy and gave me awful stomach cramping and diarrhea. Somehow all of this was still better than the UTI though, and I am now 2 days after finishing the round of medication and feeling better. Overall, it seems to have its side effects but if you’re able to tolerate them it should be beneficial for infections.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed 50mg Macrodantin capsules to be used over the course of 7 days for treatment of a UTI. Let me tell you right now, that this medicine not only doesn't work and that I still have a UTI, after completing the course; the side effects were like nothing I had ever felt before and my infection actually progressed to a kidney infection. First off, I started to feel nauseous while taking this medicine, and thought that it would be alright after a few days. However, by day 3 I was in agony with abdominal pain, chest pain, lower back pain, fever and chills. The nausea was also still there. I decided to call my doctor and they advised that I finish my 7 day course and then call back if symptoms did not stop by day 7. By day 7, I still had a UTI, as well as chest pain, abdominal pain, headaches, nausea, dizziness, fever and chills, all of which only started to happen once I took these antibiotics.This medicine may as well be a placebo.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):Was prescribed Macrodantin for UTI.  Was extremely ill from day one with headache, pressure in left ear, muscle pain, back pain and a general illness feeling.  Was originally prescribed 5 days of 100mg twice a day.  Day 2/3 I couldn't bare it any longer and contacted Doctor to change it, he insisted I stay on it and changed it to 50mg x 4 times a day.  Gave up on day 3/4 as I couldn't take the side effects and low mood any longer.  Still not feeling great on day 7 and ear still feels full.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):DO NOT RECOMMENDED THIS DRUG. I feel like my feet are plugged into an electrical socket- the worst pain I've ever felt. Side effects mentioned tingle but I feel like I'm being electrocuted- it's THAT PAINFUL. My vision is blurred. I spent days sweating, fever and chills, I thought I had corona virus and a UTI. 1st pill delivered the most intense headache on earth - needed pain pill to counteract. Dizziness, fatigue where I slept all day after pill 2. It wasn't until day 3 that I realize it was Macrobid making me so sick as I was perfect before. When my feet began feeling like the were literally set ablaze from the inside out I stopped taking this stuff immediately. I stopped yesterday and still have an excruciating burning pain in my feet and tingle sensation in my hands. If this still has me in this level of pain Monday I'm calling a lawyer. I've never experienced ANY side effects from medicine and with this one I've experienced them all. This is poison! Do not take it.
On my fourth day of nitrofurantoin. So far, Extreme Heartburn, Stomach Cramps and Gas Pains. Overall not too bad. Will continue to take. Still some burning when urinating.

This medication made me so sick for the whole 7 days of taking it. I woke up at 2 am every night nauseous and would throw up until I had nothing left to throw up all the way until noon the next day. You have to eat something with it so trying to force feed myself while feeling nauseous was horrible. My UTI was really painful and bad so I put up with it. Worst medication I have ever taken.

Been taking this drug for 3 days and not sure if the way I’m feeling is due to the drug or my ongoing stomach issues and anxiety. However, I have been feeling tired, nauseous and experiencing some dizziness. Also, had a headache for the first 2 days that wouldn’t budge - mainly frontal behind the eyes! On the plus side it seems to have cleared the UTI.I’ve completed my course so hopefully these symptoms will disappear.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I am a woman in her 40’s, I can’t speak for all women but for me my UTI’s have been getting worse with age. The pain and burning is almost unbearable. I don’t remember my 20’s being this bad. That being said, I was always put on cipro with the worst side effects that after day 3 I usually quit them all together. I recently just had a UTI, I was put on macrobid twice a day for 5 days. I am a small woman only 113 pounds. The first day I took a pill in the morning and at night, I only had half the capsule. I had absolutely no side effects and the antibiotic worked within hours!! Relief was amazing. This is the third day for me and I plan on doing the same thing. I’m not telling you to do what I did, I’m just telling you for me it worked. Also please grab D-mannose. It is a supplement that keeps UTI's away for good. I got lazy and quit buying it and boom, have sex and get a uti. I wish you all great health!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid was the worst antibiotic I've ever taken. I have never had a UTI and when I saw my Doctor she prescribed Macrobid 2x daily for 7 days. I have taken plenty of antibiotics in my lifetime and have never had any significant side effects. Within 4 hours of taking Macrobid I had terrible diarrhea for about 2 hours, after that I was nauseous to the point of vomiting (and I never vomit). No medication has ever made me this sick before. I had chills, weakness, diarrhea, and vomiting all within the first 12 hours. However, I know you're not supposed to stop taking medications so I took my second dose and the symptoms preceded to the point of not sleeping at all overnight. I stopped taking it the next day and my symptoms resolved completely. I went back to my doctor and got a different antibiotic that I had no problems with.
nitrofurantoin made me so sick I thought I was going to die, I had never have side affect

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I’ve had recurrent UTI’s all my life and prefer Macrodantin (usually as Macrobid, the slow release form) because it accumulates in the urine and isn’t as likely to cause yeast infections.  I have no side effects from it, luckily.   Over the past 3 or 4 years, I’ve noticed that 1) I need to stay on the antibiotic for much, much longer - like a month! - or the infection recurs very rapidly, within a couple of weeks; and 2) it no longer turns my urine bright yellow.  Also, while I’m taking it I sometimes have symptoms. Taken together, it makes me wonder if what I’m taking is lower strength.  Are there generics out there that are not the same as the original?

Got this prescribed for 7 days for UTI. I am 30 weeks pregnant and they found Strep B in my urine, and since I am allergic to Penicillin based drugs, this is my only option before IV antibiotics. My side effects are headache and pain behind the eyes (bearable), feeling like I haven't slept at night : daytime fatigue and weakness. I am finding myself sitting or laying down most of the day, especially 2-3 hours after taking the pill.  I am on day 5 and am trucking along. 3 more days.  It really helped clear up the awful foul smell of my urine. So yeah, not fun but when there is no other option, you stick with it.

Taken to A&E with heart rate going up and down and palpitations. (I already have a cardiac history). Urine test revealed an infection. My only other symptoms had been frequent urination and some lower back pain. Prescribed 3 day course of nitrofurantoin  100mg twice a day. Been on it 2 days so far. Heart settled, urinary frequency gone.  Only side effects were a mild but long lasting headache the first day and felt quite wiped out. Plus a couple of stomach rumblings which amounted to nothing.

On a course of 10 nitrofurantoin capsules, 2 per day. Just finished my fourth day, starting fifth tonight - I was given this prescription at a time that only allowed me to take one pill at night and then had to take the second one the next morning. On the plus side I haven't gotten any really bad reactions like some I've read, only a pretty nasty headache, some nausea and a bit of insomnia the past 2 days. On the downside, I've yet to feel better with my UTI. I'm still urinating excessively as well as producing a strong scent from it. Hoping that somehow it'll suddenly kick in soon but my hopes are pretty dulled. I won't be very happy if it worsens or I am put on another course that does give me side effects.

Horrible side affects from nitrofurantoin such as high anxiety, dizziness, stomach pain and headaches.  The unnerving anxiety was the worst thing I experienced.  They really shouldn't give this out to patients... I tried a couple of days on it and felt so out of myself.  Never again.  Didn't even touch the infection either:(

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):Macrodantin was an utter disaster. Felt that I was getting better then suddenly I had a raging upper urinary tract infection. Fever, nausea, vomiting, terrible pain. I had to be hospitalised with IV antibiotics. This drug is dangerous and should not be used as it gives a false sense of security.

Started on nitrofurantoin 100mg twice a day, for kidney infection, just finished three day course, not sure if is any better as suffering with chronic lower back pain, not related, will put another urine sample in tomorrow and get it checked! No side effects.

Nitro Macro (nitrofurantoin):This is my second time taking this. I used it in February after having been on Doxycycline for 10 days. After a check, I still had infection. A culture suggested Macrodantin. I don’t have any side affects. I don’t have to eat. I feel better after 3 pills. I get real dizzy when I have a UTI. Had to be hospitalized before. Given 3 days of IV antibiotics. The germs now are real. But, it’s all the practice of medicine.

Macrobid was prescribed by the Practice Nurse for UTI more specifically for a kidney infection. 100mg twice daily. I took one tablet and within 1 hour I was fighting to breath suffering severe rigours and a temp of 40degs. I was turning blue around the mouth, neck and chest. I was unable to speak but fortunately had read the contra indications and was able to point to them to my wife. An ambulance was called and arrive some 30 mins later. During this time I vomited twice and the breathing difficulties continued as did the rigours. Paramedics decided that I needed to be hospitalised. I was admitted to the Covid 19 ward as I was displaying at least 2 symptoms. Hospital team were brilliant , released at 4 am, not Covid! Appropriately medicine prescribed. Scary!

I was given this drug to treat my UTI. It felt like it started to work on the 3 day. Now on day 4 I start feeling urgency again. I am on a 7 day course. Do I have to wait for the medicine to finish before it starts working. I am so frustrated.

Just finished a course of nitrofurantoin at a dose of  2 times a day for 5 day dose.  The first 3 days it worked and the UTI seemed to be clearing up but day 4 I started feeling funny again and now day 5 all my symptoms are coming back just as bad as they did when I went to the doctor.  I found the first 3 days I had a bit of a headache taking this and my heart seemed to race a bit but my side effects went away the same time my symptoms started coming back.  I'm going to doctor tomorrow to get something else cause this stuff doesn't work.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took this for a UTI. I found relief the next day.  The only side effects I experienced were: dark brown urine, nausea, and upset stomach. It was very annoying to have to deal with especially after being at the hospital and enduring horrible pain from the UTI itself. I try to avoid taking this but I am glad I have it if I ever desperately need it.

I’m a 47 yr old man who was prescribed this medicine 5 days ago .I think it may have cleared it up although I still have like a twinge or ache but not as bad as before  ( plus a bad neck and back ) but this medicine has made me feel awful no appetite , nausea, I feel aches and pains , and I’m emotional all the time

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took Macrobid (Nitrofuratoin) twice for a UTI. The first time, I experienced a slight fever, chest pains, and difficulty breathing. I switched medication after speaking with my doctor, but I did not know that it also went by the name Macrobid as the generic brand. I had taken macrobid before and was fine, so assumed that this was a one-off instance of bad side effects.Now taking for a second time, and am experiencing very bad side effects of nausea, splitting headaches, slight fever, fatigue.... no other UTI medicine I’ve taken before has caused similar reactions. Would not recommend taking something so risky when there are plenty of other just as effective alternatives.

Prescribed nitrofurantoin as a seven day course for UTI. Was careful to take with food, and expected maybe some nausea. OMG what a horror story. I can't believe this drug is legal. Started with mild nausea and indigestion. Got worse with each dose and each day. Vomiting, diarrhoea, head spinning, pounding headache. Felt so ill I thought I had COVID-19. Yes it's dealt with the UTI but I currently (end day 4) feel like I'm dying. Am speaking to pharmacist tomorrow begging to be allowed to stop this awful medication.

On day 3 of nitrofurantoin and don't feel well at all.  Was awake all night, heart is beating faster than normal, night and day sweats, tingling in arm and leg, anxiety, shaking in hands, dizziness,  and no appetite.  Very nervous as I have never felt this way.  First and only time I will be taking this drug.  Calling the DR today to see what can be done.  I would not use this again.

I was prescribed this back in April. The first day I started getting nausea, rapid heart rate, fast breathing, nausea and dizziness. No relief from the UTI. Second day I came out in a rash and the breathing and heart rate was so bad I thought I was passing out. Couldn't eat so phoned docs. Nurse told me to take it for another day. A month later and nearly a stone lighter I still have the same side effects. I will never take it again and just hope it will wear off.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Came on to share my experience after seeing all of the bad reviews. I have not experienced any side effects from Macrobid; and haven’t always eaten with a large meal. Very well tolerated and provided relief from painful UTI after only a few doses.  I tend to react to antibiotics but no issues with this one.

I am usually a light weight with most medications, so when I was given Nitrofurantoin I was nervous. I ate something small before taking it, to my surprise after the first pill I was feeling relief from the pressure and burning from the UTI. It has made my a little drowsy but that it is. I’m on day 5, I would take this again. Everyone different. I have high blood pressure and anxiety, both were not effected.
I have had no side effects and am feeling so much better after the first full day taking it.

My urologist put me on this medicine Monday, Wednesday, and Friday for two months. The first week sick to my stomach, hands and feet numb, no energy, feeling like passing out, terrible stomach pain.   I couldn't even get through the first week.  Now today I was not able to pee either.  This stuff made me even worse.

I was showing symptoms of a UTI and went to an urgent care where I was prescribed a 5 day supply of Nitrofurantoin. Within 24 hours, in which I had taken two doses, I was experiencing a feeling of being off. By day 3, I began experiencing further side effects. I was experiencing fatigue, dizziness, nausea, headaches, and loss of appetite. On day 4, the dizziness and nausea had increased and there was a complete loss of appetite. I was unable to make any sudden movements without becoming extremely dizzy, nauseous, and disoriented. The only time I felt okay was when I was laying down and remaining still. I decided to stop taking the medication, which was only missing the remaining 2 doses. This medication did clear up the UTI, but I do not recommend due to its side effects.

I knew I had to take nitrofurantoin with food but with the chills and fever I was having it’s hard to eat any meals. I was ok on the first pill, but I woke up at midnight with horrible gut pain and back pain. The next day I felt nauseated, gut and stomach pain. It was hard to take deep breaths. I figured I just needed to let the antibiotics to work. Next day it was the same. Cramping in my stomach and my guts just bubbled the whole time. I couldn’t stand, walk, eat or sleep. I have to take Tylenol and alternate with naproxen. 3rd day it was the same, felt like my stomach was twisting itself. So the 4th day I said no more. The next my stomach still cramps every time I try to eat or drink anything. Energy is low. Before each dose I tried to eat a little something and take probiotic a few hours after, but I felt like my inside were kicking my butt.  I’m calling my doctor on the next working day to see what I need to do. It’s just hard to eat when you don’t have an appetite

Took this medication about a year ago and it worked wonderfully.   I developed a UTI again and was prescribed it again.  I took the first tablet and  went to bed.  I woke about an hour later with chills and uncontrollable shaking. I ended up in the emergency room. The doctor took me off this medication and prescribed Keflex which worked well for me.   I will not take nitrofurantoin ever again!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I've been reading the reviews and freaking out. I've had MANY bladder infections in my 18 years on this planet (sucks). But I've always been prescribed bactrim. But that was always by my pediatrician, so I'm in between doctors right now. I went to an online doctor thru my insurance company and they prescribed me Macrobid. I honestly broke down into tears after reading everyone's bad reviews. But I took my first pill today about 2 hours ago and the only side effect I've felt is feeling kind of heavy and fatigued. I ate dinner before taking and have been drinking water consistently since taking it. I feel pretty good! Sorry to everyone who's had a bad experience I hope y'all get better and that I don't have any of them

The medication nitrofurantoin gave me days of strong diarrhea and 24 hour nausea, starting on day 4 of 10. I had to take the pill with food, as prescribed, but the food sat in my stomach and felt like poison. I lost hunger/appetite, ate a bit , hoping to push the sour food in my stomach. Instead, it felt like it was backing up.Pepto Bismol offered a few minutes of relief.  My first time infection.Yes. nitrofurantoin generic did work by day 9 of 10 Next time, I'll ask for Amoxicillin instead.

nitrofurantoin cleared up the cloudiness in my pee quickly. But the side effects are unbearable for me. Extreme nauseous, puked everyday. Day 6 out of 10. I’ve been crying all day. Note: I do take with a meal.

I have never been prescribed a worse drug in my life. After taking nitrofurantoin my entire body hurts, can't walk, low energy, already lost appetite and this great dr prescribes me this junk. DO NOT EVER TAKE THIS DRUG. I am on day 7 and I can NOT pee. Completely ticked.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):For almost a month, I have been feeling every single description of what a UTI entails. Went to urgent care finally and they found red blood cells microscopically in my urine and slightly elevated pH, but the urine culture came back negative.  They prescribed me Macrobid and I'm now on my last day. I feel like the drug maybe helped to a very small extent, but overall not effective at all. Perhaps I have another underlying condition, but everything I'm feeling is indicative of a UTI. I had some stomach cramping on multiple occasions and feelings of being "off."  Now it's a trip to the Urologist next week to get to the bottom of this mystery. It's a nuisance and and annoyance to have this. I've never had this before.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I didn't appreciate the fact that you need to eat a proper meal or a sandwich when taking them. I had half a banana with the first dose and throughout the day I thought I felt so sick. Sick 5 times, chills, sweats, stiffness, dizzyness, tiredness and many other things. I called the surgery as I thought I might be allergic to them but they told me I hadn't eaten enough. Relief!!!

This nitrofurantoin made me itchy at night  especially my vaginal area, arms, stomach just itchy for no reason! It also I just couldn’t get to sleep, I  constantly awake if I did sleep it’s 1-2hrs , 5-10mins and I just wanna sleep but I haven’t seen that this medicine causes SLEEPLESS nights. In fact the medicine actually causes drowsiness and I haven't experienced the drowsy. And gas, so much gas omg.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took the antibiotic for 5 days for a UTI. First day it did cause a bit of nausea and dizziness but nothing too drastic. The rest of the days I had no side effects at all. Always took with a meal to prevent nausea or upset stomach.

If you already have anxiety/depression don’t take this. My heart is pounding out of my chest, whole body is numb, can’t eat, can’t sleep. Just drink a gallon of cranberry juice and save yourself from the nightmare you’ll experience from taking this.

Feel compelled to write. In the UK, 28. Went to A & E with UTI, lots of blood, urgency/pain. Prescribed Nitrofurantoin 4 times a day for 3 days. Took them with meal or food. 1st day felt UTI pain and didn’t notice anything else, 2nd day had a physical panic attack but less UTI. Elephant on chest, shallow breathing, too scared to lay down and spent all night sat up feeling like I was at the end of my life. 3rd day vertigo, tingling feet, shooting pains in legs and feet sent me to A and E again. Dipstick clear- course finished. It’s day 5, I tried to get up, go outside and I felt ill with vertigo. I have never experienced such an array of side effects and never after stopping a drug. Two days stopped & UTI does feel gone but I feel like a ghost, no energy, brain fog, confusion, nausea and upset stomach. Ask about side effects and consider asking for a different anti-biotic.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m 20 and get a lot of UTI's. I’ve taken just about every antibiotic there is. This is one of the milder ones. The bad smelling pee and burning went away after my second dose. I’m on my 4th day. I take this for 5 days. Gives me bad insomnia, but yet I’m super sleepy. Not the best feeling in the world but it’s worth it to clear the infection. UTI's can become dangerous if left untreated.

Took 2x per day for 7 days. A little upset tummy at the very beginning and good to go after that.  Thankful for this med. I was apprehensive due to the bad reviews online but decided the bacteria in my body was more dangerous than taking the meds. Feeling 100% better!

All I want know is how do I get rid of this pain in my legs from taken this nitrofurantoin poison. I have 3 kids and I can barely take  care of them because of the nitrofurantion. I’ve taken ibuprofen nothing seems to help - I regret taking this this.

Used to this nitrofurantoin antibiotic (UTI). I’ve been taking it for over 20 years to treat chronic UTI’s.  It always used to work for me, but now it’s hit and miss, and a three day course is definite not long enough. I usually take 14 x100mg for a week, but on some occasions this has not helped. Side effects I’ve never experienced anything negative apart from a bit of an upset stomach from time to time. Nothing that’s a major issue.Have tried Ciprofloxacin and this seems to be the strongest these days at treating UTI’s.  Fosfomycin sachets, trimethoprim, pivmecillinam and trimethoprim do not work in my opinion, and only dull symptoms. Cefalexin is hit and miss.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took this medication Macrobid for 5 days 2 times a day without issues and retested 5 days later to find it cured my UTI. 2 weeks later I had another UTI and again was given Macrobid. This time I started having a stomach acid discomfort which escalated to nausea, body aches and headache. I would take it with food but 3 hours later I’d feel sick and have to eat again. Day 4 I had swelling in my feet so I wore compression socks and I have drank plenty of water throughout my treatment. It basically has felt like I’ve had the flu and the next day after my last dose I am waiting for improvement. Everyone is different but this med has made me extremely sick. My dr told me to stop at day 5 rather than 7 and we will test in 3 days.
Dangerously sick for after one nitrofurantoin pill. The drug companies experiment on us.

If you hadn’t got anxiety and depression before taking this drug you will have afterwards. It also causes also dizzy, balance problems, aching muscles & bones, nausea, hearing problems, eyes hurting, feel totally disorientated, awful.  But nothing else seems to work  and I still have  like this 2 weeks after tablets have stopped.  I am still feeling awful

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This drug was fine at first. By the second pill it seemed as if my UTI was gone. If you don’t take this drug with TONS of food, it will mess you up. This drug also gave me sever stomach gas and diarrhea every morning. It also increased my appetite so much when I woke up that I had to eat something immediately or I felt sick. I really did not like being on this medicine. It messed up how I felt and just made me super tired and uncomfortable. I hope I never have to take it again.

Day 1  no symptoms Day 2  I felt better, then had 5 bowel movementsDay 3 tingling / needles feeling in both feet. And the chills.Day 4 no symptoms Day 5 no symptomsDay 6 bad headache, chills, fever of 103.4. Ears ringing.Took asprin, fever broke to 102.2.3 hours later fever was up to 103.2.Resting heartbeat rate137-139. (My normal resting heartbeat is 58-64)Shortness of breath. Day 7 I stopped taking the drug. Shortness of breath. FEVER 102.5, Resting heartbeat rate 110.Ears ringingDay 8 Fever 100 -101.4 Shortness of breath increased.  Left eye hurt, sharp pain. Ears ringing.Resting heart beat rate 99Day  9 Fever dropped down to 96.1!Hour later, temp.was 97.0. checked every 2 hours, temp fluctuated between 96.7 - 97.5Lungs hurt more. dizzy.Day 10 Temp. 97.5Shortness of breath. Strange intermittent hic-up type of breathing. Headache, Right temple sharp pains, pain travels down behind my right ear to the base of skull. Left eye ok today.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):On macrobid for UTI and everything is coming out of me everywhere. I was only able to eat a breakfast bar, water and a banana yesterday. I  threw up the banana after about an hour. Today I held down applesauce. Unfortunately it’s a holiday but I am calling my doctor in the morning.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I am on my fourth day of taking MacroBid for  UTI. The burning sensation, when I pee, has gone. The foul smell in my urine has gone, it now smells like urine again. My urine is clear again. It was very cloudy and slightly brown in colour. The two aspects of the infection that remain are the weakness of the flow and the frequency of origination, which is about every half hour. I have not had any side effects. So I feel that this has been a success so far. I have seven days worth to take and I will keep going.

Currently on my third day of taking this medication and my stomach is in pieces!! It feels like someone has pumped me full of air and the cramps are horrendous. No sickness but feeling very nauseous. My doctor said I will still feel some pain a few days after the medication finishes. I really hope it works!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Mild nagging headache, mild nausea, cold sweats for up to 3 hrs after ingestion.  Negative interaction with Lorazepam dramatically increasing the above side effect and duration.  In addition, intense muscle aches & pains.  IMHO, steer clear of benzodiazepines with this Rx.  This the 2nd time I took it this month because UTI came back.  Antibiotics must be replaced soon by new biotech because we have so changed our internal biome with antibiotics that resistance has caught up with them.  The same is true for fungi...google Candida Auris.  At our population levels microbiology has recognized us as their number one food source on the planet.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This medicine was absolutely horrible for me I had extreme diarrhea with nausea and vomiting every time I took it and I had to take it 2 x a day . The abdominal pain it caused no matter how much food or water I took with it was the sharpest pain I’ve ever felt like 7/10 on pain scale. I lost weight and was severely dehydrated .

Within 24 hours, I started with severe shaking of hands then entire upper torso followed by chills (worst I've ever had), vomiting, fever and severe aches and joint pain. I thought I was having a stroke! I will not take again and have never had a reaction to any meds taken. Always had Cipro or Bactrim with no problems and asked for one of these but Dr. ordered Keflex. 48 hours later I'm still very weak, couldn't eat for 24 hrs. It was scary.
Worked perfectly but I can't swallow whole pills so I had to empty them, crush it and then take them with a drink and it had the same consistency of chalk :))))

Had these antibiotic twice and twice I've had sepsis like symptoms not sure if connected to these but seems very strange high temperature build up of fluid and thickening of my lungs low oxygen low blood pressure and high blood cultures not sure of exact numbers but within sepsis marks.I was put  on 2 different lots of IV antibiotics and fluid but can't pick up where the infection was weird is a understatement

I had a very painful bout of cystitis and was given a 3 day course of nitrofurantoin at my local surgery. I found no difference at the end of the treatment - still burning pain, cramping, needing to go to the loo constantly but at least no blood by the end of day 3. My health has really gone down hill - extreme tiredness, inability to concentrate, distorted vision, horrendous constipation and dizzy spells. I went back and was given exactly the same thing, another course. I'm on day 3 with 1 last dose to take but still have burning pee and very bruised bladder feeling. I feel very demoralised, especially as my old surgery used to prescribe Amoxycillin and you didn't even need to see the doctor. I can now look forward to a painful Xmas

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I went in to the doc for a UTI and was prescribed Cipro. However after 4 days of taking that and experiencing side effects like severe headaches and fatigue, my lab results indicated I needed to take Macrobid instead. YAY! Another antibiotic to try. If that wasn't frustrating enough, it's only day TWO of Macribid and I'm suffering. I've been having some of the worst headaches of my life, and terrible nausea. I've lost a lot of my appetite and at times feel like I need to vomit. I've also also been overly emotional, weepy, and sad. I'm so upset I have to take this for several more days, especially during the holidays. But if it gets rid of this UTI, I guess it's worth it? I don't know... I'm going to drink as much water as I can and maybe take some ginger for the nausea to see if that helps.

This is the third UTI I’ve ever had, and my first time taking this nitrofurantoin medication. The previous 2 medications I went on gave me no complications whatsoever. However, nitrofurantoin made me extremely sick. The first morning I threw up about 6 times, and I had diarrhea the entire time I was on the drug. I was shaking horribly, I felt lightheaded, and my stomach was always in pain. I had to stop taking this drug before my prescription was over because I couldn’t stand the pain it was putting me through. I REALLY don’t recommend taking this medication unless nothing else works for you.

this is my second time taking this medication nitrofurantoin. It works well for me (for the most part).  I do get an upset stomach taking it and I do take it with meals. However, I experience a side effect that I have yet to see talked about: a yeast infection!! The yeast infection I get while taking this is unlike any I've ever gotten from an antibiotic. The yeast infection is so bad that it has made my private parts swell up. It has also spread to my bottom, causing THE most painful rash. Using the restroom burns and hurts so bad I get nauseated from the pain. I suffered with a UTI for 2 weeks and this medication helps well with that, so I'm coping with the side effects and praying for all around relief.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Overall this antibiotic Macrobid was good. It cleared up my infection in 3 days out of a 10 day treatment, I always ate a lot with it and took a probiotic and a yogurt right after taking it, and didn’t feel sick at all, it gave me a slight stomach ache but I could function and it was comfortable, until tonight where I am in bed with sharp abdominal pains and stomach ache, but it may be my fault cause I took it later than I usually do, otherwise it is good. Don’t be afraid to try it, I get sick on all medications and I get UTI's all the time and by far macrobid is the best.

I was prescribed nitrofurantonin for vaginal pain and infection.  Did not help much with the problem. Had acute leg pain and cramps very severe. Two weeks later started with the same pain 20 times or so urinating at night. Will not take it again.

I would take nitrofurantoin only as absolute last resort.  Maybe most people can take Nitrofurantoin for a week with no problems, but you need to inform yourself of possible side effects.  I took it for three days with UTI symptoms improving, but then had bad dizziness and headache, as well as nausea and no appetite.  But the worst was scary shortness of breath.  Doc thought it was  lung inflammation due to drug.  She changed nitrofurantoin to another med, but two weeks later am still having these side effects.  She said all antibiotics are pesticides for killing germs, ie bacteria, that can get into places in the body where they don’t belong.  This makes sense, but in the future I think I will ask for a different kind of pesticide.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this for a mild UTI. I’ve had a UTI in the past so I knew right away what was starting. I felt normal, no urgency to pee after the second dose. I never had pain so I can’t attest to it this time but in the past it did help with that. I’ve taken it with food as directed. The only side affect maybe sweating, woke in the night soaked and had to change my clothes. Maybe it’s the drug or maybe I am getting old? I got this same reaction with steroids that I was taking with chemotherapy but that could have been chemo too..all in all I would use this again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Started Macrobid 5 days ago. I’ve taken Cipro before and it’s always worked well. My doc was on vacation, so I went to another clinic. She told me that they stay away from prescribing Cipro, so she suggested Macrobid and said it was well tolerated. First, I want to let you know that it did not work for me. I’m on day 5 & the burning right now is just as it was when my UTI started. When I started taking it, I felt nauseous, dizzy, balance issues, weak arms, depressed and weepy. This is out of character for me. I’ve hardly worked due to feeling incredibly weak and tired. I'm self employed and 4.5 of my days have been completely wiped out by this drug. I also have cramping in my feet and today I had bizarre facial flushing, hot ears and high blood pressure for 5 hours. I’ve always had normal blood pressure so this was scary. DO NOT TAKE THIS!

I will NEVER take this nitrofurantoin antibiotic again. The side effect were horrendous!!! I experienced:All over body painSevere head achePainful eyesBack painsNausealoss of appetite.I stopped using it after the third day. The most worrying part for me was my eyes. It felt like they were going to burst out of my head. This was caused by the antibiotic!!! My eyes were so sore and painful, felt like my eyes could not take the pain of the next tablet, as I knew it would make the pain worse.

2 times I have taken this drug both times I have ended up with sepsis don't know if it connected but to me I'm sure it is. I am fine now with 5 days of IV  in hospital been sent home with oral tablets now. The symptoms I got was low oxygen, very high temperature, fast heartbeat, low blood pressure and fluid in my lungs and this was from a UTI treated both times with this drug  nitrofurantoin and like I said both time septic

My profile: mid 20’s, female, first time using antibiotics as an adult.Reason for using: UTI. The urgency was INSANE. After 3 days of chugging cranberry juice, I had enough disappointment & decided it was time to give antibiotics a go.First impressions: IT WORKS! The UTI was gone overnight. Side effects were: nausea & a low-grade fever. I also experienced tiredness, dizziness & certain smells were weird.What helped: prebiotics like pickles, sauerkraut, etc for the nausea, eating simple foods & avoiding alcohol, spicy food & caffeine & avoiding sugar because that feeds the bacteria you’re trying to kill. Keeping well hydrated, using a hot water bottle/heated pad for comfort & sleeping.Overall: I mean, it works, so 7/10. The side effects are manageable with the above tips & since it’s only 5 days (in my case) for the prescribed course, it wasn’t that bad given the alternative of constantly needing to pee.

I have never felt so badly with an antibiotic in my life.  I'm on nitrofurantoin 100mg twice a day. The first day with food started feeling really badly, I was chilling, shaking uncontrollably...awful headache...hands and legs became numb...nauseous, so weak, once I laid down I couldn’t get back up. My husband is on Hospice, and I am his 24/7 caregiver. I kept trying to get up and I felt like I was going to faint.  I'm so achy all over, I was totally felt like it was the end for me. I am in bed right now, and can’t even get up....like I  had the worst flu ever....do not take this

I took the first 3 doses of the50 mg tablets of this drug Didn’t take the 4th Severe stabbing pains in back of my head and ears So bad I was crying As the day progressed I just got worse I couldn’t even walk My hands wouldn’t function at all The pain was off the scale I thought I was going to die I will never take this drug ever again

I had a four day course of nitrofurantoin for a UTI  and pretty much the pain and symptoms went away after the first day. All good so I thought. Day 3 it floored me. I took all the advice drank loads and had them with meals. I had to take to my bed with nausea and dizziness. I could not move my head without a whirling sensation. A week later after finishing it still having dizzy moments. Very scary drug. On the pack it says usually well tolerated. I wonder what usually means? 51%? Maybe I was one of the 49% but I know I won’t take this again.

I always scare myself before taking new medications by first reading the reviews.  I almost didn't start this due to not wanting to be deathly ill from it over Thanksgiving.  But since I have a history of kidney infections I decided to just take it.  I've had no adverse effects.  I'm on day 3 now.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was terrified of taking macrobid after reading these horrible reviews. Overall, I experience minor side effects while on the antibiotic. The first two times I took the pill it made my face flushed but that was all. I also experienced slight nausea throughout the duration of the antibiotic. Please do not let all of the bad reviews scare you about the side effects of this antibiotic because they are very minimal in most cases (people who have a positive experience rarely write reviews). However I gave this drug a median rating because it did not cure my UTI. I had to go back to the minute clinic today and now am on ciprofloxacin

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):Took 4x 100mg  Macrodantin capsules for three days as set by my doctor. Cleared my UTI within two days, however experienced chest pains and shortness of breath on day one. Didn’t realise (until reading this forum) it was linked, so continued to take until I ended up in Emergency Room completely unable to breathe without pain. I’ve been off these tablets for 4 days now and I still can’t take a full breath, have sharp lung pains and am so dizzy. Really disappointed in my doctor for not letting me know the risks first.

Recently prescribed this antibiotic for a UTI. I'm on day 3 1/2, so I'm 1\2 way there. UTI seems to be clearing up which I'm thankful for but the side effects will make you wanna stay in bed and cry. I have had a severe headache since starting it and it won't go away. Diarrhea, foggy brain, extreme tiredness, stomachache to name a few. There has got to be something better out there. I feel like I'm in a bad drug commercial where I gave up one ailment to gain 10 side effects. I'm really hoping I can make it through the 7 days. Definitely something I will put on the NEVER TAKE AGAIN list.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After reading all the horror stories I was dreading taking this but I’m hoping my experience will help others out! I was diagnosed with a UTI. My OBGYN prescribed Bactrim in which I had a horrible reaction and found out I had an allergy to so she switched it to Macrobid.I was afraid to take it since everyone on here seems to complain however I read a successful post where one girl said she took it with a muffin so that’s what I did.I ate a HEAVY meal then waited about 30-45 minutes. I took a jumbo muffin and ate half of it then took the pill then ate the remaining half of the muffin. No nausea, no diarrhea, no dizziness, nothing! Now keep in mind that all of our bodies are different and so are our tolerances but this is not as bad as it seems if you drink plenty of water and eat lots of food prior to taking it, including bread items! Best of luck!

Just finished 7 days worth of this nitrourantion medication a few days ago, seemed to be working, but now I'm starting to feel the burning when I  urinate again! Don't know if it was enough or what's going on!! Headed back to urgent care!! No side effects and I'm starting cranberry pills and tea!! I pray all who are experiencing these UTI's be healed,i ncluding myself in Jesus name!! God bless us all Amen!!

Horrible! Tingling in my legs and hands, hot flashes, no sleep, stomach cramps, diarrhea and nausea. I felt flu like symptoms. This antibiotic and I were not meant for each other.  I discontinued after my 3rd pill. 100mg every 12 hours

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m leaving this review for people (like myself) who google EVERYTHING before they try something. I have A LOT of anxiety so reading these reviews made me very nervous about starting this med. I was given cipro 3 days ago for a UTI/kidney infection and spent the whole night throwing up, and pain etc. went  back to the dr and she prescribed Macrobid. It’s been 2 days that I have been taking it  and so far, so good. Yes you have to eat with it or I get mild nausea. I find myself more tired but that’s ok with me...I need sleep! I have been drinking a lot more water (I’m a huge water drinker to begin with) this med makes me thirsty. I’m glad I tried it and didn’t let the reviews get the best of me! I don’t know how it’s working for the UTI because I didn’t have any symptoms other than back pain. It was the urine results that warranted the medication. Everyone reacts different to medications. So please take these reviews with a grain of salt. Good luck to everyone out there!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I get UTI's all the time. I’ve taken Bactrim and cipro and both give me terrible headaches and just make me feel terrible. I was super anxious to take Macrobid because of all the negative reviews but it worked good and gave me no side effects. I will never take a different  antibiotic for a uti ever again.

After reading all of the reviews on here, I was terrified to take nitrofurantoin for a UTI. The drs prescribed me a 5 day course. I started it that day. As per the instructions, I took the tablets (100mg twice a day) with plenty of food and always a yogurt drink that contains live bacteria cultures, which really helped. I did  experience side effects, but mildly. The main one being nausea and an upset stomach within 3 hours of taking each tablet (dependent on how much I had eaten). I sometimes had fatigue, tingliness and itchy skin. It was nothing that I couldn't handle.The UTI symptoms were gone within 2 days of starting treatment. Don't let the negative reviews scare you off. They nearly did, me - I am so glad that I just just did it and took them. Nowhere near as bad as a recent antibiotic (mebeverine) I had to take for something else.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took my 4th 100 mg macrobid pill for UTI and it helped my pain after taking my second dose. I haven't had any problems, but I made sure to take it with food each time. This last pill I took with food but it has made me very dizzy for some reason. I don't know why it would this time and not the others, but it's very obvious it's the medicine because I was completely fine before I took it and very dizzy for 3 hours now after taking it. At least it's taken the infection away though, so I'll take the dizziness.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Let me just say, I was terrified to begin this antibiotic  Macrobid because of all of the reviews. But let me say I am so glad I did. Ladies PLEASE do not let these reviews scare you away. First, it is incredibly important to take the antibiotic to get rid of the infection before it gets serious. Second, all of these side affects will not affect most people - people who have bad experiences are so much more likely to leave a review- if something works fine people just get on with their lives. I know everyone’s body takes meds different but this is literally the top line MOST COMMONLY prescribed medication for UTIs. Thousands of women get prescribed this every day and have no affects. I have not had ANY side affects and I’m feeling sososo much better already. Don’t let these scare you and help your body heal!!!! Just make sure you eat your yogurt and probiotics to keep away the yeast infections!!

If I could give this medication nitrofurantoin a 0 I would. Did a 7 day 2 per day course. Had a horrible rash, headache and nausea, Then about two days after I had finished, major body pain started. I mean worse than the flu. I'll never take this mess again. Still dealing with another rash after finishing and body pain. Doc put me on tapered down steroids.

I have never considered posting a review of a drug until now. I have been sick for 3 days due to taking this drug. I would rather deal with the UTI entirely than have these side effects. I feel like my throat is in a vice grip. Any food I do manage to choke down, despite the constant nauseous feeling and tremors, comes out shortly after. I have already pooped on the toilet 10 times today. Do yourself a favor and ask your doctor for a different type of drug. There are several to treat UTI's. Do not use this one, it's not worth the risk!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Cleared up the UTI pretty quickly. But on the second day I started to have some side effects, nausea, upper abdominal and back pain, feeling very weak and tired... eating a larger meal with pill seems to help a little. Not the worst medication, but not great either

I have a very sensitive system and this med is horrible, causing dizziness, severe nausea, crying spells and balance issues.   I'm told I must take this med or be put in a hospital for IV antibiotic.   Hope I'll outlast these horrid side effects.   Stay away from this med if at all possible.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid 3x100mg/day5 days taken for UTI.This did ease bladder discomfort a little but the side effects were bad. Only took for 5 days and still have stomach pain and bloating 2 weeks later plus hadnausea/ brain fog/ dizzy. Never again

I really felt like I should state my experience with this drug. I had done a lot of research, including reading these reviews, and I was terrified of taking nitrofurantoin. I almost decided to deal with a UTI rather than take it. Well, I wanted to share that I didn't have any negative effects. It did make me feel a little tired, but I'm not sure if that is from the medication or from waking up earlier than usual. I will say to make sure you take it with a meal. I had half of an English muffin and oatmeal and I didn't have any nausea. I would also say to drink plenty of water to help the medication work. And finally, don't be afraid like I was. I was having really bad anxiety after taking the first pill and I am totally fine.

I got a UTI infection and first treated it with over the counter medicine, which cleared all the UTI symptoms. I still went to the doctor to make sure the infection is gone but they found that it was still in my body and prescribed me nitrofurantoin for 7 days. First few days were fine, on day 5 I started to feel extremely nauseous, weak, had headaches and loss of appetite. On top of that my pulse is 57 bpm, which is lower than normal range. I would not take this antibiotic again as it has really bad side effects.

Never take this drug Nitrofurantoin cos it has really bad side effects. Dizziness, being sick, hot flashes etc flu like symptoms. Every side effects to this drug l had. I never going to take this drug again

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Dr. prescribed this and Lab culture of the sample said it should work but after 4 days there were no change in symptoms.  For me a typical response to UTI meds is a noticeable change in 2 days. No side effects either but I could have been taking sugar pills.

Prescribed a daily 3x1 dose of 100 mg for 7 days and I have no other symptom than constant hunger. Have a problem taking the pill on full stomach because I want to eat the whole day when otherwise am not a big eater.Did it clear up my UTI? I had a 4* urine test and will have another culture after the 7 days. Definitely am feeling much better.No pain, no bad stomach, no headache.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I felt the medication would have worked, my symptoms of UTI were easing. Unfortunately, after just 1 day of taking Macrodantin, I had the most awful sudden reaction, cough, uncontrollable shaking, chills, high temperature, body aches, and chest tightness, I didn't have enough energy to shower or leave my bed. I decided to stop and felt I was getting better from the side affects. 24 hours later, I started the medication again, after the 2nd dose, I woke up during the night with the same symptoms. I had pneumonia years ago, these symptoms felt the same. I know, I can never taken this medication again.

I had to go to urgent care for a UTI, I was taking AZO for 2 days and it didn't work. The Dr prescribed me nitrofurantoin 100mg. Thank God I didn't have to get up during the night, and this morning got up use the restroom, and it didn't hurt when I urine, which is a great start,  so for me is working, I just took my second dose, so far so good. Good Wednesday everyone

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Have had UTI 3 times now and treated with macrobid. Third time I only had a pain in my right side and within taking the first pill my heart rate shot up and got excruciating headaches and I had shivering and high temp, basically flu like symptoms. Though I was dying, I was bed bound and thought I had sepsis as most of the symptoms matched. I was crying in bed as I felt so bad. On the second day the temperature came down and shivering was gone but headaches were still there and I mean they were so bad radiating pain into my jaw. I had no appetite either but forced myself to have something as it states in the pack you should for absolution. Saw doc today and she took me off them, will wait for results to see if I need something else. Glad I looked on here, thought I was going mad. I’m sure that macrobid are fine for some people and I was the first two times, but not now. UK review

Taken nitrofurantoin for 7 days twice a day for UTI. My side effects are  tachicardia, dizziness then infection cleared, but then got side effectrs of eye lids itching, swollen and then my infection came back. Wrongly relating eye problem to make-up allergy, was prescribed another course of nitrofurantoin, twice a day, 14 days. Itching to other areas of the body such as the inside legs, arms and on breast.  Stopped antibiotic and given another type for 10 days. Itching isn’t gone yet. I read that nitrofurantoin side effects can go on for long time.Seen the high frequency of adverse side effects reported and having learned that there are other antibiotics available as much as effective as this one (even if in my case the 7 day therapy didn’t work), but less likely to give side effects, It shouldn't be prescribed. Actually, it should have never been commercialized in first place. After all the safety of a medicament shall be as much as important as its effectiveness in order not to become a poison instead.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took one x 100mg nitrofurantoin capsule twice a day for 3 days, and by day 2 my UTI had cleared.  I didn't experience any side effects, although I made sure to take each dose on a full stomach.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):On Macrobid for a UTI that didn't clear up after being on Bactrim for 3 days. It seems to be helping cure my UTI and my symptoms, but the nausea is terrible! I'm usually pretty sensitive to antibiotics anyway, but this is worse than usual!

I have had bladder infections in the past but never come acrosnitrofurantoin until now. I'm glad that it's an antibiotic that just targets the bladder itself and doesn't clear out your whole body. I took 40mg 4 times a day for 3 days. I felt a difference in my infection within a few fair hours. The first two days I struggled with nausea, loss of appetite, indigestion and feeling tired. It also made my pee a different colour which were all expected. But it did pass after 24 hours. They also were compatible with my SSRI Citalopram tablets as well.I would say that the symptoms are entirely different for everyone but for me personally they worked well and the side effects were worth going through to get the results I wanted. The more you drink with these antibiotics the better. I find that a warm water bottle helps ease pain and restlessness with the infection.

I was on this medication for 9 gruelling days for a UTI. I didn’t take the last day because I thought if I did it would be my last day living. I had severe and I mean severe side effects including nausea, headaches, muscle and joint pain that were excruciating. I had pain in my spine so bad that I was afraid I had bone cancer. My joint pain would wake me up in the middle of the night. I had a few horrible nightmares and chills every night. It was seriously a feeling of doom. I had no idea a drug prescribed by a doctor could have such horrible side effects. It was so bad that I didn’t even think it was the antibiotic. I ended up going back to my doctor on day 9. I was sent for scans on my stomach, gallbladder and bowels. I had full bloodwork done. Guess what, NOTHING was wrong. It was all side effects from this nasty drug. PLEASE take it off the market.  It was a very bad experience.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This medication Macrobid is the only one I could take for UTI and it works very well for me

I began taking nitrofurantoin last night. I felt nausea, headache and diarrhea. Instead of helping my pain it seems to be getting worse. I do not know If I should contact Dr or take it for another 24 hrs.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m just finishing up seven days of macrobid and the negative reviews worried me. This is only the second UTI I’ve ever had and I don’t take antibiotics often so with that said I like to do research- but I’m here to tell you I didn’t even have ONE bad reaction.  The UTI was gone by the next day. I was actually able to have some UTI relief after just one dose of macrobid. Think of all the thousands of people taking macrobid daily that don’t come on here and state their positive reactions, forums like this are equivalent to yelp; most people will just pop on to complain about their bad reaction but there are wayyyy more good than bad so don’t let them scare you away. If you don’t feel good after your first dose just don’t take the next one before talking to your doctor. UTI’s can be dangerous so it’s important that you have adequate medication pumping through you.

I had a UTI that started a few days ago. I almost went to urgent care but was able to take a questionnaire and get this antibiotic prescribed since I get them frequently. I’ve taken a few other medications for this in the past but had horrible reactions to each of them. This is my first time on nitrofurantoin. Each time I take a dose I do get a bit dizzy even though it’s taken with food. It passes throughout the day as I eat and drink. I like how they’re capsules versus tablets, as they don’t immediately dissolve a nasty flavor into my mouth right as they enter. It’s only my second day of doses and I’m already feeling much better down there. I’ll take a headache and some dizziness if it takes away the horrible UTI pain... as it does!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was given Macrobid 2x day for 5 days for a UTI. I’m on dose 7 out of 10 and so far the worst side effect I’ve had is fatigue and mild stomach upset but when I take it with food that has seemed to be ok. Not bad at all! I’ve been given Bactrim DS before and that one makes me nauseous, I’d rather be given Macrobid over Bactrim. Macrobid seems to be a gentle antibiotic with few side effects at least for me but everyone reacts differently to medication. I don’t tend to react much to any antibiotics in general, I guess I’m lucky! Would recommend Macrobid as by the time I took around the 3-4 dose I already had less burning upon urination, it works efficiently and it works quickly! The UTI is gone but I need to finish the last few doses so it doesn’t come back.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):UTI was agony, the Macrobid antibiotics cleared it up within 2 days! 100mg twice a day for 3 days.Only side effect is very nauseous.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Was given Macrobid for a presumed UTI (still no results yet). Have had them in the past with varying results. This time from the first day, I had even more increased urination (somehow), pelvic pain, severe lower back pain, abdominal cramping, stomach pain, nausea, felt constipated, and just awful. Was given 3 days and still don't feel absolutely 100%, have been prescribed more for an extra few days but am reluctant to take and have already missed a dose because after reading about all the problems and realizing this could have been a bad reaction I'm kind of scared to take more.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This medication made me feel horrible. I had a UTI and was prescribed this Macrobid. I took one dose. Within about 15-30 minutes I felt so miserable. It worsened as the day went on. I felt anxious, dizzy, nauseous, my face tingled, and I couldn't concentrate. And the worst part was it was long acting, so it took quite some time to feel normal. I will never take this again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I got prescribed Macrobid for a UTI I have and it’s a great medication but some symptoms do come up like..headache and weakness but other than that it’s clearing everything up it’s not a dangerous medication and it’s important that you stay hydrated and eat before every dose you take.

NOPE!!  This antibiotic  nitrofurantoin wrecked havoc on my body.  2 capsules per day x 5 days.  I experienced some awful side effects from this med, but I didn't lose my hair. I still have my hair and the UTI.  EXTREME nausea, vertigo and fatigue.  No thanks... maybe try ANYTHING else!!  Btw - I'm only willing to lose my hair for life saving meds like chemo.

I get UTI's frequently and nitrofurantoin is the worst the doctor ALWAYS gives them to me when I get a a UTI. I feel horrible the doctor at the hospital wants me to take this medication 4 times a day for 7 days  and I am only 86lbs I feel like dying they are 50mg and even then I feel like rubbish  so I decided to only take them twice a day cause 4 times is way too much I feel severely drowsy and Dizzy and almost like I am walking on clouds I am on day 2 of these meds and feel really sick and it sucks because I am allergic to rocephen, amoxillin and Cipro  so these are the only ones I can take and each time I take them I still experience the same symptoms I can't deal with these meds anymore they are horrible and I don't know what to do about my UTI these help it go away quick but time the side effects are too much

nitrofurantoin is my favorite antibiotic ever for UTI's.  It concentrates in the bladder and doesn’t affect other tissues much, and even a single dose clears up 50% of infections. (To be safe, I took 3 days). As long as I take it with food, I just get my UTI cleared up with no side effects. I really don’t know why it has so many bad reviews. I was wondering if  it may be the UTI itself that’s giving people most of these symptoms, although everyone is different so I guess I am lucky. UTIs almost always give me sleep paralysis, which is creepy but a little fun.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m 56m years old and have never problem with antibiotics. Prescribed Macrobid 2x day for 10 days as I had my  third UTI in five monthss. UTI symptoms quickly vanished BUT by day 5 I couldn’t think, had zero appetite, headaches and sore throat- assumed virus- Day 8 face and neck began to swell, sudden SEVERE back pain, fever, teeth chattering, vomiting- saw doc-test showed kidney function off/dehydration, tho I constantly had fluids. 3 days off-still sore throat, tired but head clear and energy/appetite returning. Another kidney function test next week. PS this is NOT only people with allergic reactions- never again!

I get chronic UTIs. I can think of a UTI and get one. It's awful, because when I get one, I get a BIG one.So I have been prescribed Macrobid/Nitrofurantoin repeatedly over the last 20 years, even as a prophylactic. I've tried everything else and nothing works as effectively and efficiently as nitrofur. At first, it didn't bother me at all. I could take it whenever and be just fine. Now, I dread taking it. I have to take it right before bed and with Zofran (to stop nauseated ), or I will be the most miserably nauseated for hours. This antibiotic 97% of the time works with just one dose on cutting out a UTI for me, other times, I have to take up to 2. I've never had to take more than 2 doses. I wish there were a lower dosage to maybe help out with the gut issues, but it's a short term side effect that's worth it to get rid of a nasty UTI.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Prescribed Macrobid for UTI infection yesterday. I took one tablet and within 6 hours I was physically sick and shaking uncontrollably. Ended up calling 111 and was sent to see an out of hours doctor. I have now been prescribed an alternative tablet .I will never take this antibiotic again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m on my 2nd dose of Macrobid. The first dose was two tablets 2x a day for 3 days. I had no problem whatsoever on them. After my first dose they took another sample to see if it had cleared up and results came back showing no infection but still red blood cells in urine. So went back today and have been put on a weeks course. So hopefully that will do the trick. Or a trip to see a urologist for me

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve taken 2 doses of macrobid. The first dose I felt a bit woozy but didn’t think much of it. But, last night’s dose gave me the spins, increased heart rate, itching, and anxiety. It passed in a couple hours, but the pharmacist said to stop taking it immediately and call my doctor for a different Rx. I took with a meal and was very well hydrated. Even the doctor that tested my urine earlier in the day commented on how well hydrated I was, so that wasn’t the issue. Exercise caution with this med. Discontinue and call your doctor before taking another dose if you experience any odd symptoms after a dose. All symptoms I experienced are known side effects.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had a UTI last year, and was aware that this meant I might get more in the future. I started with another three weeks ago and then the pain went to my kidneys. After ONE dose of Macrobid, the symptoms began to go within six hours. By the third dose, my energy levels went up again, and the pain I had urinating has gone.  I will take the remaining five days' dosage, and I am amazed at how quickly this new treatment has knocked some very debilitating symptoms on the head!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I haven't had the gastro symptoms mentioned by everyone else and my UTI was better after the 1st dose! However as someone with mental health issues I found a significant increase in super negative thoughts and urges as well as depression and anxiety. I personally wouldn't take this but if you do not have pre existing mental health issues you will probably be okay! Good drug overall, bad for me personally
(Urinary tract infection) When I took the nitrofurantoin tablet  I had stomach pain, vomiting and I was getting nauseous . I have completed 3 days course...

Oh my gosh, I am so glad I've read these reviews. I though I was becoming neurotic! I had been diagnosed with breast cancer and during the tests I got an awful UTI. The pain was awful especially when I had to lay on my tummy in the MRI scanner on day 2 of the medication.  My doctor gave me a 7 day course and I felt terrible. Just like everyone else I had stomach cramps, loose stools,  rapid heart beat, the worse headaches ever, burning eyes, high temperature, freezing feet and hands, queasy and unable to eat much as it hurt my stomach too much. I was so weak that I just laid down all day.  I thought is was because I was run down after the cancer diagnosis and I finished the course last night. I am so pleased to find out I'm not crazy and look forward to it leaving my system today. Can't tell you if my UTI is cured because I still feel so bad. But hope for a miracle and that I'll feel fine by teatime. Xxxx

First time to use this medication. I felt awful to begin with the UTI was awful hadn’t had one in over 20 years. The medication started working immediately the pain in my back went away the pain while urinating went away but I was nauseous after taking it and overall yucky feeling. Can’t really say it was all because of the medicine because I felt awful with the UTI. It did its job .To me the pros outweigh the cons. My doctor did stress to not take it on an empty stomach and to be sure and drink lots of water. I did even though I didn’t feel like eating I did when I took the medication. All done now and UTI gone did have some diarrhea on last day but I usually do with any antibiotics.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed Macrobid for a UTI. I know medications effect everyone in a different way. But this antibiotics made me so sick. I had severe headaches, nausea, & weakness. I was unable to go to work. I took the entire 7 day treatment even though it was making me feel so terrible. I thought it would be worth it if it cleared up my infection. But it didn’t clear it up!!!!!!’ I still had the same symptoms, so I had to go back to the doctor. This time I was prescribed Cephalexin. It worked & with no side effects.

Taking 50mg nitrofurantoin four times a day for 3 daysWithin a few hours of the first dose the weakness began which I put down to infection. But it was different. Then the pounding headache around my ears, above my eyes and even in my teeth and jaw. I can’t sit in the light due to it. This is nothing like a migraine either. It’s a sharp pain. I can hardly turn over in bed and I have slept mostly for 3 whole days. I’ve also had a pain in my back that feels so awful. I take the last one today and I’m still suffering. I hope this isn’t garbled as I feel so bad I can’t concentrate .I will never take these again

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took it for three days until I suddenly experienced severe chest pain and shortness of breath. It went on for hours before I decided to see the doctor. I was immediately sent to A&E. I had three ECGs and a Chest X Ray which showed no problems with my heart. I was given a different Antibiotic to try. Chest pain went as soon as I gave them up. It's going on my notes as a no go medication for me.

I got severe headaches, my face was red, I felt tired, was coughing and was feeling lightly nauseous. I could only take it for 3 days for  UTI because of the side effects.  My medication was switched.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):NEVER again. I thought I was going to die. I was prescribed this drug for a UTI. 2 tabs a day for 3 days. 2 tablets in I was in so much pain in every inch of my body I couldn't walk. I felt like I had a pain in my chest every time I needed to take a breath and my headache was the worst I'd ever experienced. My vision was blurry and I was constantly thirsty despite being hydrated. I felt queazy and my skin was so sore to touch I couldn't even pull on my trousers.
