I know everybody is different but after checking about others users experience there is obviously a huge issue with side effects and this medication.I thought if I did manage to sleep I'd never wake up again. I tried pain meds but nothing touched this. I phoned my doctor and was told to stop taking them My  experience was so horrendous I'm frightened to take anything else again.I'm hoping that once it's out my system I'll feel better but 4 days on I still feel some effects.

Blue lips, feet on day 5. very difficult to breathe. Oxygen levels were below 80 and pulse rate dropping. Called doctor and told her I was stopping. Took several weeks to recover from the above side effects. CT scan showed lymph nodes in lungs were all swollen. Had to have been from macrobid. I will never, never, ever take this antibiotic again.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I fell into a such a zombie state every day all day, on the 7 day regimen.  I thought I was going to die.  This drug should be banned imo.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Prescribed for 7 days my first time taking them.  Didn't read reviews until day 2 as I started feeling odd. I felt as though I was coming off antidepressants my anxiety levels went into overdrive. Headaches, pain in joints/muscle. It was fine day 1, but as days gone by  I felt unsafe to drive but after 2 hours of taking meds it hits you. Heart races with shakes. Abdominal cramps feeling sick as well feel jittery and impending doom feeling. I have continued to finish course as my last day today ... I am so poorly that I couldn't tell you if my UTI is gone. It was a blessing off work this week as I doubt I could have gone in. Won't be using them again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is the 1st time Ive taken this medication Macrobid.  All seemed well the 1st few days.  I have one more day left of the meds and my UTI seems to not be gone.  In fact it seems to be coming back.  The burning and frequency have returned. And I'm on the next to the last day of the meds.  I won't take it again! !

After attending a walk in clinic today for a UTI, I was prescribed this drug and was told to take it twice a day for three days.A few hours after the first tablet, I had loose bowels. Then nausea began. I accepted that this was a stated side effect.Hours later and still very queasy, I took the second dose just before bed. Roughly 2 hours after taking the pill, I woke up feeling shaky, dizzy and very sweaty. Within minutes I vomited excessively and the vomit was very thick and heavy. After vomiting, I went extremely dizzy, close to passing out. I am not going to continue with this medication as the side effects are excessive.Further, when I was prescribed this medication, I was not informed of such side effects.I was asked who I live with - I explained that it is just myself and my 2 year old. Knowing this, I believe that it was ill advised to prescribe such medication as the side effects could easily have impacted on my ability to ensure my child was safe.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Why do they make this drug?  I felt like I was in a coma every day.  This is poison.

Where to start. I have fibromyalgia and I got a UTI. I usually never take medication, even Tylenol. After 2 doses over 2 days, I started throwing up. Then the headache began. I stopped taking them and found a bunch of other terrible stories from people with similar experiences. I’ve read it works I treat the UTI but the side effects are NOT WORTH IT and I AGREE FULLY!! today my elbows are aching and my shoulders and neck are beyond stiff. I’ve been sweating then freezing. My chest feels like little pains and like it’s shaking. PLUS, antibiotics that kill UTIs and others kill the good flora bacteria in your gut. They do not give us access to all the clinical studies and info they’ve found on small number of groups for a very short time. I will be in search of all natural remedies and I will NEVER TAKE THIS AGAIN!!!

My experience with this medication has been absolutely terrible. I’ve had bad stomach cramps, terrible diarrhea (I never get diarrhea) shakiness, extreme tiredness. I will never take this medication again once I’m done with my dosage

I took nitrofurantoin for a UTI/Bladder infection. I had severe back pain before receiving this prescription and the pain persisted until the end of the third day of my dosage, but by the fourth day I was feeling totally fine. I also had horrible headaches the first two days and felt nauseous when I took it on a semi-empty stomach. I tried to take it with probiotics but didn't every time, I felt like the days where I did have probiotics helped the side effects.

I had this medication prescribed for 7 days for a UTI . I RARELY ever react to antibiotics in a bad way, however, I’ve been taking it for 3 days and I’ve had the worst night sweats and nightmares . It is the weirdest thing. I cannot continue on this medication.

Took this when I got my first UTI, thought it was a yeast infection but the symptoms were only when I peed and some bad itching. Had a good experience overall, just took my last pill. Symptoms are gone but I had a lot of gross discharge while taking it and dark urine, kinda green? No other symptoms, feel pretty good. Not a 10 cause I felt the itch pretty bad the whole time but it’s mostly gone now, didn’t like the discharge either but what can you do?

This drug had me so sick was in bed for 7 days. I was vomiting, had diarrhea, headaches, extremely weak to the point I actually fell down. I didn't even have strength to roll over in bed, my daughter had to help me. Of the fourteen tablets I was given I managed to take only five. And with each one I got worse until my daughter finally realized it was this medicine.

I was prescribed this medication and by day 2 I was nausea, vomiting (until there was nothing but green bile coming up), diarrhea, body aches, chills, sweats, and very weak and extremely cold. I have had UTIs in the past but this was the 1st time I have taken this antibiotic. I had to stop taking then for my own health. I felt like I was going to die if I took one more dose of this stuff. I wouldn't say the pill is horrible but it is not for me. I need another type of antibiotic.
Awful medication I've never felt so ill. I couldnt bring myself to take the last one pill, this medication floored me. Never again.

Leary of taking this.. It's about 50/50 on these reviews. But definitely freaking me out.. I was curious as to why the last time I had a UTI years ago 2012ish.. They just gave me amoxicillin. And that went fine. This stuff sounds crazy as anything

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Had a UTI and my doctor prescribed Macrobid twice a day for 5 days. I’ve had zero side effects and my UTI went away. I’m an overly anxious person so online reviews worry me, but all of these reviews seem to be from those that have had obvious allergic reactions to Macrobid and these are likely pretty rare or they had another illness that coincided with their UTI?

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I did not read any reviews before taking this  and had no idea what was happening to me.  Thought I had lyme disease.  The muscle pain and headache, and dry eye sockets - I realize felt like very severe dehydration - despite drinking a lot.  People who say we are over-reacting just got lucky.  If you have things to do - don't take it.  Can't get out of bed.  And I am usually a work horse.  I am working anyway - with headaches, eye strain, and general flu symptoms.

I had a UTI that came on very quickly. Called the doc and he sent in this RX for me. Took 1 pill and about 9 hours later (overnight) had immediate relief! Still feeling good and will finish the rest, you are supposed to. No side effects at all for me. Grateful for this med!

Got a UTI. Uncomfortable but not nearly as bad as I felt after taking this drug. I agree 100% with others who have posted their negative experience. I am suffering from extreme stomach pain, chills, night sweats, headaches and general pain all over, this is  after taking nitrofurantoin for 2 out of 7 day  prescription. Not sure I can keep taking it because I am feeling so horrible. I rarely if EVER have a bad reaction to antibiotics.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Read Macrobid prescription label and was pretty anxious, considering this happened the day I  needed this when I was leaving for a weekend desert trip in 90 degree weather. I made sure I stayed more hydrated than usual, I took in A L O T of water and a kombucha a day! *whew* Taking it with probiotics and a meal sure eased side effects people have listed below! Wasn’t at all bad, UTI is gone and a desert trip was a success!! TRY AND STAY HYDRATED AND TAKE IN AT LEAST SOME PROBIOTICS. Macrobid is good if you aren’t dehydrated. Okay, good luck!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was nervous to start macrobid after reading reviews but I never experienced any bad side effects. I didn't always have time to eat so I would take with milk and at night I made sure I sat up for half hour after taking before laying down. UTI symptoms cleared up fast after starting this medication. Took 100mg 2x daily 1 week.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Please do not take the bad reviews seriously. Talk to your doctor not the internet. I have extreme anxiety. The thought of taking an antibiotic scares me to no end. But the knowledge of understanding that a UTI will get worse without treatment was enough for me to just take it. I have had no side effects from Macrobid. A little anxiety but that is just my nature not from the pill it self. Please don’t be afraid to take this medicine. It has helped me so much. Take it from someone who can not stand antibiotics.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Headache, lower back pain, chills, sweats, upper abdominal,pain, even my hair & teeth hurt. 3 days in 7 day treatment.

I recently took this nitrofurantoin medication prescribed by an urgent care doctor for cystitis. In about 30 mins the room was spinning as if I had vertigo and I vomited the entire day . The stomach cramps was so severe and I was sweating so much from my body rejecting it. I only took it for one day and I will never take this medicine again .

I took this drug nitrofurantoin in Feb 2019 for a UTI. After about 2 doses I got so ill I ended up in the ER. I spent 3 days hospitalized. The chest pain, neck pain, sob  and fever. I was so very ill. The Dr, seemed to think it was just the infection.I t took me several weeks to recover.   September 11, 2019 I took it again for a UTI. Same thing again visit to the ER. Pain Soa chest pain , neck pain and fever. Hospital 2 nights rounds of steroids and antibiotics. Heart rate up and blood sugar up, vomiting.  I am planning on a follow up with my Drs. this week. There is no doubt that this medication caused me pain and so much anxiety. If I had known that this medication was the the caused this reaction of course I wouldn't have taken it a second time.  To say the least I'm furious and I wonder if my body will ever recover.

First time using nitrofurantoin/Macrobid. They’ve gave me a 5 day course - taking 1 pill twice a day (1 every 12 hours). Basically I would wake up at 6am-6pm for my intakes. (Effects- strong -Sleepy, itchy parts of my body, anxiety and dizziness)  I’ve always suffered of UTIs

I started taking Macrobid on Friday 13 Sept for a UTI, by the 14th late afternoon I couldn't walk. Went to bed couldn't even get into my pyjamas, husband had to help. Felt like the worst flu symptoms ever, aching all over, shivers and felt cold, headache, felt nauseous but didn't vomit, did have stomach upset. My breathing was affected, coughed if I breathed too deep. Rang 111 they told me to wait for on call GP to ring back. He rings at 11pm and tries to tell me it's the symptoms of the UTI.  I told him I'm stopping this medication and I wanted a different antibiotic. Still in bed at 1pm Sunday from 5pm yesterday. Still feel very weak, but nothing like I did last night. I'll never take this drug again.

I was prescribed 1 tablet nitrofurantoin twice daily for 3 days. I went to the walk in centre on the last day of the antibiotic course as I was panicked and concerned severe symptoms I was having were part of the water infection and needed more antibiotics. The nurse tested my urine to say no infection was now present so the antibiotics worked!...but I have felt extremely sick, with major loss of appetite, chills and shakes and had a panic attack in the walk in centre waiting room which was mega embarrassing. I have just taken my last tablet at dinner today and had lower abdominal pain so back in bed with dizziness too. Hopefully from tomorrow the symptoms will subside. So glad to learn I’m not alone!

UTI: I started taking this terrible nitrofurantoin tablet for a UTI, it was prescribed by a nurse at my surgery  as there was no appointment with Doctor available.  I’ve never felt so ill in my entire life. The side effects started off with the worst pulsating headache I’ve ever had no paracetamol or ibuprofen would get rid of it, then I started to get really bad aching in lower back and backs of my legs to the point I could hardly walk. The painful headache was so bad and then I started to feel really dizzy and nauseous and then the vomiting started this has all happened in the space of 3 days, and I’m not feeling any better I’ve stopped taking them as no one should have to go through this nightmare!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had a bit of an upset tummy with the first dose but that was my own fault for not taking with food as instructed. Besides making me a bit sleepy I’ve had no problems with it. I asked my doctor for a diflucan as a preventative as to avoid the vaginal yeast infection which for me is major side effect from a strong antibiotic. Honest reviews are important this is an antibiotic we’re talking about, I found it worked really well for me.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This was my first time taking this medication for a UTI.  The first two days were not bad but in day three I couldn’t seem to get comfortable and I couldn’t figure out why.  The tops of my legs were burning and aching and I found it hard to find a good position.  Of course I looked to see if Macrobid can cause this and sure enough it can.  I haven’t taken the medication for about a week and I am still having the aching and burning in my legs.  It is awful.  I will never take this medication again.

I took one of these tablets earlier.  I’m on a antibiotic course for 3 days at two tablets a day, for a UTI. However I am already feeling a bit nauseated and after reading some of your reviews I think I’m going to ask for something else as it’s sending me into panic mode!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid has been great.  I was worried when I read the reviews but as I took it I didn’t feel anything different ! The only side effect was my tiredness and my GERD was worse . The key is to do what’s called an antibiotic sandwich... Eat a FULL MEAL , take pill, then a light snack afterwards . Also do not drink caffeine as it will cause terrible anxiety ... you have to take every 12 hours so I did 7am and 7pm . Taking too close to bed is what made my GERD bad as it stirs up your stomach acid and you are laying down on it.  My symptoms were cleared up on day 3 but I still have to take 4 more days. I  was also allergic to Bactrim so this was the alternate ... TAKE THE PILLS

This nitrofurantoin is the worst medicine I have ever taken. It has left me with hives/ rash extreme itching that started with my hands then moved to my chest and other parts of my body including my vagina.I have been continually nauseous and light vomiting. Horrible, I would definitely take something else!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had apparently taken this antibiotic when I was younger, and haven’t taken it in years. This was the first time I needed it for a UTI, and I am experiencing unbearable stomach and abdominal pain, watery diarrhea and dizziness like no other. Only on the 1st dose on day 2 and I ran back to urgent care to stop the out of control side effects. I’m allergic to most antibiotics so I’ll be curious in what they give me. All I can say is thank goodness for the internet because I’ve wondered for years if I was the only one experience these side effects and I am not the only one out there.

I'm on my 6 day of this medication I'm doing good. I  had a little headache, I have no more bad sensations caused by UTI. Before nitrofurantoin I felt horrible couldn't walk, felt like everything was just falling to the bottom of my stomach. So this med work good for me.

Please do not take this medicine.  I wished I would have looked up the reviews before taking this.  I  asked the doctor if it had any known side effects and she told me no. I have taken this drug for five days and on the last day I experienced weakness, my whole body felt like a dump truck was on top of me. The second day I experienced chills, headache, hives, fever and increased heart rate along with the weakness. I went back to urgent care and was told I just have a virus and when I told her to look up the side effects she said well, maybe it is the drug but I'm leaning towards a viral infection and told me to go home and take motrins.Here I am still feeling awful  and about to go and see my primary care doctor.

I was prescribed 50 mg 4x day macrodantin for UTI. I had severe nausea, diarrhea, headache, dizzy, confusion, eye pain , severe fatigue & sleepy. Did clear up UTI but I am so tired, & constipated 5 days after finishing meds.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is the worst medicine ever. I’m currently on this medicine the rest of my pregnancy bc of my constant uti and kidney infections. First off it makes you extremely nauseous all day. Last night it caused me to go into a panic attack and I was hyperventilating so much that I barely made it to the bathroom to throw up because I was so lightheaded, heart palpitations, the shakes, had to pull over from taking my daughter to school because I was throwing up vigorously. Asking my doc to get off this.

I’ve had a few UTI’s in my life but never treated with Nitrofurantoin, and never again.  My first dosage was Thursday p.m. and by Saturday evening I pretty much wanted to die. Horrible stomach pain/cramps, headache, drowsy, malaise and I kept on taking it.  It’s now Thursday and I woke up to a pounding headache and vomiting. Today was my last round which I’m not taking.  The UTI was way easier to deal with than this experience.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I haven't experienced any of the side effects others have mentioned earlier. After just one dose of Macrobid, within hours all of my noticeable symptoms were virtually gone. It may have helped that I got my prescription at the first sign of a UTI, before the pain became terrible. Zero side effects during treatment.

So confused by all the comments for this and other antibiotics.  I was put on this med for a UTI and it worked wonders!  No side effects and I felt better w/in 2 days.  Unfortunately 2 weeks off the med and my UTI is back.  Now they prescribed Cipro so I've been comparing reviews and it just seems everyone reacts differently to every med.  Haven't started Cipro yet, but very nervous to after reviews, then again I would have been nervous to take this med had I read the reviews first.

Was prescribed nitrofurantoin for UTI one 100mgs tablet twice a day. First dose ok taken after eating, 2nd dose taken after evening meal, felt OK for about an hour, then began to feel shortness of breath, decided to go to bed.Had an awful night, shortness of breath, nausea, bloated & upset tummy, headache, profuse sweating, felt absolutely terrible, very frightening, thought I was going to end up in hospital.Next morning spoke to doctor, she said to stop taking them & she would prescribe something different. Haven't collected them yet as still feel too ill, hubby will pick them up for me.Feeling very tired & have had to do this about 3 times as finding it hard to concentrate and string a sentence together. I will NEVER take this awful drug again, it's just not worth the debilitating side effects,

I tend to get UTIs often due to hysterectomy. Have taken Macrodantin in the past & itcleared up the infection w/some nausea. This time I  have had severe nausea, trouble breathing, congestion, & extremelyTired, confusion, fog.7 days 50 mg 4x daily.

This medicine is the worst and should be avoided. I am a healthy 40 year old. Within a few hours of taking the medicine I felt sick, dizzy, got aches and pains over my body and had a awful headache. I have been very weak and bed ridden.I have had to stop taking the medicine after the third dose as started to vomit uncontrollably. I don't suffer from allergies or have had side effects to medication before. This is the first.I'm surprised this medicine isn't banned.

Had  a few side effects  in the beginning but after I got used to it I had no problems what so ever. Please do not listen to people who leave bad reviews as this may potentially scare you away from a good, very effective antibiotic.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I am 45 and I am currently taking Macrodantin to treat a UTI.Never have I ever felt so bad taking medication.bI initially  thought my body was fighting the infection but it wasn’t the case.I am now on taking the medicine (4x100mg/day)I feel very tired, very dizzy, I have diarrhea. My breathing is not great and  I feel a bit confused ...definitelynot myself. Also pains in my fingers..I can't wait to finish the treatment tomorrow.On a positive side the infection seems gone as urine is clear.

I can't get through a decent night of sleep without having sharp abdominal pain, nausea and constipation. I'm not taking this anymore. I took the medicine at 8 and its 1 am and I'm in pain. I'm calling the doctor as soon as they open the office.

I am a healthy, athletic 19-year old college student. I don't normally get sick, but when I went to the doctor for my UTI, I was prescribed nitrofurantoin and Azo for the pain when I pee. I took the first dose at night, didn't sleep, had an awful nightmare and barely slept because of the intense pressure in my head. I woke up, had to drive an hour to a city and I had to stop 20 minutes in, to turn around because I almost crashed 3 TIMES. I was so dizzy and exhausted, I couldn't see the cars next to me, nor could I speed up because my body was just a zombie!! I had such a bad headache that I had to come back home and pass out on the couch immediately. I couldn't concentrate. I have classes and there's no way I can take this and be 100%. I'm calling the doctor tomorrow, this is ridiculous.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took Macrobid with a meal like suggested, within 2 hours I was projectile vomiting literally the worst medicine experience of my life

Went to the doctors with a UTI and she prescribed Nitrofurantoin  for a week.  After 2 tablets I was feeling not well. Felt nauseous very bad headache and shivering. After the 3rd tablet was feeling really bad being sick and bad headache so went to bed. Rang up my surgery and spoke to a triage nurse who changed my perscription to Trimethoprim. Never again will I take Nitrofurantoin.

This drug has ruined my life. Going on one week of it in my system I can't get out from the bed. I'm weak, dizzy, throwing up, my hands and feet are numb. I've been to the ER once and they  took me off of it. 3 days now clear of the drug and the symptoms are worse then when I was on it. Do not take this! If you have been  prescribed it stop using it immediately and of course discuss this with your prescriber!!
Took 50 mg  nitrofurantoin capsule every 6 hours (3 a day). It cleared the infection but the gas was horrendous, glad I live alone!

Worst medication ever. Should be banned.I came down with symptoms of cystitis on a Friday, was told that my urine test result would not be back until Monday, so was given a three day course of this toxic substance - nitrofurantoin for a suspected urine infection. Started feeling ill after the 5th tablet, vomited up the 6th tablet. Followed by burping, nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, and the worse indigestion ever. It is now two days, since my last tablet was violently ejected by my body. Still feel pretty gross.Turns out I didn't have cystitis at all!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was put on this Macrobid because I had a very bad UTI. I tried all the natural remedies first such as cranberry juice, cranberry supplements and D-mannose. To no avail I called my physician and they prescribed Macrobrid over the phone. I was given doses to last for 5 days. The first day, the symptoms of the UTI subsided a little but I could still feel a little pain. Second day I started to get a dull headache and felt sleepy and.... the UTI was seeming to get worse. Third day the UTI pain went away but I kept the headache so I took some aspirin to counteract that. I am on my 4th day, I feel way better. I will finish my prescription and hopefully will be good from there.

The first day on nitrofurantoin for a UTI, I felt fine, on the 2nd and 3rd day I felt like I was dying. The worse anxiety and panic attacks ever.... not to mention the diarrhea, cold sweats. I feel weak and tired. I decided to stop last night.  The worse antibiotic I've ever taking by far.

I wanted to update other users as I returned to my doctor. She performed a thorough examination and even though I am 12 days on from my last tablet, she believes the aches, pains and infection I have picked up are all linked to the after effects of the drugs. I have also been having nightmares and experiencing acid reflux. I am reassured that my symptoms are linked and should therefore start to calm down. My doctor said it’s not unusual for some side effects to last for 6 weeks, but they should gradually lessen. She also said that stress can trigger further side effects. I was very emotional after being checked over as I have spent the last 3 weeks feeling awful and was starting to think there must be something very wrong with me. As it turns out, it really has just been the nasty side effects of a drug that has been like a poison. I hope this reassures others who are in the midst of similar experiences.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):As other people have said, this is also my first time leaving a review for any prescribed medicine.  I went to my UK doctor as I was having  flare up symptoms of a UTI.   I was prescribed Macrobid (6 capsuled to be taken over 3 days).  I am pretty annoyed I didn't read these reviews before I took the first dose because I probably wouldn't have bothered, or I would have stopped taking it immediately and not continued thinking I just had a flu type bug!   I haven't had the dizziness other people have described but that is probably because I haven't left my bed for 3 days!!  I have had vomiting, headache, the worst aches and pains in my back and legs and generally feeling like I am dying!  I am so angry about it as I have had to cancel some seriously important meetings thinking it was just an unfortunate illness and now I think it's this poison.  Not happy!!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Went to Dr  as I had blood in my urine, no other symptoms, culture says UTI. Prescription Macrobid. First day I had a massive headache that hurt so bad I cried. 2nd and 3rd day nausea and diarrhea with increased anxiety. 4th day dizziness so bad I felt like I was sleeping drunk, sitting to standing was a nightmare and walking was difficult. Felt flu like the entire time. It has been 2 weeks since I stopped taking it. Had to go to the dr again because the dizziness did not go away. Now I have an inner ear problem that needs to be fixed with therapy. Still feeling sick. 2 panic attacks and still an increase in an anxiety. Random periods of time feeling like I can’t catch my breath. Will never ever take again. Also, fun side note, still have blood in urine.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):The first day and first dose of this antibiotic, I felt horrible. Completely out of it, pounding headache, dizziness, having trouble focusing, and this all kicked in at work. After taking the second dose a few hours before bed, I didn't feel the side-effects as strongly as the first time. I'm on my second day and first dose of the day, a few hours in and I don't feel as bad, but I'm still having a little fogginess and trouble concentrating. I have five days worth, 10 capsules in total. My UTI symptoms have subsided, and the side effects of the antibiotics don't seem to be as bad. Maybe it was my body getting used to the first day and dose, but those side effects were unbearable! Make sure you eat something hearty or greasy, wait 20-30 mins after eating to take it. IMO if you're experiencing itchy skin, you're having an allergic reaction. This stuff does have some uncomfortable side effects, but it does work quickly to fix the issue. 6/10.

I took this nitrofurantoin antibiotic for two days.  The second day I woke up exhausted ... felt like I had a low grade temp with chills...figured it was still the UTI.  I was exhausted all day.The second night I was up every hour with severe muscle cramps in places I've never experienced before.  I am use to some cramping in the night...and one little cramp pills take care of it right away.  I took a few cramps pills  and it did no good.  I've stopped the medication all together. It's the weekend, so hopefully I won't be making myself worse, but it's too scary to continue.

Started taking this nitrofurantoin Tuesday, its Thursday now and I feel like my UTI is gone but I feel soooo horrible! I feel like I did when my EBV was active! On and off headaches, extreme fatigue, stiffness and soreness in neck and throat, all I want to do is sleep! I'm not finishing this medication and will be calling the doctor in the morning. This stuff needs to be banned!

I was on Nitrofurantoin for 7 days 2 pills/day. After 2 days I noticed a decreased visual acuity while reading road signs and books, but no eye pain. This has last until the end of the treatment. Vision problem is a rare side effect apparently. I also experienced small nausea, but at the 7th day after lunch, I had really bad nausea, so that I had to stop working and go home to rest. Nevertheless, after the first day of use my cystitis symptoms disappeared. So the medicine worked well but not without side effects.

I’m so worried. I was prescribed this drug for a UTI, but  after taking my second tablet I thought I was going to die. Chills, fever, sweats, headache and a hacking dry cough that wouldn’t stop. I was struggling to breath, and sat with a friend rather than sleeping that night because I was so scared. Really I should have asked for an ambulance, but I was so out of it - and couldn’t speak for coughing.I’ve been to my GP who switched me to something else, but a week on I still have this horrible tickly unproductive cough. I honestly think it’s damaged my lungs. I’m so worried. Reading up on nitrofurtoin there are many, many similar cases. Please: Do not take this drug. I can’t stress enough. I can’t believe it’s prescribed by the NHS. I am 54 years old, healthy (or was) and have never had an allergic reaction to anything. This was poison and if my symptoms don’t improve I’m seeking legal advice.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I started this 11hrs ago... Let me tell you, it has made me feel horrible. Dizzy, trouble concentrating, exhausted, my face feels odd, hot/cold, and I'm nauseous. I am terrified to take another dose. Unfortunately, my culture showed this antibiotic to be most effective. But there is no way I can take 5 days of this. I just looked up reviews and saw that I'm not the only one feeling this way. I have only had a bad reaction to Erythromycin (vomiting) many years ago. I don't recall an antibiotic ever making me feel this way before.

I tried to take Nitrofurantoin 100 mg  for a UTI.  When it was prescribed my only symptoms were urgency and burning.  I took it as directed. The next day I woke up with a headache. I took the 2nd dose and continued to get sicker throughout the day. The headache got unbelievably worse, nausea, loss of appetite.  I slept all day. By the 3rd day I was throwing up water. Stupidly I didn’t make the connection.  I have taken antibiotics without problems.  I went to the ER. Another urine test. I had  significantly more bacteria and blood in my urine, and a fever of 101.4. had not started the new rx yet, but oddly started feeling much better as the day past.  24 hours after I took my last dose and the headache, nausea and burning stomach were gone. Nitro  made me horribly sick, and allowed the infection to grow.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed a 7-day course of Macrobid for a UTI. The first four days I felt fine and my UTI symptoms improved. Day 5 I suddenly began to experience headache, racing heart, and severe anxiety. Day 6 was even worse, I felt jittery and confused. I did't connect it to the Macrobid at first because I'd experienced no side effects the first four days. I felt like I was going crazy and was afraid to drive.  At that time I thought maybe my symptoms were due to my blood pressure, even though I'd never had those issues in the past. Finally it dawned on me that it could be side effects from the Macrobid so I searched the internet and found several forums where people had commented and had the same issues I did. I did not finish my last two doses of Macrobid. I've been off the medication for six days now....my symptoms have lessened greatly, although I'm still having episodes of anxiety here and there but to a much lesser degree. I will NEVER take this medication again.

The doctor prescribed these for a bad urine infection,  saying that if I had any problems,  I should inform the surgery and get alternative antibiotics.  I took 4 of these horrible capsules; after the second one, a bad headache came on, with very bad diarrhea  I was so exhausted and couldn't think straight. I was still having to rush to the toilet frequently.  I had a very bad headache in the night, very bad leg cramps, I felt very sick. This morning I couldn't face any food but took my morning dose with some milk. My headache got worse and worse, my heart was racing, I felt a terrible pressure in my skull and I felt full of anger, my vision was  very blurred (more than usual). I felt dizzy, I couldn't walk straight, I just felt awful, very unwell and not myself at all. Avoid this medication.

I had  Kidney pain, suspect acidosis irritation from Fanconi syndrome.  I went to Emergency for  kidney pain, they did a CT scan for kidney stones and advised me to see my doctor for antibiotics because of leukocytes.  The doctor prescribed Nitrofurantoin, even though my bladder felt fine.  Urine was clear but highly acidic.  Immediately after my first dose my urine became a thick milky white.  It has been a month and I am still recovering.  My urine is improving,  but still some flesh floating around.  Fanconi syndrome symptoms are much worse.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had horrible stomach pains, loss of appetite and severe itching all over my body after just two pills.  Awful!

When I read others' comments on this antibiotic, honestly I thought they should harden up.  However, I have had to give this drug up after three days myself.  I had a terrifying night of 8 1/2 hours shaking with cold, so much so I could not walk up the hall to go to the toilet.  The nausea, also, has been soul-destroying; it seemed to go away after the second day but came back with a fury and I had to stop eating and go back to the doctor.  I agree with everyone who has said this drug might work but it has far too serious - widespread - side effects to be on the market.  I salute everyone who has tried it and failed as I know how it feels.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After taking 2 doses I got so sick..nausea, vomiting, diarrhea.. and extreme fatigue.. and the worst brain fog in my life. I had to stop.. but my doctor then said the next best thing is Cipro.  Oh my goodness!...Cipro is the worst.. ruptured tendons?   I think no!So it was a fight to get her to prescribe Bactrim!  Sad to say Doctors listen to the drug sales people rather than reading this review space!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):The Macrobid DID work for the UTI, but my, oh my,  have I been having a bad time. I have been so, so nauseous since my first dose. I have actually vomited from the nausea. Severe diarrhea as well. It doesn't seem to matter what food I take it with. I can barely eat, I have no appetite and feel horrendous. I have also developed serious neck pain and aches in my arms, which can only be attributed to this drug as nothing else in my life has changed.I won't be taking this medication again, if I can help it. This has been the longest week of my life.

I was on Amoxicillin for my first UTI which was perfectly fine for me. No side effects. This time I am on nitrofurantoin, I wake up every morning burning up and feeling nauseous.  I've had a non stop headache for 3 days now. This is the worst antibiotic I ever had. I will never tell my doctor to give me this again. I have til Sunday to take it still and I really want to switch to Amoxicillin.

I am a 63-year-ol male and was diagnosed last week with a UTI. I'm not exactly sure of the cause but it came on after overdoing it working in the garden in hot weather. I went to the doctor after 2 days and she put me on a 10-day course of nitrofurotoin. The side effect I feel is that I have very low energy and I need to go and lie down from time to time; but if the body is fighting an infection I am not surprised by this. I walk the dog each day (at a slower tempo than normal) and continue with some basic yoga. The symptoms of the UTI are much better but I have a few days of the course of tablets.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After reading the reviews which I often do before taking any meds, I was feeling horrified at taking these for infection.  Anyway had to hope and take a chance with these. I always had food first and to be very honest can’t say I had any reactions to the tabs.  I  have been on them now for 5 days so definitely better now but will finish the 7 day course.  I have had very bad reactions on other tabs so don’t doubt people react differently. Xiproflaxen was a nightmare for me so always try tabs but don’t look for side affects good luck

This antibiotic nitrofurantoin is rubbish. Felt ok after 1 day of taking it and then on day 2 the pain has come back with vengeance . I was only prescribed a three day course so can’t see this working at all.

So far I have been on this medicine for 4 days out of a 5 day period. I have been taking them every 12 hours with food as directed but it gave me horrible recurring stomach aches for hours that made me lay in bed.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I feel like I am dying on day 2 I take anxiety medication as well I feel dizzy sick not like myself

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid was the worst experience I have ever had with any drug. Breathing problems developed on day 2 of 3 day course, coughing, palpitations followed by chills and fever. Unable to do anything for three days and thought I had a very bad dose of flu which is all you need when you have cystitis, but no it was just the side effects from this antibiotic. Never again!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After just a couple doses, I am extremely tired and sleepy, and having bad dreams from which I wake up agitated and anxious.  Taking macrobid for the first time now after a horrendous UTI/bladder/kidney infection treated with cipro left me with another cipro-resistant infection.  I am allergic to penicillins, mycins, and sulfas, so antibiotic choices are limited.  I am posting just to reassure others who might have similar experience and wonder if it is the drug, which is how I myself ended up on this webpage.  I am going to stick with it, and hope side effects don’t get worse, and it finally rids me of this infection and accompanying severe abdomen and back pain.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid was the worst medicine I had for a UTI . I only took one dose before bed to start with. I felt dizziness, sweating, heart racing and weakness. I don’t think I will be taking anymore. I will be contacting my doctor for something else. I would not recommend. I had a UTI before and had a different medicine that did not give barely any side effects except diarrhea and a little nausea if you didn’t eat.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Went to the doctor yesterday, got prescribed macrobid for a UTI.  I took the first pill with dinner, went to bed.. woke up took the second pill with a little but of food and I've been sick with nausea since 7 this morning and it has not let up since, calling in the morning to get them to change it, I've never been so sick in my life.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve had a ton of UTI’s in the past but this was my first time being prescribed this medicine  Macrobid and it has provided me the fastest relief (and thank god because this is the WORST UTI I’ve ever had). I took it at 2am and by 8:30am the urgency had already reduced drastically and the blood in my urine disappeared. Other medications would take over 24 hours for any kind of relief. I will ask for Macrobid in the future!!

I was prescribed this medication for a UTI and discontinued use due to:-nausea-explosive diarrhea-coughing-fatigue-weird feeling and taste in my mouthIt did seem to work on the UTI (we'll see when I have my follow-up appointment), but the side effects are not worth it. I was given a 10 day course and stopped on day 4.

Have been on nitrofurantoin for 3 days , and the UTI is no better than the first day. I drink nothing but water. I just don't understand why it is not helping. Have taken Bactrim and it would clear it in 2 days but I always still took the 7 days. But a month later it comes back. I wish the Dr would figure out why it keeps coming back.

This nitrofurantoin antibiotic did absolutely nothing for my UTI. I ended up back in the ER. I usually had been prescribed Bactrim in the past for UTI’s & that seems to be the only antibiotic to completely rid infection for me.

I'm a 43yo femaile, prescribed nitrofurantoin for UTI. Waited 3 days for urine culture results before being given this. I'm allergic to most antibiotics & was VERY concerned & anxious about taking this, especially after reading the reviews. As a person who is VERY sensitive to medications & their side effects, I can say that for me, the side effects of nitrofurantoin were very few & tolerable. Some nausea for the first hour after taking each pill. I ate before taking each dose & made sure to drink a LOT of water. Slight dizziness after first dose. It went away quickly & I am prone to episodes of vertigo. Did get a headache after an evening dose. Motrin helped with that & it may have been from my seasonal allergies, not the RX. Likely the mild itching can be attributed to the same. No other issues to speak of. It does turn your pee neon yellow/green. Lost the very last pill down the sink, so only ended up taking it for 4.5 days. At home test indicates infection is gone. While everyone is different, thisnitrofurantoin  medication worked well for me.
Did not help my UTI at all

Started taking this as the UTI I had started to make its way up to my left kidney and I was horrendous back pain with it to the point I was holding in tears. As soon as I took within 1-2 hours the pain subsided. Am on 2 tablets a day for 3 days and I have 3 tablets left to take. No side effects what so ever and couldn’t be more pleased with these tablets my UTI feels like it has already gone. These only cost me £9 on prescription in the U.K. to buy and I would certainly buy these again if needed.

I am very sensitive when it comes to antibiotics as well as having a chronic condition that I have to keep in mind when taking them as well. When I went in for my UTI, I was prescribed Macrobid for a VERY small infection. 100 mg every 12 hours for 5 days. I took the first pill that night with food as recommended and within an hour I thought I was having a heart attack or a stroke. My heart started racing, I was extremely dizzy and I could not catch my breath. I decided not to take the next pill because the side effects were so severe but I woke up and was nauseous as well as having muscle spasms in my hands, feet, arms, and legs as well as vertigo. I refuse to take anymore of this drug and am currently waiting on a call back from my doctor while feeling like a ton of bricks fell on my whole face. This is the worst drug I have ever taken.

I am on day 4 of this medication. The only side effect I've had was an upset stomach when I took on an empty stomach (it states clearly to take with food). Morning I take with 2 pop tarts and evening with a scoop of ice cream. No more stomach upset.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):As a person allergic to Bactrim/Sulfa. I was prescribed Macrobid/nitrofurantoin by Urgent Care. Within the first 2 doses, I developed red bumps and hives all over my body (took Benadryl to control my body’s reaction). Unfortunately, we went camping, so I didn’t have direct access to my PCP. Instead I spent 7 days on this antibiotic without relief in symptoms.  When I was able to get home to my PCP, I was put on Amoxicillin and after 3 doses my symptoms were gone....however because of the second round of antibiotics I’m stuck taking antibiotics for a longer duration. I wish UTIs were easier/quicker to culture as my UTI wasn’t sensitive to Macrobid.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I'm usually a natural remedy girl. D mannose usually nails this, but I'd run out and it's first time ever I had kidney infection.Reluctantly picked up nitrofurantion, I'm glad I hadn't read the effects prior to taking as I maybe would have avoided these.. But I took them and had no issues at all. Was also drinking plenty of turmeric ginger and black pepper and in large fluid doses. And taking with food. Only had 6 capsules over 3 days and worked a treat for me. No side effects noticed except wanting to sleep lots. However I am on no other medication and food intake is very clean and healthy.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have had this prescribed on three different occasions for UTI over past couple of years and each time I wound up with worse symptoms ( higher fever, chills, stomach pain and severe headache). I always assumed it was just not correct antibiotic for the bacteria, as results from culture had not been received. The last time I gave this a try, my fever increased and my white blood cells went sky high, as did my blood pressure and heart rate.  I was hospitalized for three days to prevent sepsis. It took quite awhile to get heart rate and blood pressure to get back to normal. Obviously, this antibiotic doesn’t agree with me for some reason. I will have it listed as a med I am allergic to, as I’ve had these miserable symptoms each time I’ve tried it.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This medication gave me the most severe headache imaginable. It felt like someone had pounded stakes in my temples. I couldn't get off the floor to call for an ambulance. The pain was so bad I passed out. I had a slight headache the first day. The second day was unbearable. Beware!

By the time day 3 of taking this rolled around I became horribly nauseated, headache, stomach pains and cramps, dizziness, no energy, and then by day 5 add in fever and chills. I went back to my doctor who said immediately stop! Its been 2 days now since not taking and I still feel drained, headache, foggy, and dizzy. NO WAY will I ever take this again and would recommend others stay away!

I have always been healthy but was given this drug for a UTI. 4 days later I ended up in the ER with severe stomach pain. They said I have elevated liver enzymes and to get them checked again that  week. The next day these quadrupled when I got checked and everyone was so concerned they did a CT that found nothing. After two days of stopping treatment my levels dropped by half. I am going back today for another check and praying no permanent damage.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid worked for the UTI, but crazy side effects. Super vivid nightmares. And patient has mild bipolar. Psych symptoms were all over the place. Something she hadn’t experienced in a long time.  Wouldn’t recommend it for anyone in psych meds.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Their reviews really drove me away and I didn't want to take the pills since I hate taking medication. However I eventually decided I needed to take it. Symptoms cleared up after the second pill and I didn't have any side effects until day 3 when I woke up  at night with some nausea. Went back to the doctor the next day and he prescribed be some zofran to take an hour before the macrobid. I did that and managed to get through all 7 days with only a little fatigue, some headaches, and some excess flatulence. Trick is to take it with food and lots of water and follow it up with a probiotic 2 hours after.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was given macrobid for a terrible UTI, it worked like a charm for me. I'm sensitive to sulfa and quinolone antibiotics, macrobid was a god send for me.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I read these reviews and was terrified to take this. I have anxiety; so even if I didn’t have the physical side effects, I was pretty sure I would have psychosomatic ones after reading all the negative experiences. I’m also scared of antibiotic resistance, and hate taking them to begin with. I  procrastinated for a week because I didn’t want it to make me feel terrible. Also, my UTI wasn’t bad, I didn’t have many symptoms. But I knew it wasn’t going away, so down the hatch the Macrobid went. Well, I didn’t feel terrible. Absolutely no side effects. I know everybody is different, but if you have an Rx for this, don’t be afraid to try it because chances are you’ll be fine. It’ll do it’s job (which it is).

My second day of taking this medicine and I feel horrible, short of breath, heavy breathing, pains all over my body, have a headache.  I will stop it and call the doctor tomorrow.  There has to be something that doesn't make me feel this ill, for UTI. I never had a bad reaction from any medication until now.

I can't seem to focus at work this medicine also gave me an anxiety attack! I took this medicine 3 times in 8 to 9 months because the UTI never went away I was experiencing the same symptoms cloudy urine etc about 1 month later, thought it was me but I highly doubt

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This was hands down the absolute WORST experience I've come across with any medication. If you can get an alternative definately opt out this one. Felt like taking poison.After taking a pill for UTI hours later I began feeling off and dizzy. Huge anxiety spikes for no reason and trouble concentrating. My face and neck began to get puffy and felt all bruised over. My whole body then began to get sore inside and out. Felt like my body had gotten into a car crash at that point. Had to stop taking the medication and 24 hours later stomach is still doing backflips.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took it for 3 days had severe migraine, palpations, anxiety, numbness and tingling in both arms down into my fingers!

Got my nitrofurantoin medicine on Friday, I had some weird dreams on Friday night. I've had a but of an upset stomach but it's really helped me. I'm not in pain anymore and I'm not peeing every two seconds.

I took two tablets on first day all fine, following day I woke to feeling extremely ill, feeling sick then being sick violently for hours to the point of vomiting bile for several hours...was a warm day and I was wrapped up in bed with blankets and thick socks as I was shivering and freezing cold however I felt red hot. I couldn't get out of bed in 24 hours got up for one hour, and that was a struggle. Pounding headache where I resorted to taking something for it which I never take medication. I felt dizzy within 10 hours of taking last pill sickness subsided but felt so weak, and burning hot ...stopped taking this antibiotic never again going to the doctors to tell them not to give me this again it was AWFUL.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Horrible side effects! Omgoodness.. Just 2 days on this and I had to give it up.  I had to hold onto the walls when walking I was so dizzy, I also felt like I was gonna pass out, and vomit at the same time and felt hot like I had a fever.Never again. Dr then put me on cephalexin (keflex brand) and no side effects except a little tiredness. PS. D-mannose is amazing at preventing UTI's. Better than antibiotics. I had just stopped taking it.

Hi there I'm a 48 year old male and been on this terrible drug for four days now, after diagnosed with a UTI and the side effects from nitrofurantoin are horrendous. Bloating, strange pain in abdomen, nausea, coughing, unable to focus properly, lack of appetite, bloody diarrhea and the worst severe night sweats.I can't get out of bed let alone work and feel ill every single day. My advice is avoid this medication. I literally feel like I'm dying!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was given the Macrobid medication for a UTI. I took the first dose with food before bed and woke up feeling ok. I took the 2nd dose that morning and headed into work. On my way into work driving I began to get dizzy, I thought I wouldn’t make it in. I arrived then I immediately left work- went home with a headache, nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, and body aches. I took another dose before bed to try and power through, then woke up the following morning unable to move, again with flu like symptoms. My doctor told me to stop taking the medicine. And I will NEVER take it again.  I am currently a day and a half off the antibiotic and still experiencing nausea, diarrhea, aches, and exhaustion. It is getting much better as time goes on, but I feel as if I wasted time on a medicine that made me even more sick, when I should be UTI free by now.  My stomach is still so sensitive from this so I cannot even go back on another antibiotic yet. Still have a UTI, missed 3 days of work, and feeling awful.

I’ve been nauseous, drowsy, and very anxious while on this medication. It’s been really difficult to get out of bed in the morning as all I want to do is sleep. All of a sudden I became very anxious with no other explanation, and it’s been extremely uncomfortable and counterproductive to feel this way while I’m  at work. I’m on day 5 of the medication, and so far I haven’t felt any change with my UTI (although I still have 5 days remaining of treatment). I’m going to suck it up and continue treatment,  but no one should feel this way while on medication; especially when you have to take it for 10 days.

I was prescribed nitrofurantoin at an Urgent Care for a UTI.  The first pill made me slightly nauseous.  After the second pill I started feeling extremely fatigued and woke up with a pounding headache.  After the third pill I started having chills and a high fever along with extreme fatigue and body aches.  I stopped taking it.   24 hrs after taking my last pill my temperature shot up to 104.  It's been 2 days and I still feel awful.

First it was bactrim that caused tremendous joint pain in my left shoulder. They wanted me to finish it and I refused, so now, I’m on this nitrofurantoin antibiotic. I have a large itchy rash on my left shoulder, a headache, tired and dizzy and feel totally out of it. What happened to the other antibiotics we used to take that had minimal side effects? This is really bad.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Been taking this Medication for 3 days, my 4th day starts today and I have had such a horrible time with this medication. My anxiety has been the worst its been for a while and I have started having night terrors again:( The nausea has been horrific and I feel so unwell, there's this horrible taste in my mouth too. Not sure whether I should keep taking it or not, but please be careful anyone taking it as I'm sure these symptoms could be far worse for someone else.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have taken several antibiotics for UTI and Macrobid is the only one where I felt the need to write a review and also search for one as I was praying the EXTREME side effects I have been experiencing were not uncommon. I took Macrobid for three days and each day the symptoms got worse. I have been completely nauseous ever sinceI  started taking it and my heart rate has been scary high. Yesterday my heart rate got so high my whole body was shaking and I got blurred vision as I was driving and had to pull over on the side of the road and have someone come pick me up because I was too unwell to drive. The vaginal irritation got worse on day 2 and I’m still waiting for that to subside. I would so much rather have a UTI then feel like I am literally about to die. This has been one of the scariest weeks of my life as I thought something was seriously wrong with me until I read some of these reviews. If your doctor wants to prescribe you this medicine you may want to ask for an alternative.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This has been the worst experience of my life with any antibiotic. I took my first pill about 8:30 pm last night two hours later I start having chills. All through out the night I have the sweats and the chills and my stomach felt a little messed up. I get up to get ready for work this morning and start having severe diarrhea. Had to call out because I couldn’t get off the toilet. It’s now almost 1pm and I feel AWFUL. Still having diarrhea, slight headache, my body feels so weak and like I was hit by a truck. I wish I never took this pill I feel like I poisoned myself.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid got me very sick - shivering, vomiting, and fever. I  am still very dizzy 4 days in bed. Not good at all

I was prescribed a weeks course of Nitrofurantoin and had the worst side effects on day 2 onwards. I thought I had caught a stomach bug. I suddenly started to feel nauseous, extremely weak, sleepy, shortness of breath, stomach, chest and neck pain. I even passed out! When I realised it was the antibiotics I stopped taking them after consulting my GP. I still feel unwell 2 days after my last tablet. I will never take these again unless they did smaller doses perhaps but its currently put me off and I would ask for a different one next time.

I was prescribed a weeks course of Nitrofurantoin and had the worst side effects. I really thought I was dying, pounding head and neck ache, cough, breathing difficulties, nausea, bloated stomach and stomach pains. When I realised it was the antibiotics I stopped taking them. I still feel unwell 2 days after my last tablet. I will never take these again. They should be withdrawn.

I have been using the nitrofurantoin antibiotic for 3 days now for a UTI and I believe it is working very well . I have some side effects like a fever, cold chills, and drowsiness, and my urine smelling really bad . I had an emergency c section and had a catheter for 1 day . My doctor recommended this antibiotic because I am breast feeding and it is not harmful to my baby . I still have the fever but it comes and goes . There are a lot of negative reviews but everyone reacts to medicine differently. I would take this again I just don't like the side effects.

I got nitrofurantoin prescribed at urgent care for suspected UTI. I’ve never had UTI before. I told Dr Im sensitive to medications & some affect my kidneys. Dr said I should take nitrofurantoin I’ve not taken before-he prescribed me usual dose. Got home 11PM, took one tablet. By  7AM I felt like a truck had run over me. For next 7 days I felt exhausted. Had to cancel going to work.  Couldn't get out of bed. Had to cancel trip.  On the final day taking it (every12hrs) red lump with dark purple center appeared in my groin area/pubic region. Never have I had any lumps anywhere thank goodess, until after 14 cumulative Nitrofurantoin. Started to panic then knew it had to be Macrobid. I researched lumps, lesions Macrobid side effects  & it says severe side effects Nitrofurantoin is red lesion with a purple center. After 4 days of completing Macrobid lesion reduced by 90% but still small bump under skin & small red with tiny purple center bump on top of skin. I think Nitrofurantoin should be stopped by FDA

I’ve been on nitrofurantoin a few times and it certainly fixed my urinary tract infection problems but it makes me SO tired and then punches me in the face with nightmares. Insane nightmares where I wake up crying every time I sleep and I feel like I need to sleep 12 hours a day at LEAST. I end up stuck in bed too terrified to sleep but too tired to move.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid was no good for my 91-year-old mother UTI. It also  made vaginal irritation worse, caused dizziness in which increases her risk of falling. It also did nothing for her UTI. It did seem to help in the very beginning which is why I'm not giving it a 1.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve never had to write a review for any medicine. But this has been so far the absolute worst experience of my life . After 2 days of taking the Macrobid I felt like I have really bad morning sickness. It would fade and I could go about my day . But the nausea kept progressing everyday . I took the pill twice a day for 4 days . I was suppose to take it for 7 days. But I landed in the hospital and they advised me to stop taking the medication since my urine came back clean. They gave me some Zofran  to take home to help cope with nausea. I’m currently on 4th day of not taking it . And the nausea has slowed down a little bit. I ADVISE ANYONE TO NOT TAKE MACROBID. I’ve had to miss 3 days of work

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):The doctor diagnosed me with a mild UTI yesterday and prescribed Macrobid. A few hours after taking it I felt my brain wasn't fully functioning, very slow. After that I was beginning to feel more and more nauseous which ended up in full blown violent vomiting, which was continuous for hours. Now it's the next day and I have heart palpitations, busting headache, extreme tiredness, still can't hold anything down. I've never been this sick from any other antibiotic and I only took 1 dose. The doctor prescribed me different antibiotics, I couldn't continue the Macrobid with these abnormal side- effects. I never write reviews but thought to share my experience this time because of the severe side- effects this medicine can have. It might work great for some people but not for me

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is the first time I’ve been prescribed Macrobid antibiotic for UTI, and it’s the first time my UTI didn’t clear up. I took the medicine as prescribed, yet it did absolutely zero for me. I did not have any side effects at all as others have mentioned here, but for me it just simply didn’t work. Hope this review helps others, I’ve never written a prescription review before, but I felt compelled to share this experience as it’s the first time I’ve had to go back to the doc for a second script to clear up the UTI. These are not fun, and having to hit up the doctors office a second time around was definitely not fun. Take care everyone

I was prescribed nitrofurantoin for a UTI which was diagnosed from a urine test by an emergency doctor. At first my nitrofurantoin side effects were not too bad, although early on it gave me cold hands and a tight chest and a strange cold unwell feeling. Initially these passed off quite quickly but the longer I took it, the longer and worse the side effects became and lasted.  By the end I was feeling very ill and I  still felt very ill for a week afterwards. It is ten days now and I still feel poorly. I managed to feel a bit better by having an antihistamine each morning to counteract it. I would never take it again. My UTI meant I was peeing out red-brown urine and as that is also a side effect of taking nitrofurantoin, so I did not know if I was cured or not. But a week after stopping it, I am back to peeing red urine again. So not cured. I am about to try co-amoxiclav . (I was taking 100mg nitrofurantoin twice a day for 7 days. I am a 70 year old woman, otherwise very healthy.)

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Awful drug. Took Macrobid for 3 days for UTI where I couldn’t eat as I felt so sick, slept nearly all day every day as it made me so tired. I’m on the progesterone contraceptive pill it has interacted with that and I’ve had a period for 3 weeks non stop since taking these antibiotics (after 5 years of no periods). Three weeks on from taking these I have been depressed the whole time, not wanting to get out of bed and felt teary and everything was making me cry. I thought I was going insane as you don’t expect medication to still be effecting you 3 weeks after you have finished taking it!! Gave me twitches in my hands too! Need this medication out of my body ASAP!! Trying to take charcoal, probiotics and milk thistle to recover my body from this awful drug!! Do not take it, ask for a general antibiotic instead as it’s so not worth the side effects. I’d rather suffer from the UTI than ever take them again!!
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Soon as I started taking Macrobid my anxiety was out of control !!! I can’t sleep... my heart is racing ... I can’t wait to be done taking this medication !!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took 3 doses of Macrobid and became violently ill, with nausea, diarrhea, the shakes, headache, anxiety, heart palpatations - you name it.  I thought I was going to die.  It has been awful.  I'm on day 4 of trying to flush it out of my system and get my life back.  Take anything for a UTI but this  - it shouldn't even be on the market.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took macrobid for bladder infection The first day felt pretty good but second day I woke up with numbness across my left rib cage into my backI stopped taking it but numbness is still there and tingling in hands has startedHow long before macrobid is  out of your system

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Had been prescribed this Macrobid last year without obvious side effects. However was prescribed again yesterday and having issues..  Became very nauseated, severe chills and dizzy within an hour and got headache too.  And also had some strong palpitations later. Managed to keep pill down with gingerale and crackers.  Tried to take second dose this morning, but it came back up within 15 min, so not sure how much made it to affected area.  Have call in to Dr.  to call in something else.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took first 2 Macrobid pills, started running a fever of 101, headache, vomiting, could barely function, felt sicker than I ever have.  Worried that infection had gone to kidneys.  Never been to ER in my life but decided to go because I was scared. Tests all came back normal.  Sent me home & said to finish my course of Macrobid.  Felt better when I got home (about 12 hours since last pill), was finally able to eat, took next dose of Macrobid.  Shortly thereafter I was violently ill again.  Next day after close to 24 hours since last pill I started feeling better, was able to eat. That’s when it dawned on me: drug side effect I found sites like this where people had same experience.  Next day the hospital called to check on me.  I told them what I discovered; said they never heard of Macrobid causing reaction.  Bottom line, I got sick after taking it & got well after not taking it.  My symptoms match the manufacturer’s list of side effects.  What else am I supposed to think?

This drug nitrofurantoin  for a UTI robbed me of a week of my life. I was prescribed a 7 day course (2x a day) and have had such EXTREME fatigue, I have needed to sleep 12 hours a day and STILL feel tired. I have had past issues with anemia and thought it must have returned but this was far more severe and more swift than any past experience with anemia, I found this site and read that others have also slept 10+ hours and still feel exhausted and realized this must be the culprit. Never ever ever again. Can barely keep my eyes open or finish my thoughts.

My new Dr. prescribed (generic) Macrobid for a bladder infection last Thursday. I had been fatigued on Saturday, and this Sunday morning, I still had pain, despite taking Pyridium. I called the Dr's answering service, and got a prescription for a sulfa-Trimethoprim (generic for Bactrim & other brands), and am starting to feel better after taking 1 pill.Newer and more expensive medications aren't always better, sometimes they're worse.

Feel like I am a lab rat and survived a lethal injection. This antibiotic has me so sick I can't even get up from bed. Freezing cold, headache, whole body hurts, every joint and limb, chest pain. Definitely suffered bone, joint and tissue damage. Caused sporadic nerve pain. Feel better on ibuprofen but as soon as it starts wearing off feels like the flu. Extremely hungry, eating a lot and very dehydrated. Completely immobilized and unable to work. Hope I never get a UTI again because I cannot bare the pain and agony associated with this antibiotic. Aside from it feeling like it was killing me though, it worked and the worst of the side effects disappeared along with the UTI.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had zero side effects with macrobid and it cleared up my UTI quickly. I almost didn’t take it because of the bad reviews, but am glad I did.

My doctor ordered this nitrofurantoin script for me after Bactrim was unsuccessful at clearing up a UTI/KIdney infection. Almost immediately after taking the drug, I felt lightheaded and tired. Later in the day, my head started pounding which later developed into a horrendous migraine. I started to panic when I felt I incredible pain and pressure in my jaw, ears, face, throat and nasal area. It felt as if someone had shoved their fist in my mouth and was pushing the bridge of my mouth through my skull.  The pressure was unbelievable. I contacted my doctor, then my pharmacy. The pharmacist told me to stop taking the drug and suggested I ask my doctor about Cipro as an alternative. I've never experienced adverse side effects from a medication before and suggest that you use caution when taking this drug. I'm currently taking Codein to minimize the pain from the antibiotic. What a disaster!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I normally would write off side effects as "everyone has a different experience, don't try to discourage others", However-I have just finished my second day of the Macrobid dose for my UTI, and I have never in my life experienced such unbearable side effects. Within about 2 hours of my first dose yesterday morning, I started feeling extremely nauseous, weak, brain fog, and horrible vertigo.I had to call out of work yesterday and today, almost unable to make it out of bed to use the bathroom or anything. This feels worse than just about any flu I have had. Not to mention, my joints all feel like someone hit them with a crowbar. I can't take this anymore, stopping the med ASAP. I don't even care about the negative effects of stopping an antibiotic prematurely at this point. By all means, take your doctor's advice, take this if it is prescribed to you- but listen to your body!!! Call them about any overwhelming side effects, don't put yourself through absolute torture if you don't have to

Took  nitrofurantoin in April 2019 did not clear up my urinary tract infection, but noticed the back of my neck got really tender and hurt from inflammation.  Did not connect it to the medicine.  Doctor prescribed same medicine in May 2019 because I never really got over the infection from April 2019.  After 2 doses on day 1 I started having the same problem.  Developed a knot of inflammation directly on my spine at the base of the back of the neck. It was painful called doctor for new prescription. By day 2 after not taking this prescription the knot is almost gone with a little tenderness.  Had put in my medical records to never get this medication again. So just if you are taking yourself and wondering , yes the neck pain or knot is a side effect of nitrofurantoin

I was hoping to quickly resolve my UTI as I have used this drug before without side effects. I've taken half of a 3 day course and feel SO ill.  Headaches, cough, no appetite, fast pulse - sometimes tachycardia, retching. I feel as though I am drip feeding myself poison - so I have stopped taking it.The urine frequency is better as is the bladder pain but I feel dreadful in other ways.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is my second time using Macrobid and NO SIDE EFFECTS whatsoever and it works like a charm. It takes two full weeks but works great.... WOULD Highly recommend for any type of bladder infection !!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid was absolutely awful. I’ve never had side effects from any medicine so severe. I woke up this morning with chills, three blankets on and still shivering, body aches, blurred vision, piercing headache, dizziness, and extremely fast heartbeat. At least the symptoms of my bladder infection have disappeared, but I’d honestly rather deal with that then have to keep taking this.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had a sore throat every day I was on this medication, my skin was drying out, pretty much any body moisture dried up. The second to the last day of my meds I had hives all over my  back and sides as well as my thighs. I also began having episodes of light headedness and sweating profusely on the face...I was clammy and nauseated. I took my pill before bed and that night was the worst, I was hot and sweaty, nauseated, clammy in the face, I almost passed out. I became constipated, my hives were still present , something didn't feel right inside, possible heart palpitations and I felt very jittery and sick. I thought that I may need to go to the ER. In the morning my left arm was a bit numb and elbow and wrist have been stiff and achy today. My hands were tingling and going numb as I was driving and despite my not taking my next pill I have still felt nauseated and a bit light headed all day. I will never take this drug again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have never written an review for any medication in my life. But oh my goodness! This was a horror. As soon as took my second  Macrobid pill , I became so ill that had to call an ambulance. I had extremely high temperature, chills, pain in my legs, chest. Had all the side effects and some aren't even mentioned on the their leaflet. Can someone please tell me how long will it take for symptoms to go away as it's next morning and I'm feeling so unwell still. Thanks

Avoid at all costs. Have suffered UTIs for over 20 years now and all other antibiotics worked nicely. NOT Nitrofurantaine though. Would usually be back at work the following day after starting antibiotics for a UTI but these antibiotics have made me feel dreadful, severe stomach pains awhile after starting them, bloating, gas, bad headaches, nausea and real fatigue. In short, they have made me unwell, just with different symptoms than those I'm being treated for. I'll be refusing them point blank at the Doctor's if ever offered them again. Awful medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I got a UTI and was  prescribed this medicine. At first when I would take it, it was fine. However, after the first day I started to get extremely tired and would sleep SO MUCH. Then I started getting a bit of heart palpitations, but I disregarded it. After about 3 days in I took it at night ( with food of course) and a little after I started to feel TERRIBLE. I got heart palpitations, a fast heart beat, shortness of breath, and major anxiety. I knew it was this antibiotic since I was feeling just fine before taking it. I barely slept that night and when I woke up I still had the terrible symptoms, so I finally went to my doctor and she took me off it and we’re getting my urine tested again to see if it went away. In just 3-4 days of taking it I had such bad side effects and it’s been a day since taking my last dose and I’m still feeling  sick

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Went to Urgent Care for UTI and they prescribed me Macrobid. I had experienced severe headache, nausea, leg cramps, itching and blood pressure is really elevated. My UTI is minimally better after having taken for three days. Stopping it today.If I could give it less than a 1 rating, I definitely would.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was given nitrofurantoin (macrobid) for a UTI, I have taken one tablet a couple of hours ago and since then I've had a constant burning feeling plus stabbing pains and a heavy feeling under my right ribcage and a throbbing under the left ribs. Seems silly after just one single tablet but I will not finish the dose going back to docs ASAP demanding something else even though I will have to pay again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this Macrobid antibiotic for a UTI. It has horrible side effects really bad. The first day I took It I had really bad headaches. The second day I started to feel like I was dying no joke. I wasn't sure what was causing it so I kept taking it now today is the 3rd day and I feel so sick I can't even get out of bed. I have had to call into work twice now because I have no energy to do anything at all. This is the worst experience I have ever had on an antibiotic.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Used macrobid  for my UTI twice a day for a week and my side effects were after my first dose, I had mild heart palpitations for approximately one minute.  The second night using it (third dose) I had an onset of diarrhea immediately after but it did not last the rest of the night.  I had occasional ambient queasiness but did not feel ill from this.  No side effects were what I’d consider severe, I’d call them mild, and none that lasted the duration of the treatment.  This is not a perfect medication, but so many of the other reviews sound so scary.  Please don’t be afraid to try this medication.  If you do experience bad side effects, please don’t stop the course without consulting with your doctor. This leads to antibiotic resistant bacteria. Do not flush pills down the toilet; please dispose of them properly or turn them into a pharmacy. Otherwise they will get into water and also lead to antibiotic resistant bacteria.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took 3 doses of Macrobid  for a UTI and started feeling awful a few hours after the 3rd dose.  I had fever of 101, body aches, chills, sweats, nausea, vomiting, couldn’t hold down any food.  The next day I was delirious, could barely form a sentence, so weak I couldn’t sit up.  My hubby was so worried he called 911.  They tested my blood to make sure the infection hadn’t gone to my kidneys — kidneys were fine.  My urine was all clear.  They gave me IV fluids so I felt better.  The next day sick as a dog again.  Home healthcare doc came.  They ran a flu swab test —negative.  They said if not better tomorrow, get admitted to the hospital for a full workup. They all told me to complete the 5 day Macrobid.  I didn’t take it today because I would have thrown it up.  Now that I am reading all these reviews I am thankful I stopped!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took 3 doses of this antibiotic and my arms are numb and tingling. I am having trouble remembering anything and feel jittery and anxious. I haven't slept in 24 hours. I feel worse now than I did having a urinary tract infection.  This medication is horrible.  I won't ever take it again and I'd advise others to take with caution.

After taking my first tablet of Nitrofurantoin for a UTI I began vomiting and couldn't even keep water down. After the first day I felt so unwell and spent 2 days in bed with a fever and shaking and my whole body was in pain. I then started with a chronic headache and a tight chest with a cough.
