I was utterly exhausted and felt so unwell. I've now got tingling in my fingers. I've never reacted to any antibiotic like this one and urge anyone not to take it

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is the worst medication I have ever taken. It was very effective in eliminating my UTI, but I had a severe adverse reaction to it. I felt extremely nauseated, couldn't eat, and vomited when I got out of bed. Then I started to have a dry cough and difficulty breathing. I also had a fever, night sweats, and chills. I was worried it was the flu or a kidney infection. I called my doctor and she told me to stop taking it, and all of my symptoms went away. I have never felt so ill while taking medication in my life. I didn't know I was allergic to it but I'll avoid it at all costs from now on. I can't believe they give this to pregnant women.

I suffer from recurring UTI’s and was put on Trimethoprim the last time which worked fine. Went into the walk-in centre on Sunday and was prescribed a 3 day course of Nitrofurantoin. Took the first dose on a full stomach as instructed and started getting a sharp pain in my stomach and a strong urge to go to the toilet. I also felt extremely fatigued. I have IBD so I just assumed I was having a flare up. The next day I started getting flu-like symptoms, fast heart rate, nausea, severe migraine etc. and was sent home from work. Had no appetite that night and could not sleep (kept waking up with night sweats). I am back to work today, and I feel even worse. Left arm is itchy and red, and my hands are feet are tingly and they feel so weak. No matter how much water I drink my mouth feels so dry and I still have a slight burn and discomfort when I urinate. Have a Dr’s appointment in an hour so hopefully he prescribes me something different. Never again.
Never ever again. I will make sure never take this  drug in future.  It is bad.  I stopped taking it as it had so much side effects

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Unlike the other reviews on Macrobid, I only had some bad headaches and my sleeping  schedule went off a bit the first few days of taking it - otherwise nothing. It cleared my UTI up, and I felt fine.

I had to stop this medication  nitrofurantoin after two days of it.  It gave me 101 fever, chills, nausea, headache, abdominal pain, dizziness and accelerated my heart rate  and extra 20 beats per minute  at rest.  Got relief after 12 hours.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I've never felt so strange in my life.  This nitrofurantoin has caused severe agitation, anxiety, rapid heart rate elevate blood pressure, and mania.I was in the ER for over 24 hrs. Lots of tests but all came back normal.  I was off the macrobid for 36 hours.  I took my night time dose and went to sleep.  Took the daytime dose and thought I was going out of my mind.  I had enough energy to run a few marathons and then to harvest potatoes.  The only relevance I can think of is that I had audio hallucinations when prescribed years ago, and there is a link between chronic infections/use of antibiotics and mania.  Would appreciate feedback
Was prescribed nitrofurantoin 3 times for my UTI's. Each time I ended up in A&E with more acute pain and symptoms. It simply doesn’t work.

I am a healthy, happy, energetic 77 year old.  I was prescribed nitrofurantoin for cystitis two 100 mg tablets daily for 7 days.  The 2nd day I experienced nausea, headache and extreme fatigue.  By the 3rd day I also experienced vomiting, tingling in my fingers, irritability, stomach pain and fullness and pressure in my head.  I stopped taking the drug after 3 1/2 days and started on amoxicillin.  The nausea and tingling stopped 1 1/2 days after stopping the nitrofurantoin but the headache, pressure and extreme fatigue continued for another 15 days.  My doctor said that the drug is not known to cause these symptoms.  I have never researched a drug or written any review but felt compelled to let people know that this drug does cause all these symptoms and more.  Judging from the number of reviews it would seem that these are not rare occurrence.  Perhaps the pharmaceutical companies are not being completely honest about the side effects this drug causes and the multiple of people that are affected.

I've been having recurrent UTIs for quite a while and am prone to them due to the surgery I had. I had a lot of abdominal pain and pain while urinating. I was prescribed nitrofurantoin but it unfortunately didn't work for me. First day my symptoms didn't change much. 2nd day had a bad headache and was so tired slept most of the day and was shivery. By day 3 I was in so much agony with the pain I couldn't sleep so had to call the doctor to change to a different one.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I suffer from chronic urinary infections due to Crohn's disease. I've been on many different antibiotics most of which have caused nasty side effects and were not effective . Macrobid is the only one that works for me . It's fast and has caused no side effects at all .

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took nitrofurantoin for 14 days for a pretty severe UTI. My symptoms went away almost completely after 2-3 days of taking it twice a day, so that was pretty great. Only thing to complain about was slight nausea after taking it, but that was completely manageable. All in all, not the worst antibiotic I've had to take, but the process wasn't anything to rave about either. I was just glad that my terrible UTI was gone!

I had nitrofurantoin for UTI and literally after the first day of taking the pill I vomited. It felt terrible the head aches as well as, making me very emotional and sensitive. I feel really sick even typing this review got a bubbly belly. The medication definitely works but I'm not into the side effects I feel sad.

I'm 18 and have had on and off fevers from my UTI and was told I would start to feel better after a couple days on the medication. I felt absolutely terrible with my fevers getting worse, nausea, fatigue, dizziness, night sweats, diarrhea, loss of appetite, muscle pains and an overall constant feeling of weakness. After 2 days of feeling like absolute garbage I called the nurse who prescribed it and she said I don't have enough dosages in me yet to start feeling better so I kept taking it thinking the side effects were symptoms from my UTI. A day after that I no longer had the constant urge to pee but I still had all the same side effects that  I first had and continued to have on and off fevers. I could not keep my eyes open at school. If I hadn't looked up other people’s reviews I would have kept feeling like I was crazy. I haven't been able to work out and have had to miss some school. Grades have worsened just in the time I've been on this and I still feel like garbage. Stay away from this!
As soon as I took this I started feeling very sick and I felt sick all day. I also had a terrible tummy ache and headache. I ended up phoning the doctor and was prescribed something else.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This medication made me so weak, nauseous and made my chronic migraines worse. I won't ever take this again. I can't wait until Friday when hopefully the symptoms will disappear since Thursday is my last day on it.

Nitrofurantoin worked perfectly for my urinary tract infection and I had zero side effects and I often have drug side effects. I can’t take cipro for example. Cleared my UTI within a day and of course, I took for entire time frame. I recommend this drug. As a precaution I also took probiotics for women and ate plain yogurt.

I was given nitrofurantoin as a maintenance medicine for UTI.  After a year I developed fatty liver and stomach ulcers.  Immediately the medication was discontinued the liver started to return to normal.  I don't drink alcohol the condition was non alcoholic fatty liver .Will never take another of those tablets again .

After taking two nitrofurantoin  pills as directed, I woke up the following morning coughing, shortness of breath and vomiting.  I have seen another Dr and she had to put me on steroids, penicillin and a cough syrup.  This drug caused Nitrofurantoin induced lung disease.  3 days after taking that pill, I'm still very sick.  If continues , I will have no choice but get to a hospital.  I truly believe this pill is awful and needs to be removed from the market.

Absolutely awful drug. If I didn't come here for reassurance I would have lost my mind. I have ringing in my ears, had flu like symptoms, depression, anxiety, aches pains, couldn't stop urinating. I have lost 2 weeks of my life on these tablets. Went to an A&E twice both times my observations were fine. Bloods came back fine. I am a week now from stopping my 5 day course of two nitrofurantoin 100mg tablets and I am just about managing a 15 min walk and a shop yesterday. Avoid at all costs if you start feeling any negative affects. My hair has been falling out , my scalp still tingly. Gives you the worst paranoia . I couldn't sleep was having bazaar dreams, total loss of appetite, just started coming back last night. Never again please.
Macrobid made my symptoms urinary tract infection a little better but I never felt them go away completely ,now a week after stopping a 5 day Macrobid treatment and I am in searing pain again.

So I was giving this medication for UTI definitely made my neck muscles stiff, was feeling a little weird, had stomach cramps and I  could barely sleep my symptoms did clear up on my last two dose however they seem to be coming back very mildly.  I hope it not round two.  Plus my anxiety was out the roof. Well after looking at the reviews with similar symptoms as me I'm sure it is all the side effects

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m generally terrified of medication, and this one has some horrible reviews. Be aware it can cause pulmonary reactions as well as neuropathy. I would never take this daily for prevention, but I took it when I was pregnant as well as this week. No side effects, but I would consider myself lucky. As with any medication weigh the benefits and risks. My bladder infection only got worse after a month of trying natural cures, so I really had no choice. If you have to take it know everyone doesn’t have side effects, and if you do immediately stop the medication and consult your doctor.

Took this for a UTI and I feel worse than before! UTI cleared from 2nd day but I feel dead. My body is aching and I have not left my bed in three days. The pain I’m feeling is something I have never experienced in my life, it’s excruciating!  I don’t understand how this medicine is prescribed while there are safer alternatives!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):So far the infection seems to have gone away however, I have had severe heart palpitations since taking this medication, I've been off of it for over 24 hours and still getting them. I also had an itchy stomach and headache periodically while taking it. Wouldn't take it again.

Nitrofurantoin for mild UTI, two tablets a day for 5 days. The nightmare began on 2nd day with nausea,  soft bowel motions, shortness of breath, hyperventilating,  couldn't think clearly,  legs aching, so lethargic, unable to drive, couldn't work about, heaviness in my chest, oh & depression came on me. Usually if depression comes it brings a reason, this came as itself, scary. Never Again will I trust. Cranberry n water for me.

I was put on a 3 day course of nitrofurantoin for a UTI. After 1st day felt nauseous, dizzy  and lethargic - just absolutely awful. By the time I had taken my 5th one I was feeling like the room spinning like a helicopter blade. I'm not taking my last one as I just could not go through another day like yesterday. Have had pneumonia and 2 pregnancies which were nothing compared to this feeling. Never ever again.

I had a mild UTI with both mild pain on urination and frequent urination. I was prescribed a 7 day course of the prolonged release capsules of MacroBID Nitrofurantoin.  I did not have any sickness nor the fatigue others have described and it seemed to clear up the infection 2-3 days after starting the course as the pain on urination stopped.  However, I found that after day 3 the frequency of urination increased again and I had more prolonged general discomfort only being relieved on urination (no pain on urination however).  This turned out to be the Nitrofurantoin causing localised irritation and the discomfort faded and disappeared within days of the course finishing.  Having said that I do have sensitive skin in that region and have to avoid scented soaps etc.  I am mentioning this in case there are others reacting the same and don’t realise it may now be the treatment and not the UTI causing the symptoms.  I am now 3 weeks on from completing the course with no relapse.

DO NOT TAKE nitrofurantoin especially if you have colitis or stomach issues!  Avoid like the plague. Nearly killed me.  Had UTI but also have colitis.Practicing nurse prescribed it. 100g x 2 daily for 7 days.1st dose cleared the UTI. 2nd dose hell began.Thinking it was not related carried on. Started Monday.  By Thursday was in A &E on 2 drips anti sickness and electrolytes.  4 days of violent shakes. Vomiting.  Hot cold flashes. Can't drink water. Can't eat food.  Tongue white as snow.  Sleeping all day. Back pain.  Brain fog. Nails felt like they were detaching from beds. Soiling myself. Hospital Dr surprised this was prescribed when I had colitis.Spent half day in hospital. Couldn't work for week. Blew my guts out. It's Sunday and I stopped Thursday.  Still weak. Sleeping all day. Muscles 'flipping' in my thigh. Head still fuzzy. Still disorientated. DO NOT TAKE ESPECIALLY IF YOU HAVE IBD.Worst medication. I am 54 year old lady.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICATION!!!   I AM a healthy, active person. I almost never get sick. The night I took the first pill I was nauseous. I woke up the next day and thought I was getting the flu. My legs ached and I had the chills.  I continued to take the pills thinking I had the flu. I fainted on the second day.   I got red eyes, rashes on my legs, heartburn, headache, neck ache, stomach ache.  I look like a zombie.  Finally I thought, this is NOT the flu. I contacted my doctor and she said, 'stop the pills'.  I did a day ago but I am still feeling horrid....headache and blahness. Normally I work out 3 x's a week, am active, work full time. All I can do now is sit on the couch.  I am so sorry I took Microbid.  I hope this drug will eventually get out of my system.

Ive been one of the lucky ones! Been taking nitrofurantoin for 5 days now for my UTI and had barely any side affects, just a bit lethargic and dizzy and nausea but that is it! Pain stopped a day after starting taking it! But probably wouldn’t use this medicine again because of side affects..

Horrible! I had 3 days for a UTI and felt unwell - which I put down to the UTI.  I had a few days of feeling well and then thought the UTI was returning, had a positive dip test and neck pain so the GP prescribed it me for a week for high UTI/kidney infection.  I am on day 4.  I think my UTI is clearing - I no longer have the associated back/kidney pain.  However the side effects are quite awful. I feel tired, lethargic, spaced  out, dizzy and not with it.  Not too bad at rest but when I’m walking I feel all out of sync and lightheaded - I couldn’t go to work like this, nor could I drive.  If I wasn’t allergic to penicillin I’d ask my GP to swap.  I feel really really unwell.  I’m sleeping OK but having very bizarre dreams and waking up with a pounding heart and random anxiety - which is unusual for me... it’s a means to an end but it’s not an antibiotic I’d take if I felt there was an alternative.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I've never done a review but wanted to on it because of so many bad reviews. The macrobid is working great, no side effects that I’ve noticed from the meds.  But before starting the meds I did have a severe UTI with severe pain in my stomach and back as well as nausea, dizziness, cramps, muscle weakness, headache and flu like symptoms all from the UTI infection. I felt like death. Which has all subsided since taking this medicine. I’ve read a lot of bad reviews but I think everyone fails to realize that UTI and bladder infections cause a lot of symptoms plus everyone reacts differently.   I would take this again!

After previously being hospitalized for a UTI I am now on Macrobid for to  prevention  UTI's. I took one pill and later that day, I was cold. Took my 2nd and currently I am laying in bed, can’t think with flu-like symptoms, watching my fever. It hurts to even get out of bed and physically walk. I have never experienced this much pain before! I have to take this medication for 3 months!! I hope and ray I can survive!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Worse experience I've ever had, I'm pregnant so I thought maybe it was the pregnancy causing all these bad symptoms but nooo it was UTI. Abdominal pains, throwing up, diarrhea. I didn't even want to move. Took my last dose today and I couldn't wait. Yes it cured my UTI but  the side effects were the worst.

I was diagnosed with a UTI on a Friday afternoon and given this med. no fever prior to dr visit. Took one pill immediately and another 6.5 hrs later. 3 hrs after the first pill began the migraine behind my eyes that didn’t stop for 4 days and the chest pain like a mild wheezing & no appetite. It only got worse from there. That night and for 3 days and nights after I ran a fever of 100-103, with severe muscle and joint aches, sweats, chills, and delirium. And I drank over 2 gallons of water a day Bc the dr said oh ensure you are drinking enough! Please! I have never in my life felt so horrible. I never get sick and have a very high pain tolerance, but this was a nightmare. Only when the dr came off her leisurely weekend did she bother to change my med, which was Cipro and made me feel like I was on hallucinogens! Drug companies need to post more serious reactions like these so people know they happen.

I use to have recuurent UTIs and my go to was Macrobid. I never had any significant side effects aside from being tired. I took a generic this time and it made me feel terrible. Extreme fatigue, weakness , nausea with a loss of appetite. I took 10 pills and 5 days after stopping still feel awful. Good news is the UTI cleared up but I don't feel well at all.

I have a UTI.  Had a culture done.  I have e coli and I am sensitive to nitro.  YET I had to take two rounds of 100 mg x 2 for it to go away (while fighting a yeast infection).  UTI symptoms returned one week later.  Did another 7-day round of the same dose.  I was to reduce the dose to half, when urinating pain returned.  Now I am in my 4th round of nitro.   This is one of the least "habituating" antibiotic, and I don't want to try anything else, since the culture indicated in a graph that this is the best match for my strain of e coli.  My doctor says that these infections may take a long time to treat successfully.  I will have another culture done to see if I still have the same sensitivity to it.

Pop!!! That sound came from my right calf last night after being on this medication. I can not walk or ambulated. I had been telling my family for 3 days that I felt I needed to check into the hospital but had no idea that the severe stomach pains, aching body like I had widespread infection, 2 fingers on right had so tender that any bump made me wince in pain, stabbing pains to back of my head, confusion, loose stools, upset stomach with GERD all could come from one pill. As soon as I head the loud pop in my calf I went online. I also have been experiencing a feeling that I had a hernia in my navel but had not experienced anything to have caused a strain. I was given 14 pills, I have 4 left. I can not do it another day. Funny thing my doctor just gave me these pills on a suspected UTI, I think if I drop my decaf coffee habit I won’t have any issues with that. My dr. did not ask me about what I’m drinking like soda and coffee, they just push these killer drugs on us and should query us more about our lifestyles and what we can do to help ourselves. I am 58.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have reoccurring bladder infections/UTI’s. I’ve always had anxiety disorder and now I am wondering if it is due to taking this  as a preventative dose since I was a teen. I had a horrible UTI,  which I hadn’t had for ages. The doctor prescribed me this, I have been on it 4 days and I am so sick. Nausea, diarrhea, major anxiety, leg cramps, my muscles in my leg are so stiff I can't take it, also major shortness of breath. I will NEVER take this medication AGAIN! Worst medication I have EVER took in my entire life!
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Did not work at all for me.  UTI came back in 10 days. On cipro now.  Found it useless.

19 years old and went to Dr  for a UTI. Today at 1:00pm I took the first pill. At  2pm I started to sneeze. 3pm at work feeling cold and chills. 5pm body was aching, everything that touched my skin was hurting me. 7pm head and throat aching. 10pm feeling like I got the worse flu, It feels like I’m swallowing glass. It’s  1:03am and I thought I got the flu so I bought medicine. I wanted to make sure I could drink medicine and take pills together, then I found out that a flu like symptom is common!? I would have kept thinking it was a flu if I didn’t look it up and I would have been still taking this horrible pill! I sent my doctor a message. I can’t sleep, my skin hurts, everything that touches me or brushes me hurts, if I tried to change clothes it was hurting me. I can’t even open my mouth because my throat hurts.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This was NOT the antibiotic for me

Horrible experience! Was prescribed nitrofurantoin 2 capsules daily for 7 days for UTI. On  my 3rd day of taking it, started experiencing shortness of breath, numbness in my fingers and extreme weakness, almost like I was about to pass out. Had to stay up all night! Didn’t really think it was a side effect of the medicine I was taking. Thought, I’m having an asthma attack. Forced myself to finish 7 days course. At the end, UTI didn’t clear completely!!! Moreover, now there is a blood in my urine!!! Terrible drug!!! Please be careful!

Had a sudden severe UTI, burning when passing urine and unable to sit, breathe or relax due to the pain and discomfort. Was prescribed this antibiotic and it was great! Symptoms became milder on first dose, slight tingling in left arm but that was it. I have 4 young children to run after, didn't affect my energy at all. I took it with food, twice a day on a 7 day course. I was scared when reading reviews but I am so glad I didn't react badly to it as I really needed to take something to relieve my symptoms.

Nitro Macro (nitrofurantoin):27 year old female. Day 1 of this medication I had horrible stomach problems. Flu like symptoms, crazy cramping. Ibuprofen was not helping. Later that night I had unbearable SEVERE stabbing pains in my "area" they were so bad I went  in the bathroom debated on going to the ER. Looked online at reviews for this antibiotic. I wasn't sure if it was this drug or my UTI or maybe my endometriosis. After looking online and seeing a lot of other people with similar side effects I immediately stopped taking this drug. Most of the symptoms stopped so I do know it was this drug. This is day 2 of me being off the drug and I feel so dizzy like I am about to pass out and I can barely keep my eyes open even after I got over 8 hrs of sleep.  It will not surprise me if there is a recall on this medication.

I was prescribed this medicine for 7 days while pregnant for a UTI. While it did take care of the UTI it also gave me a migraine headache that wouldn’t go away. The headache started on day 4 of taking the medicine. The last day of taking the medicine my right hand also went numb with occasional twitching in my fingers. The numbness was very uncomfortable. I also experienced severe pain in my left hip to the point where I couldn’t move my leg when I would I would try to walk. Very displeased with this medicine. Would not recommend it. Symptoms subsided after the medicine ran its course.

I had a UTI and started taking Furodantain after three days felt weak no energyI had the same feeling when I had hepatitisChanged to trimethroprin and feel better Not to be prescribed to UTI sufferers without a specimen of urine as this drug is very strong and I'm 67 felt dreadful

This medication had minimal effect, throughout the course of 5 days towards when the dose was due symptoms noted.  After 5 days of therapy return of infection ++ within days. Associated with the urinary symptoms a pyrexia and feverish. Question: is it masking symptoms opposed to curing them, allowing a secondary overgrowth to occur.

I am hoping this antibiotic my doctor  prescribed will help. If I just think about having sex I get a UTI it seems but every single time I have sex I get a UTI and it is very stressful and stops me from living a full healthy life. I so hope this works  100mg post after sex , but I do read some take it prior , interesting , I will have to ask my doctor about that one.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is my second experience with Macrobid. The first time I took it I was fresh out of the hospital after having a hysterectomy. And I assumed that the side effects that I was experiencing we’re from that surgery. But I’ve ended up with some bladder problems three months post op and an infection. My doctor put me on Macrobid yesterday, I took my second dose this morning, and I am sick as a dog. Heaviness in the chest, trouble breathing, headache, chills… This is the worst I have felt in three months. I called my doctor and said get me off this garbage

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I am not sure how or why this drug is being made. It's the WORST. I went to immediate care [out of desperation] for UTI symptoms and they prescribed Macrobid. The first day was ok, my symptoms went away but I felt a little dizzy. The second day I was good but that night I started getting horrible cramping in my abdomen. I was up all night with what felt like a gastrointestinal infection or stomach virus. It was awful. The stabbing pains were so painful. I also had a terrible headache. Contacted my doctor and he was upset that I was prescribed this and immediately prescribed something else. I am on day 2 of being off Macrobid and still recovering. I do not recommend at all.
I had my first UTI . Dr said I had had it for awhile. Nitrofurantion is so far working wonderful. 5 day dosage. On day 3. And feel wonderful. Just a little tired. Keeping my fingers crossed.

*DO NOT TAKE*.  Had a UTI and took this drug for 7 Days in October 2018.  Experienced Migraine headaches that lasted 12 hrs a day every day.   Never had one in my life.  I should have thrown these poison pills out immediately.  The UTI cleared up, but to this day I have ringing in my left ear.  Have been to MD, ENT, cardiologist, and neurologist.  Also had a Brain MRI.  Nothing is showing up for my current state.  I blame this terrible drug for the ear ringing.  There are too many bad side effects from this drug.   Do not become a victim.    I wish I had known.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I experienced every single side effect in this  blog. After day five I drove myself to the emergency room. My organs almost shut down. I’m at home, can’t work, and now have to see a lung specialist this week. It’s been weeks and I still feel like I’m dying. I wish the people that had no problems would list their age. And great -  I’m glad it worked for you if you had no problems, but don’t ever EVER tell anyone not to be afraid to take it. Be afraid, be very afraid. This med is no joke. I’m 49 and this is the worst thing that’s ever happened to me and I’m still so sick I can barely get up or breathe and my last dose was  almost 4 weeks ago

I've been on this 4 days and had no issues.  I think it irritates your bladder as do all antibiotics so during the course of your treatment, drink lots of water, not cranberry juice, if your bladder still hurts.  It can take a few days for your bladder to feel better.  It is probably red and sore inside.  So go when you have to go and drink lots of fluids (water) and flush that bacteria out of you.  If you get the side effects I've seen in a lot of posts, you're probably allergic.  I've had two reactions to different antibiotics and ended up in the emergency room.  Allergies isn't the fault of the medication.  Just be careful and pay attention and don't take chances.  You can become allergic to anything at any time.  I did.  The best thing to take when you're taking an antibiotic is a 90 billion probiotic and the refrigerated kind.  Also if you're nauseous with this medicine, take with a full stomach and lots of water.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took this drug twice a day for seven days without any noticeable side effects until the last day. I developed a horrible headache near the back of my neck and came down with chills. After two days being off the medication, I still felt bad and had developed a dry cough as well as a temperature of 100.8. Today, my third day off of the medication, I’ve developed hives!!  If this has all happened early on, I definitely would have stopped the medication!!!

I used to get a UTI after sex without fail. Didn’t matter if I went to the restroom or drank all the cranberry juice in the world. Dr has me take a 100 mg pill after sex to prevent the urine infection and it’s worked perfectly. I haven’t had any side effects

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Please don’t take macrobid! I just got out of the hospital after taking full dose for a UTI.I started itching in my head on Friday by Sunday morning I had a severe rash and my joints and muscles hurt so bad my legs gave out on me and then I started having shortness of breath and chest pains. Went to the UTC where I got the prescription and they had me rushed the the ER. I was having a heart attack. They gave me a epi pen. I ended up staying in the hospital and did have a heart attack but because I did not have blocked arteries it was not a major one but this drug caused some cells to die in my heart and now I have to go to a cardiologist to find out what is next for me. Please please be careful taking this drug.

Within hours after taking Nitrofurantoin for UTI I was bedridden for 48 hours. Had weakness in muscles and  joint pain, confusion, delirium, ice cold sweats, feet and hands ice cold, burning headache back and hip pain loss of concentration, pale face loss of appetite. Horrid taste in mouth couldn't eat for 4 days and lost 5lbs in weight. Had to send for doctor after 5th day. Mentioned to Dr who came that I thought the tablets had bad effect on me, he dismissed comments saying Nitrofurantoin was a widely used medication for UTI. I stopped taking it and felt better in 24 hrs.  Horrid scary experience a warning to other people prescribed this medication. Horrid Nightmare experience.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Stopped taking this a month ago, and still have pins and needles itching all over.  The only thing that helps is zyrtec.

Was prescribed this medication for a UTI. As a sufferer of UTI's (I get them every few months) I end up in hospital with the UTI going to my kidneys as antibiotics haven’t worked. But this time my mega bloated stomach, the pain etc had all halved after 2 of the pills which was a relief and no horrid side effects. Was prescribed 100mg capsules 2 a day for  7 days! Worked a treat for me!

I have never left a review or a medication before but I had such a horrible experience, I have to. The side effects were worse than the actual symptoms. Headache, dizziness, drowsiness (I could barely keep my eyes open and suddenly desperately needed naps.) I am prone to migraines and episodes of depression and this medication was causing me to really spiral. Horrible! It would have been impossible to take this for 7 days (as prescribed.) Never again.

I was prescribed this for UTI, as I have already had an adverse reaction to Trimethoprim. The day after I started taking it the symptoms of the UTI had gone but I felt absolutely awful, I threw up twice and called the doctor who switched me to penicillin. The UTI symptoms came back but less than before, but I was just relieved that the effects of nitrofurantoin had worn off, I had to cancel work for the day.
I’m on my last day of taking this medication now I have got a vaginal yeast infection.
I have taken this antibiotics and my symptoms are still here. Why give this medication when the rating is so low.  How can we get this ineffective medication off the market. Help!

I took this for a UTI 2 weeks ago. I didn’t experience the chills, nausea, or flu like symptoms as others have described. However, this did not work at all. Now two weeks later, I have another UTI and it feels worse than the first time. I told my dr that this med did not work and she gave me a different prescription. Not sure if this antibiotic is strong enough. On day 6 of 7 I still felt the UTI symptoms lingering, it never fully got rid of it.

I'm not sure why so many have had such a bad reaction to this medication (?) as I have had it over my lifetime several times for UTI and never had any reaction other than a tiny bit of nausea when I took it without food (you have to take it with food).  I myself have never had any reaction to this antibiotic and been told it's one of the few antibiotics in 2018 left that's not yet totally resistant to UTI-causing bacteria (most are pretty resistant now).  NOTE: Chronic UTI can be prevented with methenamine hippurate tablets (HIPREX) but first use an antibiotic to treat the UTI, and then take methenamine hipp. to prevent future ones--it WORKS for me!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):First day of taking macrobid made me super tired at work , I felt like a zombie. The second pill gave me a huge headache and at night I got a huge cough and my throat itching kinda like when I get a cold. I was coughing so much and waking everyone up. I just hope my UTI clears up after this. I am on my 3rd day out of 5. I won't take macrobid again if I get another infection.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):OMG guys and can’t even talk about what my body is going through right now. I feel like I have morning sickness with food poisoning and the flu all in one! What the heck is going on.. I took it for my UTI and the first day was fine! The second day that night I started to get really ill my heart was pounding my feet and legs felt like pin and needles tingling all over my body! I sweating after that night the next morning I was so nauseous and dizzy with diarrhea and I was so weak couldn’t even walk was completely incompetent what so ever around me! I started to feel anxious and nervous shaking and was about to drive my self to the ER. I stop taking it on my 4 day and I am still feeling like garbage after 12 hrs later! The symptoms is still there not feeling any better! Had to call out for work the next 2 days!! I always read that one of the side effects can cause nerve damage permanently. Never again!

I took 5 days of this, two pills a day for a UTI. About 2 days after I finished this medication, my UTI returned, and came back much more painful. Had to go get more antibiotics.The medication made me drowsy, and it says on the package that it will. Turned my urine a weird orange colour which was expected.The medication helped me stop urinating blood. So the drugs works, but it has a high chance of not being strong enough to kill all of the bacteria.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took this medication for a week to relieve a bladder infection at 100mg per dosage. The entire time I've been on it I've felt constantly nauseous, short of breath, and very dizzy with borderline vertigo. Which is bearable to some extent, however, everytime I have peed while taking this, it still doesn't feel normal. Going in for another urine test to make sure it cured it because it doesn't feel like it did much.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Prescribed 7 days for severe bladder infection.  Made me very tired, bothered my stomach and quit it after 3 days.  Had a scratchy throat on 3rd night, restless sleep. Was in bed all day on 4th day.  Then started getting a cold, head cold on 5th day and at bed time, could hear crackling in my lung/chest area.  Never had that before.  Will never take this again.  Hoping no damage done to my lungs.

I took it for UTI. My new GP prescribed this to me after hearing that I reacted badly to Cipro. I've taken Apo Sulfatrim (Bactrim) often, but that gave me diarrhea and muscle aches, though at least I knew what to expect. After reading all these negative reviews, I was hesitant. Within a couple of hours, I started to experience tingling and numbness in the soles of both feet and hands, at different times. I was very concerned because these can mean peripheral neuropathy; nerve damage. I called the pharmacist and told me to stop taking them immediately. Will never take these again. I am giving it a 1 (not because I had to) but because it did relieve my UTI symptoms, but not sure if 1 dose is going to be enough.

I had very mild symptoms of an UTI and didn't even know what it was. Currently on day 3 of this medication and I have never felt worse! Whether I eat before or after taking the meds I'm nauseated. Very lethargic, no appetite and dizzy. However, my symptoms seem to be gone already, and I'm very anxiously waiting until day 7 so I can enjoy food again.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):This year I have struggled with repeat UTIs.  I have taken Microdantin each time.  The first two times for 3 days and it cleared up.   The third time for 7 days it cleared up.  This is time I took it 100mg for 5 days.  After the 3 day of being off the drug the UTI returned.  Now I'm on another 5 day course.  I  do experience the insomnia and distorted dreams.  With the first course I had severe diarrhea. No diarrhea with second course.  Can't wait to be rid of this drug and infection.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):While this did clear up my UTI I am now on week five of intense gas, bloating, diarrhea and discomfort. It’s pretty embarrassing as an elementary teacher to be constantly burping and to have small children constantly ask, What’s that?!? as my stomach is making god awful sounds with me then having to bolt to the bathroom. I learned the hard way that the sounds are followed by gas which unfortunately is also accompanied by diarrhea. Nothing I have tried has worked to decrease these side effects. Like I said, it did it’s job but was it worth this? Definitely not. I’d like to be able to fart again without having to worry about if I’m going to shart instead. It’s the little things.

I never in my life had bad experiences with antibiotics but this one was a near death experience . I had a UTI and was given this by my doctor.  I felt like my symptoms had gotten worse after I started taking this pill  and just thought it was the UTI that was still affecting me so I continued taking it. I felt like a zombie for the next few months cause I didn’t think that the pill was affecting me or had so much side effect. I had chest pain, fatigue, night sweat, pain in my neck arms and feet, tingling sensation my whole body, headache, the sensation all over my body which I still have cause my nerves are probably damage now. I'm going  to see my doctor today because this is not going away on its own.  If I knew better I would have stopped taking this pills right away. But already took most of it. Please whoever is reading this stay away from this pill. It will make you feel like you have a virus.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Attended Emergency for Statin use related UTI.  Started medication same day and next morning vomited.  I took the next prescribed dose and 2hrs later could not take a deep breath, had a very tight, heavy chest, and I thought I was having a heart attack.  By the time for my next dose, I had a headache, muscle pain which kept moving, felt sweaty and feverish.  The next dose created more of the same, with increased labored breathing.  I had never felt so weak or nauseated.  Sleep was intermittent and weird dreams.  I did not continue, called my GP and stopped immediately.  I am a 60 year old woman and this is the most horrible drug I have ever been prescribed.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):This drug needs to be taken off the market. I have taken antibiotics for recurrent UTI’s and never have EVER had such a bad experience. I took this pill before bed, and almost immediately had body aches. The next morning, I woke up feeling like I was hit with a bad flu. It was horrible! Took five days to get out of my system. Avoid this at all costs!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):On my 3rd day  of the drug. Cleared up UTI really  quickly but the side effect I have suffered from is really bad dizziness.  Haven't been able to do anything for a couple of days for fear of falling over.  It's horrendous.  Last tablet tonight so hoping this will soon be over.  Never want these again
I took this for UTI, this medicine started clearing up the symptoms on Day 2. I had a bit of fatigue and nausea but tolerable. Better than the discomfort the infection caused.

Terrible medicine. Took it first day as prescribed with food. Within a couple hours I was down and out. Fever, aches, pains, horrible nausea, vomiting. Trying to avoid going to ER but might end up there if it doesn't wear off soon. Never taking it again.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have taken this several times for a UTI and did not have any problems at all!  Do eat when taking it!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I started taking  for a UTI. The first day I started feeling tingling in my thighs. I called the dr office asked if this was normal to experience with a UTI as  it was my first. She said yes that's normal. Over the next couple of days my fingers and legs started twitching. I thought I maybe had a herniated disc. On the 5th night I had twitching tingling down my legs felt as if I was going paralyzed. I drove myself to the ER. I told 3 nurses and the ER dr I have tingling my legs and they feel weak. They all asked if I was taking meds I told them yea I'm taking macrobid for  UTI. He said my legs were strong and I had a pulse in them he saw nothing emergent. I went home thinking I was crazy. I took the macrobid 2 more days. The day I stopped my fingers stopped twitching. It is 3 weeks later now. I have just found this info that macrobid can cause permanent neuropathy. I'm so scared and angry with these Drs. Going to see a new md tomorrow to see what I can do??

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Earlier today I got this for a UTI, and I have not stopped throwing up for over 12 hours. I'm fatigued, starving, sweaty, my head is pounding and I'm miserable. I would never wish this on my worst enemy. DON'T TAKE THIS

Took this for a UTI. Didn’t experience any bad side effects, UTI symptoms cleared very quickly so I have no complaints about that. The only thing is I noticed is it turned my urine a bright neon yellow almost greenish which freaked me out until I realized it was probably just a side effect. Sure enough it says right on the bottle that it may change the color of your urine or feces.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Felt great day 1 bladder symptoms resolving. After day 2 had similar adverse reactions as others - horrendous diarrhea, cramps, sweats, nausea, short of breath, headache, clammy skin, anxiety and racing heart. I took this once before about 20 years ago and it was fine. This time it was awful. Pushed myself through 5.5 days but had to stop. I hope these side effects go away soon this is wretched. I need to get back to my life. Have not gotten out of bed for 2 days.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I am on my 5th day of this treatment for an acute UTI.  I felt it working within the first 6 hours of taking it.  It didn't get rid of my symptoms right away, but it took the worst of the symptoms away within a day. The other symptoms faded more slowly. As far as side effects, I did experience mild nausea, a bit of abdominal pain, and loss of appetite.  Compared to the excruciating symptoms of the UTI I can live with these side effects. This is the 5th day of treatment, and the first day that I can say, I am symptom free.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I went to urgent care to get medication for UTI and doctor prescribed Macrobid. I took the first pill around lunch, and felt totally fine, and took the second after dinner. I woke up the next morning and had terrible nausea, fatigue, and diarrhea. I though I ate something strange the night before and continued to take my medicine twice a day. The next morning, same deal, fatigue, diarrhea, nausea, and this time, vomiting. It cleared up around the afternoon. My doctor recommends taking a probiotic a few hours before/ after taking an antiobiotic to lessen the effects of diarrhea and nausea. MAKE SURE you eat and drink plenty of water. It’s has helped, however, I switched to another antibiotic. If you have a sensitive gut like mine, I would try another antibiotic!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed a 3-day dose of Macrobid to clear up a UTI. The only negative side effect I found was extreme fatigue - to the point where I was nearly falling asleep at work. It also turns your pee bright yellow/green, almost neon. I was hesitant because there were so many negative reviews, but this worked fine for me. I found that the symptoms of my UTI cleared up shortly after taking the first pill.

I’ve been having issues from urinating a lot, to sharp pains for 3 months and after 3 months of taking different things and going to the ER they diagnosed me with a UTI and prescribed me  Nitrofurantoin macrocrystals . I’ve been on it for 7 days now and I’ve experienced terrible headaches, neck pains, dizziness, loss of appetite, and nausea. I've felt the worst I’ve ever felt BUT this is the first time I’ve felt relieved from any UTI symptoms in 3 months and that’s the only thing that matters. Yes, the side effects aren’t the best but it gets the job done and for your health just take the medication. Don’t stop it because you feel like garbage, it’ll be done shortly it’s only 5-7 days of being on it and in the end the results make up for it cause now your completely healthy. Don’t be scared of all these reviews, you’ll get through it don’t be worried. The best thing you can do is relax, rest, sleep, and don’t get worked up and worried. You’ll be A OK!

An ER doctor prescribed Nitrofurantoin for a UTI. When I got home I checked out the side effects of this drug. One of the side effects was liver damage, are they kidding me???? Taking this drug is slow dangerous. Monday, I saw my urologist and he my urine test was negative. YAH!I put the Nitrofurantoin in the trash. Glad I didn't take any of this medication (:

I have been taking this for going on 4 out of 5 days. I had some nausea the first day, but nothing too bad, very orange pee. The second day nothing but the third day my face and lips have been very dehydrated- my lips are chapped etc. Only one more day!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was really worried about taking macrobid after reading reviews but so glad I did, it cleared up the UTI, I had no side effects whatsoever, I was on 100mg twice a day which I always took with food. Would definitely take again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Everything was fine until the 3rd day of my 5 day trial on Macrobid. I experienced severe nausea and was very close to vomiting. My body was aching so bad I couldn’t move. Thankfully after the 3 days, my UTI did part it’s ways. I won’t ever touch that antibiotic again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):On day 4 of this medication.  First couple of days I was tired and had a headache.  Could be from the meds or the UTI.  Now that has gone but now have some aching down the backs of my legs.  Could be the meds or the heels I wore yesterday

I took Nitrofurantoin for the first 2 days and saw improvement, but by day 3 I started to feel worse it felt like my UTI symptoms were coming back drastically. Continued to take it for another day and woke up on day 4 feeling absolutely terrible. Extremely nauseous, still feeling the urge to go pee non stop, no appetite, crazy anxiety, hot flashes & body ached & pains! I immediately went to the ER thinking my UTI had turned into a kidney infection but after a CT scan, urinalysis & blood work the informed me they couldn’t find nothing and all my tests came back fine. Even my urine test showed no bacteria anymore. They told me to stop taking Nitrofruantoin and gave me some zofran for the nausea. It’s been almost 12 hours and I’m still feeling terrible and even after the zofran I am sick to my stomach and have no appetite. And I still have the feeling of the constant urge to go pee! I don’t know what the heck is going on! But I know I will never take this medicine ever again!

Worst reaction ever! After 7 days I completed the medication as directed. My scalp started to itch. I thought I had mosquito bites or summer bug bites. Then, it got worse. I had to take Benadryl just to halfway function during the day and sleep at night. I've never had a reaction to antibiotics until taking this awful drug. Had a terrible outbreak of hives! I've never had hives in my entire life. My hands would itch and burn like crazy too. I definitely allergic to these and will never take them again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed a 7 day course of Macrobid for a mild UTI. 2nd day: all UTI symptoms gone. Neon yellow urine3rd day: Feeling like a cold is starting. Dry mouth, congestion. Back and stomach aches, but I dismissed it to PMS and a prior back injury.  Pain was so unusual (not relieved by menthol gel and a heating pad) and only somewhat relieved by ibuprofen and sleep.4th day: diarrhea, stomach bloating/pain, back pain, darker urine.5th day: I began getting concerned that it may be liver pain after reading the drugs side effects. My pain is exactly around my liver. It has become unbearable and all I want to do is sleep so I don’t have to deal with it. Darker urine.There’s a chance I will stop taking this medication early. I know it’s a big no-no to stop antibiotics early, but I’m getting a little desperate to feel normal again. Also concerned I may be doing some permanent damage to my liver.
This stuff is bad, 3rd and final day.  I feel weak, dizzy general feeling of having flu, awful stuff.

I was given this for suspected UTI and I can honestly say I have felt like death. I ended up on two courses of it but stopped through course 2 as I felt feverish, sick, face hurt, weird neck pain. After 24 hours of stopping I felt better. I'm left with a really bloated stomach that's painful. Anyone else had similar?

I have just finished a weeks course of this. The first day of taking this I felt AWFUL.... Extreme nausea, headache , high temp , heart racing , really bad chest pains but I knew I HAD to get rid of this infection ( caught septis from having a urine infection three months ago after my c section so has terrified me) anyway I continued taking it and on day four I felt a lot better. It makes a huge difference eating something before taking it and I took a glass of milk with it rather than water to fill my stomach more. It has left me with extreme anxiety but I suffer from that anyway so am hoping it calms down when am 24 hours clear of it. Now just hoping it’s actually worked!! It’s better feeling like garbage for a few days rather than the infection spreading any further I would continue taking it if you feel like stopping it gets better!

I tend to get UTI's rather easily. Most of the generic antibiotics don't work for me and make me feel worse.Though this antibiotic does work. It made me feel terrible. It also sometimes gives me a slight burning feeling in the bladder. This can last even after I have finished the course. When on these it pretty much like you have a really bad case of the flu. (again this isn't for all people you might react differently)Sometimes I had bouts of feeling okay, but then suddenly really sick and nauseous. I rated it a 5 out of 10 because. although the side effects are horrible. I would rather deal with feeling ill for a few days then having pain when urinating or a kidney infection. And if you take paracetamol while on these, it will calm down some of these side effects for a few hours.If getting rid of your infection is more important to you than feeling sick for around 7-10 days then I would recommend it. If not then try another antibiotic.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Horrible side effects.  I am going into day 4 and I feel like I might die.  I'll update if I don't.  I'm still having horrible UTI  symptoms.  This medication better work because this is miserable and if this is all for nothing...

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this for a UTI because I have a high sulpha allergy. I took one pill and was fine with no problems, took it with food as prescribed and went to bed about 5 hours later. Woke up in the morning with my body aching so bad I felt like I had the flu. I was really spaced out, depressed, had diarrhea. It cleared up the symptoms for the UTI very fast but I have to go to get a different prescription. I’ve had body aches all day and feeling so lethargic. I don’t recommend.

These reviews are scary! I have just finished my 3rd day of doses out of 5, and to be honest, I do not feel the symptoms of my UTI going away at all. While I don’t feel any pain, anxiety, nausea, or drowsiness (because I eat before every pill) I also don’t feel any UTI relief. Big pharma is a scam!

I don't know why the drug is on sale. I have never feared death, never like when I took this drug. I took the drug on my first day of getting the prescription and 4 hours later, a mixture of diarrhea, vomiting, chest pains, blurred vision. At first, I thought I was going to die so I called my wife and told her to take good care of our two young daughters in case I don't return home. I also gave her the passwords to my bank account. I then visited another clinic to undergo medical tests and see if they can remove that poison from my body. I was astonished when the doctor told me to stay calm and all will be well. In fact, I was given 2 glasses of water to drink. The doctor didn't give me any more drugs but told me to wait for 7 days to elapse and get back for testing and we start afresh. Luckily, I healed when I went back, but to be honest, I can't recommend this drug to any patient. The drug is not humans who have daily errands.

Cannot fault the anti bitoics for getting rid of the infection but wow I got every side effect going! Finished yesterday and still wiped out,Feeling drained and got achey muscles and mainly my legs! I first had an infection three weeks ago and then it came back so I asked if I can take two 100mg instead of four a day. I was also on the slow release ones as the nurse advised me won’t be as intense with nausea.

This drug me feel terrible- very dizzy, stomach ache, and a headache like I’ve never had before. I can’t wait until this gets out of my system. It hit me so hard I had to lie down in bed all afternoon.  Never again
I have several UTI s a yearWas always given CapriIt did nothingThen was given NitrofurantoinIt worked!!Little diarrhea But well worth it to finally have a drug for UTI s that works!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this for a UTI. I became sick right away but thought it was the UTI getting worse. By 3rd day I had such severe body aches, chills, chest pain (I could barely breathe), and an extremely high fever. I went to urgent care and could barely walk. They checked my temp. Which was slightly over 103 and told me they were going to call an ambulance for me if I didn’t race to the hospital right away. My husband drove me there as fast as he could and I thought I was dying. Not only was I in extreme pain but my anxiety was through the roof. Got to the ER with 104 temp. and they did every test on me (including a CAT scan) and found nothing wrong and told me to keep taking it. Went home and took 1 more dose and that was it. I was so sick I didn’t take anymore. I thought I was going to die. 12 hours after my first skipped dose, I finally get like I wasn’t going to die—like I might actually live. Never took another pill and got better fairly quickly.

Never did I think I would feel like this from a prescribed medication.  I took my first dose at 8pm got really tired slept for 2 hours. It's 6 am now have been up ever since I started sweating  and having horrible crazy dreams. All night my chest feels tight and my throat feels like it's closing having trouble breathing. I will never ever take this medication again only took one pill and made me feel like this I could only imagine how I would feel taking all that I was prescribed.

Omg this medication! I have a mild UTi and I’m currently taking this, I’ve taken two doses now and I feel so nauseous, I have a headache, I’m achy and weak and have no appetite. I’m not taking another dose this is horrible!!! Would rather have the UTI

Worst drug experience ever.  Within one hour of the very first pill I started throwing up and after 12 hours of not being able to keep food or water down, feeling worse by the minute, and on to dry heaving my husband took me to the ER at 2 am.  Spent 4 hours on anti-nausea med and fluid IV’s.  And I only took ONE pill! How can this drug stay on the market with these kinds of side effects?

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After my first dose of macrobid I experienced some of the worst pain I have ever felt. A horrible headache, my entire body hurt,  fever/chills, and a lot of nausea. I couldn't function the remainder of the day. Was falling asleep during work and while driving home. Decided maybe I would only take it right before bed. Woke up in the middle of the night sweating and achy. I'm on my third dose and I'm honestly not sure that it is helping my UTI. If I make it through the prescribed amount. I will most certainly never take it again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I experience recurrent UTI's. I have been prescribed a combination of antibiotics over the years including macrobid, cipro, Bactrim, etc. The doctor rotates them. Never had severe reactions to any of them, aside from waves of nausea here and there and headaches. Was just prescribed macrobid this last time and had the worst reaction ever. Thought I was crazy until I read the other reviews. ANXIETY, heart racing, nausea, diarrhea. I stopped taking it immediately. I have never felt this way before. They changed me to cipro but I have so much anxiety from that last script I’m terrified to start the next. Anyways my point is we can take an antiobiotic for years and be fine, and then our bodies can change and have a reaction. Don’t immediately assume you will have a bad reaction but be very aware of how you are feeling and stop if you experience any severe symptoms.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This medicine was the worst! I slept ALL day, I was constipated, fever, extreme body aches, and the worst headache of my life. I had to be rushed to the emergency room.

I took this for my only UTI I have ever had. I am allergic to most antibiotics, so this was safest. I am actually very happy with it. My only issue is that it irritated my skin- but its worth it to be able to pee without my bladder contracting painfully.  I was prescribed 3 days, so I am hoping it continues to work and the infection doesn't recur.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Horrible medication! After only two doses, I had severe joint pain in my hips and knees; felt extremely weak, and flu-like symptoms came on strong. I immediately called to be changed to something else. It may help with UTI’s, if you can suffer through, but I was not willing to. I can’t imagine how horrible I would have felt had I continued the recommended 7 day treatment. I will never take this medication again.

This medication has caused my whole entire body to change. I experienced dizziness, poor concentration, heart racing, and worst of all anxiety. I have never taken this medication before and have never suffered from any of the symptoms described above. I'm not sure why doctors think is ok to prescribe such a poison. Never should have and never will take it again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I'm in my 5th day of macrobid. Really just wanted to review to ease some minds because I ran to the internet too when I was prescribed this medication (like I always do with new medicine). The only side effects I've had is some nausea/stomach upset, anxiety (I have health anxiety and was pretty shook up from the reviews, so could be that), tiredness, and my urine turned a dark yellow/florescent yellow. I'm 19, get UTI's a lot as I'm prone to them and am on a 7 day course. I'm also usually pretty sensitive to medicine because I'm so in tune with my body. Basically, this drug is fine (for me). If you drink/eat before/after taking it the nausea is dramatically reduced. I even talked to my nurse, and majority of people do well on the medicine with little side effects (mainly upset stomach). This medicine has taken care of my UTI no problem. By day 3 I felt normal.

I had a bladder infection that the doctor gave me this antibiotic to take, it was twice a day for 3 days. I finished the course but still feel terrible.  I was not hurting when I peed anymore but felt like I've been hit by a bus, aching all over, headache, tummy ache, no energy and also had anxiety. So I went back to the doctor to ask if the infection had gone because I still felt terrible. They got me to do another sample and yes it was clear, but the doctor gave me another 8 tablets to take. Therefore altogether I would be on them for 7 days but I decided not to take them as I’m sure it’s the tablets that made me feel so unwell. I was fine before I took them it just burnt when I went for a wee but now feel terrible on day 2 of not taking the tablets. I just want to feel like myself again.

My regular doctor prescribed Cipro in the past which always worked but urgent care prescribed me this. Twice a day for a week. I only made it through two days. Exhausted with , leg pain, diarrhea, stomach pain, nausea, loss of appetite and sleep. I already have anxiety which I take medication for and being on this brought my anxiety back ten times more. I’ll never take this again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I've taken 2 courses of this  drug now and it cleared up my UTI perfectly. Zero side effects! I made sure I took it with something to eat and drank plenty of water. It does make your urine turn neon green/yellow.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I didn’t get any side effects until days 2-3. Mostly stomach related. I called my doctor and got zofran. I was able to take he meds fine after that.   If anyone out there has issues taking meds this one is a gel cap, which is easier to swallow.  Took for one week!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Started Macrobid 3 day course for a UTI on the Tuesday morning. Fine for the first 2 days, seemed to be working, though I did notice that my urine had turned neon yellow, like mountain dew.Woke up at 6am on the Thursday feeling nauseated and anxious. Severe diarrhea began closely followed by vomiting. I was shaken up and confused, I have never before suffered side effects from any other antibiotics. Stopped taking them immediately. Never touching those pills again.

Just got back from the ER as a result of this drug. Day 5 of this drug, my throat felt like it was closing in and I was gasping for air. I’ve never had these crazy side effects from any other med. I’m a young healthy strong woman, but I couldn’t finish the full 10 days...pretty certain I would have passed out on day 10. What a horrific  Experience. Not only will I never take this again; I likely won’t go back to the clinic that gave it to me. I’m currently on steroids and other drugs to help me breathe normally again!

Prescribed 7 day course. Stopped after third day. 2 days later I'm still suffering from nausea, lightheaded, motion sickness, blurred vision, concentration issues, fever and worst of all anxiousness! Will NOT be taking this medicine again, I'm hoping this passes very soon! Although feel at ease knowing other people have had similar symptoms!!!

Awful medication. Within 4 hours of taking the first dose, I had the chills, headache, diarrhea and dry heaves. Then the fever set in and the sweat poured off me. Scared me to death. Should never be on the market.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Worse drug ever.  I felt like I was being poisoned from the inside out - like I had a really bad flu or food poisoning. I drove to work and passed out twice at the wheel. Not sure how I’m still here. Made me feel so nauseated, very very tired to the point of not keeping my eyes open  feverish, numbness and tingling in hands and feet.. needless to say I stopped taking it after 4 days I don’t think it was working as it was still burning when I peed. Never again.. I switched to another meds. I’d rather keep having the UTI then taking that ever again

Have taken these tablets before in capsule form and they did the job, got some this time in tablet form. I have never felt so ill -  my whole body ached I was sweating dizzy and was unable to drive due to my vision.  I  slept solidly for 13 hours I stopped taking them after 2 days but still am sweating feel like garbage. I cannot go to work as cannot focus on anything and every part of my body hurts.

Today is my third day of using this stuff. Never used it before.  Having flu-like symptoms and achy back pain.  Crazy intense apocalyptic dreams.  The stomach and back pain are the worst part. I can handle lethargy, but I went to the dr. to get rid of pain. Three more days. Fingers crossed. Never using this stuff again.

My wife was prescribed nitrofurantoin,  within 1 hr experienced chest tightening  shortness of breath, vomiting with flu like symptoms. Was rushed to hospital and was diagnosed as having anaphylaxis shock, be wary of taking this drug.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is my first time leaving a comment on a drug on this website. I'm just here to relax anyone who gets prescribed this medication. This medicine did give me the chills, tiredness, joint pain and nausea, but it did what it was supposed to do. Got RID of that same UTI that I had that just wouldn't go away, which is dangerous. I was given 2 rounds of bactrim first. I felt VERY sick from the UTI anyway, so feeling off from the macrobid made no difference. Be happy it isn't ciprofloxacin, or any other fluoroquinolones you were prescribed, which is what these doctors try to push now when patients want a switch from the med that seems would work best after a culture test. Some of them don't know that the FDA put out warnings that it shouldn't be prescribed for conditions like this, for very serious reasons. You have been warned.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I have had 3 experiences with Macrodantin and they have all been bad!  I am sure that this drug works very well for those that can tolerate it, but is not for me!  I have had recurring kidney infections all of my life and the first time I was put on it I became nauseous, vomited and felt very ill.  This doctor told me that he would not be giving that drug to me again.  Several years later I had a UTI and my new doctor gave it to me but it was under another name, so I didn’t make the correlation.   Again, fever, chills, nausea and vomiting.  When I researched the medication, I realized it was a generic name for Macrodantin and stopped taking it immediately.  This last time, after having been told by my doctor that it was just a coincidence, I tried again!  Again, I had the same symptoms as before!  I felt miserable for 2 days.  I’m off Macrodantin for life!

Wow - reading many of these comments and I also share having bad experience with Nitrofurantoin. Had a 5 day course for a UTI , UTI improved although not completely but side effects awful - Day 2 felt like a I had a virus, extremely nauseated, loose poo, dizzy, generally feeling yeuch, anxiety ( not me at all usually) & cancelled going to a fantastic social event. Never again. And UTI returned within 2 days

Worst medicine I’ve ever taken! Read the other reviews how they make everyone feel sick is definitely true. Makes you feel extremely sick! Nauseous. I’m having bad cramps right now. If you can get a different medication for UTI then do it. I get UTI’s a lot & nothing was ever as bad as this medicine. It takes it away but how it makes you feel is not worth it. I never leave reviews on medications but I just wanted to warn people. Made me feel so sick I had to call in to work.

Took this for first 5 1/2 days for UTI. Had weird dreams and extremely sweating at night. So bad it would wake me up on and off at night. Then that Saturday keep soaking my clothes while out eating and shopping. Could not get cooled off. Then felt like rubbish by Sunday night. Pulse rate jumped to 110. B/P went up as well.  By the next day numbness all over tired, sleepy, dizziness and instability. Increased water intake from day one. Have heart problems and autoimmune as well. Have a long list of meds I can’t take already. Just one more for the list.

I was prescribed Nitrofurantoin (macrobid). I took my first dose at noon, & about an hour later my skin was on fire & I had hives all over my body. Shortly after that, my heart started racing and I felt extremely tired, I slept on and off all day until my second dose at midnight. Four hours later I woke up feeling like I was dying, I was violently ill and extremely nauseated, I had a fever and my body felt like it was hit by a car. I looked online and saw all the bad reviews, I also looked at the side effects and had just about all of them. I’m allergic to amoxicillin & get hives, but this was nothing like that; I’d keep the UTI over what this medication did. Nearly 24 hours later & I still don’t feel right. Avoid at all cost.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve reviewed a drug before but this one deserves it. I took macrobid for a UTI 100mg x2 for 10 days. While it helped my UTI I have been left with anxiety and digestive problems 2 weeks after finishing this treatment.  This drug has ruined my month and I’m hoping my stomach will bounce bad

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Been taking macrobid 3 days. Symptoms come and go. I have extreme anxiety and a fast heart rate for a couple of hours after taking a dose. Hardly able to sleep. Tired all day from lack of sleep. Stomach bloat. Dizzy a lot. I will take my dose this morning . I am going to the heart doc today for test results of a cardio work up I had done last week ...I will be asking him if it is ok to start cipro. I guess some people do ok on this med...but it has to many hard side effects for me.

Had lots of UTI's antibiotics  and they just don't agree with me at all.   But as we know we have to have them to cure infections.  I've been on this med frequently 7 lots since March due to a bladder prolapse that's not operable, so at the moment I have the worst symptoms I have ever had - I feel so sick, headaches, dizzy can't hear, blurred eyes, no appetite, stomach pain and terrible back pain plus thru the roof anxiety which is very debilitating. Other antibiotics don't  work.  Is it the pills or the infection that causing these symptoms ? It's got  to be the pills, I just have to take them what else can I do ??

The MD prescribed Macrobid, 100 mgs., 2x/day, for a urinary tract infection. After taking the pill for 2-3 days I broke out into a terrible rash. The worst part of the side effects was that my vein in my neck protruded and I look like I have a turkey neck. I am so depressed and angry that I can't sleep and am so frightened that my neck is not going to go back to normal. So far it has not changed at all. I have seen an allergist and 2 internists and no one is helping me. This medication should be discontinued.

I was put on nitrofurtoin for a UTI . From start of taking meds I had the worst experience started feeling dizzy and tired pains in my lower back and chest pains I thought medication was supposed to make you feel better not feel even worse.  I took myself and called my Dr and asked to be switched to something else ASAP I don't recommend this medicine it needs to be off the shelf

I really believed I was going to die.  Within hours of first dose, I was being rushed to the ER.  Horrible chest pain, so bad that I passed out.  Only to wake to dizziness, nausea, and uncontrollable diarrhea.  I literally vomited from dizziness every time I tried to open my eyes.  I honestly believe this medication should be removed from the market.  If I had managed to take another dose, I believe I would have had a major cardiac event.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I get recurring UTI’s about every 3 months & I have taken every antibiotic that you can name. Macrobid did make me feel so bad with body aches, chills, headache, heart palpitations, diarrhea & very nausea. I am trying to hang in to the end of the meds but I don’t think I will take Macrobid again. But feel pretty sure it has not got rid of my UTI...

After going on a sugar binge my body finally told me enough is enough and about 3 days ago I ended up with my first UTI in about a year give or take a few months. I had severe back pain and it felt like my urethra was badly bruised whenever I would urinate. I went to the doctor and they gave me a prescription for "macrobid" twice a day for 5 days at 200mg a pill. I have taken 4 pills so far with minimal side effects and it doesn't hurt as much when I urinate now although it is still a bit uncomfortable. My back no longer hurts either. I have been taking my pills with either a meal or a glass of milk and both methods have prevented stomach upset from the medicine. I highly recommend this antibiotic.

Really danger medicine  my wife took this medicine for couple days and she started feel a horrible effect. She start feel heart palpitations, tingling in her face and left arm numbness, also she can not sleep.  She went to another doctor and explained what effect she have after she took the medication and the doctor say stop don't take it any more one day. After that we received a call by the nurse asking for my wife and and I was at work and a telling her my wife is not here what happening and she tell me a can't tell you but tell to you wife stop taking the medication we prescribed to her. They also saide they were going to given her other medication and please let it know to you wife she need to call us. Wahoo something is wrong with that medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Terrible! I finished the 5 day course and my UTI is gone BUT I have chest pain, shortness of breath, and body aches all over. Not worth the side effects!!! This is the first time I’ve ever had a reaction to a medication. Back to amoxicillin I go! And the med check doctor I just saw told me that negative side affects are extremely rare. Thanks for all the reviews so I didn’t think I was crazy!

Oh,  third time on Nitrofurantoin, in less than 2 months.  It seems to clear up the cystitis, (painful pee,)  but within weeks it is back again.   The stomach discomfort, fatigue and shivers, I am having, this time, is causing me great distress.   I have no choice but to not complete the course.  I feel absolutely awful.   Would not recommend this product ..

Side affect: Chest tightening, hard to breathe. Heart pumping. Arm tingling.After 24 hours of first 2 doses, I had chest pain/tightening. Then 3h after 3rd dose my arm was tingling. After the 4th dose at 9am, Chest tightened and shortness of breath, worse than the first time. Called for a phone appointment with a doctor. End result: DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICINE ANY FURTHER.My heart has been racing for 2h on and off now. I thought I was going to die earlier and I have never reacted to any form of medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Stay away! How this drug is still manufactured I do not know. I took this and thought I was getting more sick or having liver failure! Skin sensitivity- nausea- extreme fatigue- heart  palpitations. I immediately stopped taking it. Antibiotics should for the most part make you feel better not like your on Chemotherapy.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Read the reviews and was so scared to even take it!!!!!! But I took the medication and not a single side effect! Great medication .... I’m 5’5 and 135lbs .. very prone to headaches... nothing happened. Don’t let the bad reviews scare you !

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):UTI's are the worst. I've had em all my life. Seems like twice a year they come with a vengeance. Everyone reacts differently so take your docs advice before me or anyone else. Macrobid sure doesn't make me feel good but heck I would take those symptoms over peeing fire every five mins any day.I get shaky but it does help to take with food. Also a tablespoon of baking soda in water is always helpful. D-mannose does work to prevent but once it's there you can't swallow enough capsules to rid it (least me). I've taken all kinds of antibiotics and macrobid seems to work the fastest. It does knock you out for a lil while tho. I guess I'd rather feel a little off then crying in the bathroom wondering why women have to endure such nasty infections (men too). There's nothing worse than wishing for a new urthra. Take the macrobid. Your doc has said it'll help. If it really makes you ill, ask your doc for a new one.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin): I am the exception of people reviewing macrobid .  Lucky me! I took this for my UTI and has been the most effective one to deal with an extremely persistent one and also in my case, with the exception of drowsiness and intense need to sleep, was asymptomatic.

I have been on this drug before for a UTI. First time was a 3 day course and apart from feeling tired I was fine. 3 months later the UTI has come back and again the doctors have placed me on the same drug. First night I was up all night being sick. Next day I was very faint, had diarrhoea and extremely nauseous. I couldn’t eat or drink enough to ‘prevent the upset stomach by eating’ I’m now on my second day and I am bed bound! No energy and still sick as a dog. Please speak with your doctor to see if there is another medication for you as this is really not worth it.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):If you have a job, kids or any sort of life don’t take macrobid.  Wipes you out completely with sickness, extreme fatigue and flu like symptoms!!I lasted three days and just couldn’t take any more!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this medicine for possible UTI. Didn't work because I believe I have cystitis but this was precautionary. Almost didn't take it because of the reviews! The only bad side effect I had was stinky gas and maybe a little tired.  I don't understand how this drug has so many bad reviews. (maybe people who have bad experiences are more likely to review something and the ones who have good experiences just move on with their lives) Drink it with a glass of water and food. I was fine.

Okay, I’m  on here  because I read a review on here that said something about those of us with bad experiences having phantom side effects, she also stated that no medication would give you those effects after only a few doses.  That is WRONG.I was on 100mg twice a day for a UTI that I discovered on accident.  I had no UTI symptoms.  I literally felt like I was getting the flu on the second day.  I didn’t think anything if it, I just thought well I guess I’m getting the flu.  Then the headaches came.  I had a headache for FIVE DAYS straight! No.  This medicine is bad.
