I took my last one this morning and I’m hoping there are no irreversible effects.  This medicine made me really super sick.  I do not recommend this to anyone.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have taken this medication twice.  I rated it a 5 because, despite the severe reaction I had to it, it DID take care of the UTI.  That said...First time I took it I felt like I had the flu for the first day or so.  This wore off so I continued taking it, and after the course was finished my UTI was gone.  I recently was prescribed it a second time for a UTI; however, my reaction to it was much more severe after my first day.  I had:-Severe body aches-Nausea-Chills/fever (as high as 102)-Shortness of breath-HeadacheMy skin also became very sensitive and it hurt just to have fabric touch it.  I had to take a day off of work and lay in bed because I was so ill.  I was informed to stop taking it and have been switched over to Cipro.I can't recommend it due to the side effects I endured, but I suppose if you don't suffer from the side effects it is an effective drug for a UTI.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):On Macrobid I had nausea, so tired and headache. I made it 6 days. Don’t ask how. I hardly have the energy to walk, no appetite and everything hurts. I’m not finishing it and hoping for the best.

First UTI I have had in four years.  Last one was found during a routine urine test.  With this one, I had so much pain and burning, especially when I had to urinate.  First urine test indicated UTI with many E.coli and some trace blood.  Was told  to take nitrofurantoin , until my culture came back. When I had taken two 100mg of drug, I was feeling just awful and sick.  This is my 4th day on meds, and I finally am able to urinate without too much discomfort, but still not normal.  No  results back from my culture, which I find so ridiculous. Last night I had the worse headache I have ever had!  Took Tylenol, but it did not work. As soon I get back my results, I am will ask to go on another drug.The side effects are not worth taking this horrific drug.I have never had such dreadful, frightful, alarming and very depressing side effects  a medicine in all my  65 years.  There has to be a better way to clear a UTI.  It's 2018!!! Shame on  the company that produced this drug.
After 7 days, the UTI remains. I have to return to Dr office to ask for DIFFERENT ANTIBIOTIC. Waste of my time and still suffering!

I’m sure this drug works wonders for some people, but I’ve never seen an antibiotic with so many side effect warnings and unfortunately I suffered severely from this drug after only three doses. By the end of the second day I was deathly ill. Couldn’t eat, couldn’t drink, scared, anxious, depressed. I developed stiff sore muscles all around my back and chest so badly that I couldn’t even laugh or cough without pain. It has been 6 days since I stopped the nitrofurantion and I am still facing the effects of anxiety, slight depression from being hardly able to leave my house and still battling the UTI. It did take away the stinging I was experiencing but the side effects were no where near worth the UTI healing. The UTI didn’t clear because I was on it for so little time and ended up on another antibiotic. Use at your own risk and if you’re a working person that can’t afford time off choose your drugs very wisely and ask a lot of questions. Side effects can be life altering.
I’m on day 3 on this medication and it doesn’t seem to work, still have the uncomfortable sensation every time I urinate .

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Was prescribed Macrobid 7 day course for a UTI. Was fine at first, but by day 5 started to experience nausea and gas. Continued meds, but after day 6, I was so sick I had to stop. Weakness, joint pain, uncontrollable shivering and fever. Shortness of breath. Thought was the flu. Didn't take med for a day, started feeling better. Resumed med and again sooo sick! Have taken many different antibiotics and NEVER had any reactions. Won't take this again!

honestly I came on here to ease the minds of people who were prescribed this because the reviews are scary. I took this for a week to cure my UTI and it did it’s job, with no side effects. I’m 21 and overall healthy, I was taking no other medication with this antibiotic and have no pre-existing conditions.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):The day after starting this medication I woke up with the worst nausea. It felt just like horrible morning sickness (which I've suffered with both kids). It was so bad that I even took multiple pregnancy test. The funny thing is that the side effects on the bottle only say "may have discolored urine". Nothing about the drowsiness or taking with food. I'm on day 5 and don't know how I will make it the next 5 days. I'm sick all day with nausea and cramping. I've never experienced anything like this on antibiotics. Crazy town.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin): I took this medication twice a day for 7 days. My UTI is cleared up and I had NO SIDE EFFECT. I just finished my last pill on 7/09/2018.*Please don't believe everything you read - remember everyone reacts differently*I wish you luck with your condition

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Thankful that it cleared up my UTi right away and thankful it’s over with. Will not miss constantly waking up early with my heart beating extremely fast, diarrhea, and nausea.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had an extremely painful UTI and was prescribed macrobid. Took it with food on the first day and was fine, then woke up at 5am on day 2 (today) vomiting bile. Repeated at least 5 times in a couple of hours. I am making sure to keep my stomach full at all times today as when I am not constantly eating something the nausea comes back. I am also very tired. I can at least say that my UTI symptoms are clearing up but I am not looking forward to taking this drug for a whole week.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Went to dr for an annual checkup and apparently had a mild UTI. I’ve finished 4 days of Macrobid but am unsure whether I can toughen out Day 5. I’ve had headaches, muscle pain, nausea, severe diarrhea, severe stomach pain, and insomnia. Not to mention I started an antidepressant on day 1 of this and I’m PMSing, which also worsens these symptoms. I was stuck in a car for 6 hours today and 4 hours tomorrow... this Med is not compatible with driving

Pro: nitrofurantoin did get rid of my UTI after 7 days 2x/day use. Cons: I had intense drowsiness, luckily I work from home and was able to step away to nap, but couldn't have kept my eyes open if I tried. The most worrisome side effect was the blurry vision. I had sudden blurred vision in one eye towards the end of the week's dose and it has not gone away after 5 days. I had perfect sight before so this is very abnormal. Won't be taking this medication again!

Nitrofurantoin works. I was suffering from a severe infection for at least a month and it took 3-4 days for his medicine to actually show visible results and  for my symptoms to start disappearing. Just wanted people to know that not everyone suffers from allergies to this and you should consult your doc before discontinuing a course of antibiotics. UTI can get severe if left untreated. Don't take it lightly.

After reading reviews from others I felt it necessary to gjve true honest assessment. Too many people claim to have bad experiences, bad side effects from this medicine because they have read others negative reviews, and the power of suggestion causes too many people to manifest every bad reaction instantly. The claims that this medication made sicker within a such a short time after first dose is ridiculous.The only reaction anyone would have to a medication that fast is an allergic reaction, allergic reactions are serious and should not be ignored. It's quite possible that the UTI may get worse until medication starts working. A UTI can make you feel just awful, beyond urinary discomfort, after all its an infection, give this a real chance it works. I was prescribed for UTI and it worked just fine, follow the directions and most importantly drink, drink, drink water (not alcohol!).
I was on nitrofurantoin for 5 days twice a day. I had zero problems absolutely no side effects. Thank you Lord.....

I was feeling off so went to doctor and they took stool sample , blood, urine everything besides imaging and found all normal but a UTI. I was so shocked I had no idea I had a UTI. I was prescribed this and I am On day 2.5 and yesterday I felt like vomiting and passing out. Woke up at 5:30 couldn't sleep and felt icky again. Took another pill (thinking my icky feeling was the UTI) and went to Walmart hours later. In Walmart and felt the same way going to pass out and throw up worst anxiety ever. I do not recommend this to anyone. So I got home and started reading side effect and it says there are cases that the pill can kill you and be fatal with no warning signs. Sorry and  WHAT ?!?! And all this for a UTI that I had no symptoms of um NO!!!! Be safe out there. Big pharmaceutical don’t care about us ! That’s like saying hey shoot yourself in rate cases people die. Come on people !!! Very upset right now

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve been taking nitrofurantoin for a UTI for 3 days. Very quickly I felt tired, achy and either hot or cold. I’m now confined to bed and I need to work next week. I don’t even know if I can bear to continue.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Red dots everywhere on my body for over 2 months now! Macrobid sent me to the ER!  My throat was swelling and closing shut!  My lips were swollen.  These red dots look like I have chicken pox and have ruined my summer!  My DR said the dots may last for four months or more.

I'm 12 weeks pregnant and got a UTI so my doctor prescribed me this. It is the freaking worst. I'm only the second dose and I seriously feel horrible. I feel nauseous and exhausted. Thankfully I haven't thrown up yet but honestly, I think it's only because I'm also on medicine for morning sickness. I will admit my UTI feels better so I think it's working. I can only hope the symptoms ease up.

The bad reviews scared me off, but after a week of pain, I caved in and took the medicine. I am on my fifth day (out of seven days) and have felt no bad side effects. I take it twice per day (100MG) and I always eat food with the medicine. I'm glad I took it after all! I read a story online of a girl that didn't take her medicine and her UTI turned into a kidney infection and got sepsis and nearly died, that is what made me realize - okay wow, I really need to take this medicine to prevent this. Anyways long story short, I feel no bad side effects whatsoever. No drowsiness or sickness at all :) I wanted to make sure that I wrote a review to let other people know that this medicine isn't bad at all, I have no idea what the other bad reviews are about, I imagine the few people who have a bad reaaction write reviews and the ones who have now problems don't even think about writing a reveiw. I've had no trouble at all with this medicine

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Never again. Day one I felt drowsiness as suspected. Day two nausea! I thought it was something I ate. I’m on day three now and I felt nausea again, shortness of breath this time, and also mild diarrhea. I’m done taking this and I’m going to call my doctor tomorrow. My UTI doesn’t feel like it’s there anymore though. I will still never take this again. I’ve never had any side effects like this with other UTI meds. This is ridiculous.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took this because the Bactrim didn't seem to work.  I took this and was nauseous and very tired but I continued and the infection did go away.  I'm not sure if I will take this in the future.  Other medications may interfere; but I am not a doctor.

My doctor found leukocytes in my urine, so he proceeded to send it for culture and prescribed this to me. I had no symptoms of a UTI prior to this, so it was a bit of a shock to hear him say that. I took this drug for about 7 days with no bad side effects. However, once I hit the last two days of my prescribed dosage, I started getting cramps and had a hard time passing urine. I thought drugs were supposed to eliminate UTI's, not cause them? I'm going to see my doctor this week, but this probably shouldn't have happened.
The worst medication, I felt like I have the flu , fever chills cough chest pain nausea joint pain please stop prescribing this medication

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I will never take this drug again.  The first day of taking it, I got a migraine headache, and the fifth day I was having bad eye vision in my left eye.  After two days of not taking this drug I still have blurred vision in my left eye.  This drug is not a good drug to take, and I recommend that no one take this drug.  It is not worth the side effects and your money.

I have never experienced a headache this bad before, so bad, I was prescribed  this different antibiotic - nitrofurantion and  after only 2 days I was soooo ill, shaky, sick feeling almost straight away, dizzy, weak. I was told I may feel ill but it was good for UTI's. If it works for you great but I won't take it again.

If I could give this medicine a zero I would!!! Worst medication I have ever taken. First day taking it I felt nauseous right away and dizzy to the point of almost falling over with room spinning. Thought it would go away next day but it didn’t. On day 2 I started feeling itchy in vaginal area. I thought I was going to die. By day 3 of taking medicine , the vaginal itch was so bad and raw I went and bought vaginal itch cream to give some relief. Unfortunately it didn’t give any relief. Also started with diarrhea on day 3. Day 4 I called my doctor who told me to stop this medicine right away. Started with a cough today and tightness in my chest. Drinking loads of water to flush this out of my system. I will definitely NEVER take this medicine again
I have been taking this for 2.5 days for a UTI. I feel worse than before. I am not taking the rest. I’m weak and nauseous

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Day 2 on this medication after having a tolerance to the Monurol (fosfomycin) treatment. The symptoms of the UTI are gone but I feel very nauseous and weak. I hope it goes away ...

This medicine is great for infection. But the side effects have been devastating for me causing a severe neuropathy, vertigo, poor balance muscle weakness and hair loss and I’m unable to walk and move my arms in the normal way. since having this medication.  Anyone feeling a burning pain and tingling in arms and legs should cease and ask doctors advice.

I don't understand how a drug like nitrofurantoin can even be prescribed.  I took 3 days worth for a UTI.  I had chills, my skin hurt, all of my muscles were sore, I developed a cough and felt like I had the flu for 2 days.  I finished my last pill 36 hrs ago, and today I have to use my inhaler.I will never take any prescribed medicine again without reading up on it.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):Poison. I’m having severe side effects after four days. They came on gradually. Ears are very sensitive to noise, constantly ringing. My eyes almost feel like they have mini seizures when I watch something that moves too fast. My hands and feet tingled and got very cold to the touch, even when it was 90 outside.  I quit taking it and this morning I still woke up with a new side effect, difficulty breathing. I even asked the doctor for something else when he prescribed this and he insisted this is what I needed. To top it all off it wasn’t helping the UTI at all, my symptoms only got worse!  Going to start Keflex today and I pray it works!

I've had macrobid many times since I was a teenager for recurrent UTIs.  I never had a major side effect until my most recent Rx for a "mild uti" discovered in a repeat urine test I was given after having passed a kidney stone.  On the 7th dose of a 2x a day 7 day course of Nitrofurantoin I took the dose before bed and woke 2 hours later with severe chest pain and burning, numbness and tingling in my hands and feet.  I've since had 3 EKGs, which showed a depression in the ST wave indicating ischemia (blocked blood flow to the heart) I have never had heart problems and am a (before this) healthy 36 year old, Mother of two.  I week has passed, I've had an urgent care visit, an ER visit, a chest xray and a CT scan with no definitive answers.  This drug is toxic, I'm afraid that I might have heart damage.  My heart is struggling and the chest pain continues.  I'm afraid this may shorten my life.

I'm on day 2 of nitrofurantoin and my side effects are insane! I'm emetophobic, but that's an excuse for this medicine to be so harsh!!!!! I am extremely nauseous, dizzy, high anxiety, pain in abdominal area, farting (I don't mind that) and nightmares (so bad I could write a better book than Steven King). I have been taking zofran and promethezine to try to not feel sick and to keep going, but it only helped a bit. And those medicines can help with the flu! I serious rather have the UTI pain than this pill. I would not recommend this medicine to other emetophobics and to people that hate throwing up or being nauseous.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This was a terrible Rx and should be banned.  For the week I took Macrobid, I have severe stomach cramps, nausea, dizziness, headache, severe gas, leg cramps/Charley horses, and extreme fatigue.  My last day I took them was Saturday and it felt like I had the flu on Sunday.  I could hardly move, every bone in my body ached, and I either had chills or a fever.  I sweat all night long and Monday felt much better.   I took probiotics, ate yogurt, took magnesium while taking this but this drug was way wrong for me.  Hope there is a better antibiotic I can take next time.  I am also allergic to ciproflaxin.   This stuff is horrible.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid is absolutely dreadful, It got rid of my infection fast but it actually came back, and the side effects were horrible. It made me wobbly, shaky, and made me so sick I kept almost throwing up. It made me very very tired but I could barely sleep, I will not be taking this medicine again.
Given 8 days course of nitrofurantoin , 4 pills a day. An hour after taking 1st pill  I felt really sick.  I got to day 3 and felt awful so stopped taking them. Never felt so ill in all my life

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m on day 5 of a 7 day course for a UTI. This medication has had horrible side effects for me. Within hours of taking the first dose I had nausea. I took it exactly as directed with food. The next couple of days I didn’t have any other issues, and today I’ve started having nausea, vomiting, and shortness of breath after taking my morning dose. I’m going to try and tough it out since I only have 2 days left, but I’ll try to avoid this medication from now on.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Horrible! Constant nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, lack of appetite and fatigue! Never again will I take this medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I  am 70. I tried natural treatments for an UTI but I still had some discomfort, tested positive with Azo test strips. I have had two days of Microbid and  the headache, nausea, weakness, etc, is making me feel awful. So, here I lie in bed at 4 am, unable to sleep. Not sure if I can hold out to see if this med clears the UTI
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was in great pain and microbid did take a long time to alleviate the burning sensation that UTI Brings. Another antibiotic like cypro is way better.

I am 7 months pregnant with UTI, also nursing an infant. Prescribed Nitrofurantoin Mono for 10 days. Horrible side effects- migraine headache that left me nearly unable to care for my children, loss of appetite, irritable bowels, unable to sleep because I could feel the medication surging through my body, when I did sleep I had terrible nightmares. My nursing infant was extremely crabby with minor bowel issues. Still feeling sensitivity with urination after discontinuing use. I refuse to take any more. Constantly flushing with water all day long throughout.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After taking only one in the evening I woke up the following morning and when I got out of bed I was about to faint so I lay on the floor for a while but each time I tried to get up I fainted again so lay there for about half an hour before the feeling passed. I had to get to the bathroom where I was very sick. This went on most of the day, sick and fainting. Followed by sore muscles and joints, a headache and a bad thirst. Next morning I felt a bit better but as the day went on all the pain returned with a vengeance. Very sore muscles and joints again and blurred  vision, I just went to bed. The 3rd day I felt better. They are hideous and should never be prescribed.....

If I could give nitrofurantoin a zero I would. DON'T take it- demand an alternative. I was on it for a week (I still have a UTI surprise, surprise) and I have the worst itch around my vagina and anus. I've also lost 5 pounds in 3 days even with eating 2500 calories a day. My body now looks saggy and  disgusting and I had confidence issues before this - thanks dr.  I have also developed a dry cough that's apparently the first sign of a lung injury just read the leaflet about all the horrible side effects . Also I had a LIGHT gym session the day I started taking them, then my muscles were too stiff to walk properly for about 5 days and I lost all the bending forward flexibility in my back to the point that I can't touch my knees never mind my toes (I can usually put my palms on the floor quite easily) feel horribly depressed too and knackered am a normally fit late 20s woman

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Was placed on a 7 day course (1 capsule PO every 12 hours) for a suspected UTI and bladder infection. Medication seemed to work right away after day 1 with no side effects. However, started having severe flatulence and diarrhea on day 2 although I took the medication after meals. Symptoms just got worse and worse with each dose. By day 3, I experienced muscle fatigue followed by elevated heart rate, nausea, chills, and fever before bed. Woke up in the middle of the night burning from the fever and couldn't get out of bed in the morning. UTI symptoms are completely gone however. Not looking forward to finishing the rest of the course at all (I think I will discontinue if symptoms worsen). Keep in mind that side effects vary from individual to individual. If you're few of the lucky ones, you won't experience many of these symptoms at all.

This is the worst medication for UTIs. Took these for a couple days and I experienced chills, major headaches, nausea, and stomach pain. I felt more sick from the medication than from the UTI. Horrible!

I’ve never had a reaction to antibiotics except this one. I had been sick with a stomach bug so that is why I went to doctor to be sure wasn’t flu and then they said I had a UTI. I am 7 months pregnant and the Dr prescribed for a very mild UTI. I  was told to take one that evening and 2 the next day. Worst watery diarrhea ever and that night I thought I was having a heart attack because the heart palpitations were so strong along with the worst acid reflux. I also had zero energy, granted I know I’m pregnant but this drug made me so lethargic and I have  a 2 yr old to look after to. Lastly weird ringing in ears. I stopped it early. Symptoms went away so the next day my energy came back and had slight diarrhea more solid (probably system getting back to normal) and no more heart palpitations. I wouldn’t want to take this ever again.

On my third course of this antibiotics. Only taken 2 tablets I will not be taking anymore. I have felt so ill today. Flu, shivers, stomach pain, headache, cough and at times feels like I am having a heart attack.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Male aged 70. Have had previous infections and on this occasion GP said we're now prescribing this instead of what you had previously.Never again! After a week of waking every two hours to pee which was restricted to a dribble I was completely exhausted. Fortunately I have a supportive wife but otherwise things would have been very difficult. Headache for the week also. Burning sensation when passing urine until finally the seven day supply was finished. What a relief! It appears to have cleared the infection but the 'side effects' are dreadful.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’m currently in day 6 of 7 for a UTI. I was lucky to discover my UTI very early so I didn’t have bad sickness from that. However, I’ve felt worse from taking this drug. My symptoms are fatigue, headache, high anxiety, tightness in chest, smelly gas, low blood sugar( so low that my hands started to shake really bad) mood swings, and insomnia.
Gave me TERRIBLE MIGRAINES!!!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Horrible side effects I had to go to urgent care. I asked for Cipro usually 5 will do. New doctor mine was out of town I will never go back. I am so weak with nausea, cramps, vomiting, headache, coughing and sinus infection with fatigue so bad.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took macrobid with some hesitation after reading side affects but I was fine only side effect was slight headache

I was given a 7 day take twice a day  treatment for a UTI. Oh my goodness when I say this medicine has me feeling like I'm about to die -  I feel horrible. I have been having nausea, throwing up, lets not even talk about eating - I haven't had any appetite and have been very tired. I have been on other UTI medicine before and been GREAT but this here is the worst. The only reason I'm giving it 5 is because it feels like my UTI is gone but with two days worth of pills left I will not be taken them  - I just can't as  I FEEL HORRIBLE

This med is not for me. It causes very bad side effects. Tight chest cough, difficulty to breathe, temperature, headache, and weakness. I'm not going to finish the treatment. Never will take it again. My UTI symptoms got better only 50%. Is so sad.

This is not a drug to be taken!!!!  I took one pill and after about 8 hours I was deathly ill.  Fever 102.7, bad chills, sick to my stomach, chest pain, hurting shoulders and neck, dizzy.  You name it,,,,I thought I was dying.  I should have gone to the hospital but didn't feel like moving. After nearly 2 days, I finally started to feel better. Just really weak and not back to normal.   DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICINE.....trust me.  Please.....I have been sick with many medicines but NOT like this.

I was prescribed this for my UTI twice a day for a week. After four days of the medicine my UTI pain actually was worse and I broke out in little bumps all over my face neck and chest. Would not recommend.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I rarely suffer side effects from medication, but Macrobid has been a hard route, as following the 1st dose, began suffering extreme nausea, gas, stomach pain, anxiety.  I pushed forward thru dose 4, when I decided on Day 3 to skip all medication, but did take only 1 dose of Macrobid with something to eat late in the evening, hoping to bypass nausea. I awoke early & began vomiting once an hour for 4 hours...so I'm calling Dr to request a different medication.

I do NOT recommend this drug. I have taken this twice (once a year ago, and now a day ago). Both times I have been weak, shivers, unable to stay conscious for multiple days, dizzy to the point I cannot walk, terrible fever etc. On top of this it hasn’t cleared my infection either time - not worth the side effects. Other medication clears the infection with minimal side effects.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I'm currently taking these twice a day for UTI. I'm on day 5  and I can't seem to sleep,  it takes me hours my chest keeps getting tight when breathing and coughing a lot and constant headache today. I haven't eaten a meal or breakfast since 3 days ago because I have lost my appetite. I don't even feel slightly hungry. I wish these 2 days I have left on these tablets would hurry up cos I want to go sleep and eat a meal. They have got rid of my UTI my urine has also gone bright yellow as well

I was put on Macrobid for a UTI because I have had anaphylactic reactions to both Bactrim and penicillin based antibiotics. After the first dose I felt much better, still having pain when peeing but my kidney pain and weakness was gone. After taking the 2nd dose I started feeling extremely sick, pounding headache, blurred vision, intense nausea and pain in my neck and chest. Also still having UTI symptoms. I am afraid to take my next dosage.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I should of taken 4 in the space of 2 days by taken 2 ( 2 ever 12 hours) after taking my first one I got a severe bad headache and back pain, my kidney's swelled up and so did my spine. I got a red rash along my back and was struggling to sleep and breath. Didn't want to eat or drink and wasn't myself. The second day I took another after a few hours I completely lost my breath I was struggling, burning up all over, left shoulder felt loose and hurt, wasn't with it at all and thought it was the end as I was on the phone to 111. Today I didn't take anything going to the doctors as I've had a severe allergic reaction to these meds bad throat and chesty cough. My tablet's where blue and yellow and others seem to of have yellow and black? Really wouldn't recommend these to anyone!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I am on Macrobid for a UTI. I've had 3 doses so far. I have some shortness of breath since starting it and today I've had joint pain and muscle pain. I have arthritis in my hip and now the pain is much worse. I read these can be side effects. I don't really know when I have a UTI because I catherize myself. I do get some back pain and some lower abdominal pain and my urine showed I did have an infection. I'm a diabetic and it's causing low blood sugars. I don't like the Macrobid and have been on Cipro in the past which didn't cause any side effects. Today is Friday and my doctor won't be back till Tuesday. I'll try to stick it out, but if I feel worse tomorrow I'm going to stop taking it and wait till Tuesday when my doctor is back.

Some comments imply all the logged side effects of this drug are not the drug but the urine infection. My GP has assured me that this is not the case. One 50 mg capsule caused extreme headache, nausea, fatigue, diarrhea with blood, nose bleed and a complete inability to function in any small way. I persevered taking 7 capsules in total as advised, before contacting my GP who saw me that same day. She was so concerned, she felt I should have a CAT scan. Just change the drugs I pleaded, its 10 hours since I took one ( 50 mg every 6 hours) and I can feel myself improving. This she did and after 3 days I was able to do light household chores, although still very fatigued. Two weeks later I am nearly back to normal, just my stamina a little low. UTI has gone after taking Trimethoprim which had minimum side effects. Why Nitrofurantonin causes these extreme adverse side effects in some but not in others is a mystery but believe me if you are susceptible they can make you very unwell.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have foolishly taken macrobid twice for the same infection. It seems to clear it up but actually it reappeared within two weeks. Both time had a severe reaction. High fever alternating with chillsNo energy whatsoeverSleeping all the timeTerrible headachesNausea Unable to eat no appetite whatsoeverDry mouth no saliva to the extent my mouth stuck together overnight and my lips cracked and it felt like I had a trout pout my mouth was so swollen tongue fuzzed up and feeling like sandpaper. These drugs are cruel, I will tell my GP I cannot take ever again , I went downhill from getting the drugs, at first I imagined it was the infection coming out or maybe worse, I have a cancer, but I really should have read these reviews the negatives are spot on. I too was referred to ER who probably weren’t aware of the side effects or that they could be so bad

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):UTI with very mild symptoms but I was traveling so I wanted to get something to take care of it pronto. Doctor said Macrobid (two 100mg for 7 days) had 85% success rate, so that sounded pretty good to me. Second day on it I was driving on the 10 freeway in Los Angeles and had to pull over from unbelievable anxiety. It felt like I had a tunnel vision like perspective. These side effects progressed so I stopped the medication after the 3rd day. Side effects didn’t go away. The night after I stopped taking Macrobid I was up until 2am with what felt like an insane flu. I almost drove myself to the ER because I thought the UTI spread (?) I was so confused by what was going on. This is 3rd day off this drug and still dealing with side effects.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):How does anyone take this drug?  Severe migraine, severe nausea...you can't complete the course of therapy if you're sick in bed.  There are better choices out there.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Took one pill a couple of months ago & violently vomited several hours later.Tried again yesterday.  Took 2 doses.  Nausea & vomiting followed a few. Hours later.I took it exactly as directed with food.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I used this twice daily for 7 days for my UTI. It got rid of my worst symptoms but it didn’t completely get rid of the infection. After 7 days I still have mild symptoms and I just checked with the doctor and I still have the UTI infection. He just me prescribed Cipro. Hopefully that works.

I went to urgent care Monday they prescribed 100mg twice day.  I started taking Monday night was up all night with fever and chills. By Tuesday flu like symptoms throwing up. Sore all over.  I have never taken this medication before now and I'm 50 yrs old. Will be making sure all my medical records  say never to take this again.  It should be banned!!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Was prescribed this during my first trip to the National health service (NHS)  since moving to England. Typical UTI, and the timing made sense, so I knew the routine. I was prescribed Macrobid because "we have a better drug for UTI over here that isn't being used in the states and you should try it". It was at least 36 hours before I started to feel symptoms going away, which I found troublesome - my trusty Cipro always worked within a couple hours. I'm currently on day 5 of 7, and have found every night I wake up after about three hours sleep both with stomach cramps and completely ravenous. I'm so sleepy, I can barely complete a day at the office before coming home and passing out. I've thankfully not had the headaches others have described, but between the stomach aches, the drastic sleepiness, and delay in relief (which makes me scared of return soon as meds are done) I will definitely be requesting Cipro if there is a next time.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is my second time taking this med for a UTI. Last time I took it I thought the horrible stomach pain, fever, chills, aches all over and pounding headache worse than my migraines was due to the infection because it took so long for it to clear. This time I have a milder infection and Today I started to feel better until I took this drug, and almost immediately the side effects kicked in so bad was bedridden, again. Yesterday I wasn’t able to get out of bed all day. I woke up crying the first morning I was in so much pain.  I’m going to call my dr first thing tomorrow bc this is torture, and after reading these reviews and feeling so much better today before I took it, I know its the drug and not my infection. And the first time I took this med, I was sick for two weeks after. My dr refused to write me a note for work because they said that you don’t get that sick from this type of infection

It is 2:25 a.m. and I have just made an appointment at a clinic for 9:15 a.m.  I just finished a 5 day course of Macrobid (nitrofurantoin) yesterday morning.  It hasn’t worked.  I started the RX on Friday and on Monday I felt that I had started all over with the symptoms but still had 5 pills to go so felt I had to give it a chance and finish.  Tues. night was awful, Wed. during the day I thought there might be hope but here I am after a very uncomfortable night.  I AZO tested at 2 a.m. and leukocytes are dark purple.  I had utilized a program where I can do a face to face visit with a Dr. on my phone, and UTI was on the list of illnesses.  I told the Dr. that Cipro is what has worked in the past as I generally suffer UTI twice a year, despite all my precautions, but he was concerned about side effects and therefore ordered Macrobid.  Time and $ wasted all around and almost a week of pain and anxiety.

I have chronic UTI and nothing has worked for me. I'm on a daily dose of probiotics and cranberry pills. If I have sex and don't take a probiotics after it's almost guaranteed I will get a UTI. It's just terrible. So the urologist recommended I take this after having sex- one last 24 hours. I refuse to do that because I'm scared I'll become immune but this time I didn't take my probiotics and sure enough I got a UTI. I take one nitrofurantoin and within an hour I feel better. If this drug didn't exist I'd be dead. I've never had any side effects.

Been on this med nitrofurantoin for 3 days of a 5 day cours.  I've experienced the worst headaches, chills, bone pain, weakness and upset stomach.   No appetite feeling felt like I needed to be in someone's hospital but I am toughing it out feel 75 percent better tho got a follow up Dr. appt in the a.m. UTI is no joke. Hope I never got to take this drug again! Drinking up lots of water here on out.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed Macrobid for UTI. I have taken it once before and had to come off it. This time the first day I took it had massive headache. I get migraines but this felt like my head was being crushed. I could barely move from bed. Had to have those cold migraine strips on my forehead. The pain was horrendous.  First three days had headache. Felt nauseous, anxious, heart was palpitating, had no energy. Felt like I was going to fall over.  Went to urgent care again and they cultured my urine and said if they found something that wouldn't respond to Macrobid they would contact me. Finished yesterday and still don't feel myself. I hope tomorrow is a better day.

I have  previously done this treatment (4 pills daily for a week) After a year, I got UTI again, and tried another antibiotics, which just relieved for a short time my infection but did not clear it. Nitrofurantoin is the only one that got rid of the infection for a long time compared to others, the treatment is just a bit harder because of the amount of water you need to consume, and the only side effect I experienced both times is stomach ache and a little nausea, but very mild.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):While Macrobid got rid of my symptoms quickly, less than one  month later, it’s was back and worse than the first time.  Nurse at the clinic told me they and over a dozen people coming back for a UTI after being prescribed Macrobid.  Don’t be shy with you doctor if they prescribe this med. Total waste of time and money!!!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I’ve gotten UTI’s periodically throughout my life and since becoming sexually active I typically get an infection 1-2x/yr. I am very diligent with my hygiene and take preventative measures, yet I still get them on occasion. This time around I was prescribed Macrobid to take 2x/day for 5 days. I have taken this medication once before and it successfully treated my UTI. This time however, on my fourth day of taking this medication I could still feel my symptoms through the AZO pills (which I was taking around the clock all 4 days). I was worried the antibiotics weren’t working, but I gave them a chance. I want to note that I also experienced HIGH anxiety throughout the duration of this UTI. Anyway, 24 hours after finishing my prescription, the UTI was back in full force. I had to go in for a urine culture and was given a different antibiotic (Cephalexin) which I start today. Hoping this will be the solution. It’s been a miserable week.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Awful, thought I was going to die, sweats, fever, tight chest etc, confusion.  Imagine a Flu bug that you wouldn't wish on you're worst enemy that is this awful product!!

Uti. Most of these reviews repeat the same thing and must be big pharmas way of Rxing levaquin (that literally dissolves geriatric ligaments and tissue) and the super all inclusive spectrum antibiotics that kill everything. Macrobid works great. My GP tried to dose me with levaquin again after I’ve been on a great probiotic schedule and I was like please don’t. So she rxed macrobid. It is great. No side effects besides somewhat loose stool, neon urine, and bad gas. I’ll take that over some of these hardcore antibiotics any day. Burning subsided by 2nd pill.

HEY,  this stuff really works, no kidding!  Two pills and my pain when peeing is gone!  No side effects either.. well at least so far.  If you have a UTI this the the stuff you want to take.  I had forgotten what it felt like to feel normal again.

I’ve seen so many negative reviews on here that I wanted to leave my experience. I’m one of those lucky? people that is prone to UTIs. I can follow all the rules in the book, and I still get them. I’m also allergic to sulfa, which eliminates Bactrim as a possible antibiotic. I start to feel better within about 3 hours of taking the first dose of Nitrofurantoin. My urologist actually put me on a month regime of this, and I didn’t have a UTI for over a year and a half, unheard of for me. It does make me sleepy and turns my pee neon, but I don’t have symptoms other than that!

Prescribed 10 tablets for mild UTI. Headache started after first day and has never gone away. Have taken half the course and will not continue. Crushing headache, dry mouth, dehydrated and feeling generally very unwell. Unable to go to work have had to spend day lying down. Would not recommend this drug. Will not take again.

Nitro Macro (nitrofurantoin):Just like Cipro, Nitro made it impossible to walk on my right foot.  Cipro made my arch feel like I had  creamed the edge of a brick (and left me limping in the hospital before my surgery and too messed up to drive to the doctor after discharge.)  Nitro, without a drip, took longer first making my right wrist tendons feel like a sprain, and then made my right heel suddenly hurt, literally, like I stepped on a spike in the center of the heel.  I needed a cane to get back to my bed.  I stopped the drug an my heel recovered immediately.  My right wrist still hurts today, three weeks later with little recovery.  The hurt begins outside of my little finger knuckle , goes below my wrist bone and fades out towards the forearm.  I use my left hand more than ever  before in my 72 yr old life.

This drug resolved my mild UTI very quickly with the caveat that it made my mouth (saliva?) taste rancid. These pills had me brushing my teeth three times a day and downing mints like crazy. I guess that's a pretty bearable side effect though; I had no nausea or headaches.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Was diagnosed with a UTI and was prescribed macrobid. Day 1 I was super tired but didn't pay no mind to it. Second day 2nd dose it's like I got run over millions of times. Super tired nausea vomiting stomach pain dizzy chills night sweats loss of appetite crazy he'll headaches. I just continued to take it thinking it was my UTI. After day 3 dose 5 I knew it was the medicine so had to stop it. Felt so bad and just couldn't do anything. I have been off it for 5 days and still feeling chills and dizziness. Hopefully it goes away soon. Will make an appointment with a doctor by Thursday if not a 100%

I think the problem I had with this is I took too much of it in too short a time. Took 100mg 2x a day for a week in mid December for a bladder infection. Made me a little nauseous after each pill but it would pass and it cleared up the infection. A month and a half later, I was put on the same dose for what was later found out to be symptoms of an ovarian cyst and not a bladder infection. Before we figured that out, I took the Macrobid for about 4 days and felt like death the whole time. No appetite, hot flashes, a horrible cough, fever, felt like I couldn’t get out of bed, horrible diarrhea. All of which subsided a few days after I stopped taking it. I felt like I was being poisoned. Never taking it again.

I've just had the most miserable week of my life, like other comments I have had violent headaches, nausea, tummy upset, fever, chills, breathlessness, loss of appetite and general weakness. I was told by the pharmacist they were changing the antibiotics as patients were becoming immune but clearly this is not the drug to use. I can barely get out of bed and gave to spend most of the day resting feeling very poorly. I persevered as it says side effects will disappear once the course is over, two more days to go. I have contacted my surgery to let them know this drug does not agree with me, they were most concerned and offered to prescribe a different drug but I don't want to suffer another set of unpleasant side effects.

My doctor prescribed me Nitrofurantion Mono-Mcr 100 mg Capsules and the very first day I had pain in my lower right side it was so bad I could not stand up or move then it was hard for me to breath. On my third day my ears were swollen and turned reddish purple and my whole face started to burn. This antibiotic has made things worse

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed the generic of Macrobid for a UTI.  The last day of the treatment, early evening I started with severe chills which ended up being a very high fever.  The next day I was not able to lift my head off pillow as my head was pounding and now my temp is over 102.  I was taken to ER.  ER could not find ANYTHING wrong with me.  I was brought back to ER within 30 hours with 102.9 fever, covered in rash, ALL joints huge, red and painful, bottoms of feet burning lost the ability to walk without a 2 man assist.  I was admitted to the hospital and spent 5 days with doctors testing everything possible for an answer.  The answer was severed adverse allergic reaction to this hideous medicine.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This is just my 3rd day on this medication and I am not sure what to do. I vomit about 2-3 hours after a dosage, loose stool, horrible smelling gas , upset stomach and neon green urine. However my UTI appears to be going away. I never want to experience this again.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this poison by my doctor for a UTI. One capsule to be taken every 12 hours after 5 tablets I had to stop them  I thought I was going to die. I can’t remember when I last felt so ill. It seems to have cleared the UTI but at what cost it has been a week now and still not feeling well.  I hope it clears up soon. I’ll never take macrobid again. I think doctors must tell us about the side affects of this drug when prescribing it so we can make our mind up if we want to take it. We know that most drugs have side affects but believe me you don’t want the ones you get with macrobid. Get an alternative anti biotic for a UTI if you can please be aware

I agree that this did help my bladder infection, but I ended up in urgent care with cold shakes, chills and body aches.  I was terrified I had a kidney infection after 24 hours of this drug. 48 hours in I felt fine, only to break out in a rash from head to toe 72 hours in. Avoid this if you can!

I think the drug worked pretty fast because I felt a lot less discomfort within 1 or 2 doses, but the side effects are not great. I've had diarrhea the entire time, a couple of headaches, and vertigo once. I'd definitely choose a different antibiotic next time.

After having recurrent UTI's for the past couple months I decided to finally go to the doctor. After 3 days on this antibiotic I got the worst headache of my life. Horrible, throbbing headache, anxiety, sore throat, and achy bones. I though this has to be the flu going around but after reading these reviews I'm skeptical that it was this antibiotic. That being sad it took away my UTI symptoms after 1 day but if I ever have another  UTI I will request something else

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):After first day of taking this medication, I started noticing a soreness in my neck. It got increasingly worse each day. I contacted the doctor and was told to discontinue taking it. I stopped yesterday and still have a very sore gland in my neck. It hurts when I swallow.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I'm wondering from the occasional decent reviews on here if there is a high-quality version of this drug that my insurance has cheated me out of.  Because I have the horrible version and am suffering 20x more than what the UTI was giving me.  HORRIBLE headache - Tylenol not effective and afraid to take anything else due to the nausea.  Already allergic to one of the UTI antibiotics so I'm reluctuant to give this up after only 2 days but they have been 2 AWFUL days.  If only drugs were capable of targeting our specific problem without killing off the rest of our body!  Be prepared for the possibility you may not be able to work while on this - I sure as heck can't.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Never seen my daughter so ill. Called an ambulance tonight as since being prescribed these last week. She has vomited daily. Been in so much pain with no effect from these new tablets. The other nittrofurantion were small white tablets that work in one or two days. These cheap nasty drugs are in capsule form by MicroBID. With some other ingredient to make sure the penicillin works. They worked perfectly well. Another cheap nasty substitute to save money. Avoid like the plague and insist on your normal tiny white tablets. These are hideous and the side effects are savage. Will be filling in the yellow card. Discussed the harm and distress they have caused. Did nothing for the kidney infection. Scandalous

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):This antibiotic is the absolute worst antibiotics I have ever taken in my life. Not only did it not cure my infection it gave me horrific side effects. Within 3 to 4 hours of taking the tablets I was sick and had the worst headache of my life and I suffer from migraine and this didn't even compare. It felt like my skull was been squashed. After 48 hours of shaking, sickness, weakness and headaches I stopped taking the tablets and went back to doctors. What went from a mild kidney infection, I was nearly hospitalised. DO NOT TAKE THESE TABLETS! Unless you wanna feel like you wanna die.

Never having had any reaction to antibiotics before I took these and ended up being admitted to hospital with suspected meningitis:  High fever, banging headache, rash ..... typical symptoms!  I could hardly walk and I felt so ill.  I had a lumbar puncture which came back clear (Thank God) so the Doctor's put it down to 'a virus'.  However, some time later I got another infection and started a new course of Nitrofurantoin.  Within a couple of days all the symptoms I'd previously experienced started again and the penny dropped!  My reason for writing this review is not to scare anyone, and probably for most there wont be any side effects, but to raise awareness for those people who have an adverse reaction.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this medication for a UTI while preg. 100 MG 2x a day for 7 days. I started the first dose at night so I took it & went to sleep. I took each dose with food as advised. By the evening of the 2nd night I had a terrible headache & a stiff achy neck. Let me reiterate the headache... I read the reviews but I really feel like I should emphasize this headache. I was in bed all afternoon & Tylenol did not help. The next day was the same. The morning was fine but by the afternoon/evening I had neck pain & that TERRIBLE headache. Now after the 5th dose or so the headaches & neck pain eased off for me.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Yes it worked and got rid of my UTI,  but side effects are just horrible and so frustrating as I have previously had other antibiotics for a UTI that had no side effects and worked perfectly fine. Headaches and stomach aches for the whole 7 days. I would definitely ask for an alternative.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took two 100 milligram capsules and felt like death.  I was extremely exhausted, had a low grade fever and woke up in cold sweats.  I must be highly allergic to this medication.

I do believe that it has cleared my UTI, but I can't finish the dosage. I have pushed through four days of it, but took the last one I am going to take last night, as I still haven't gotten rid of the severe headache that accompanied it, and the ear pain. I thought all of my problems of sickness were coming from the UTI, but found that although those symptoms seemed to clear up, each time I'd take a dose, I would progressively feel worse and worse. Not the right drug for me. Now just hoping I can get rid of this headache.

I felt improvement in my UTI after 1 pill, with most pain and discomfort gone after the 3rd pill, so I would say this works.I felt some flu-ish sensations after my first pill--nausea, headache, crappy feeling -- and also the second day. On my third I am not really noticing any side effects.I would rate the side effects as much less unpleasant that a UTI, so for me its a fine tradeoff. I am on a 5 day course and I imagine that will be plenty to get this UTI totally out of the way, based on how I feel on day 3.

AVOID!!! I've taken a few antibiotics on my time and never had any side effects.  This drug on the other hand has been my worse nightmare, two days of taking it got chills/nausea/anxiety/headaches/ extreme giddiness (like being drunk)/stomach pain and numbness in legs and hands.  It's pretty much just poison.  I won't be taking it again  as never felt so bad.  The worst symptoms are the dizziness and numbness to limbs...nothing is worth that so I advise anyone to AVOID!!!

After the 2nd dose, I developed a fever, chills, extreme joint and muscle aches, nausea, and diarrhea. Felt like I had a really bad case of the flu. I felt so tired and horrible I couldn’t function at work.  The symptoms then started to subside as the doses wore off, which finally alerted me to the fact that I wasn’t really sick, but reacting to the medication. I took 3 pills in total, then after a horrible night in which I couldn’t even leave the bathroom, I went to my Dr and got a different prescription. It helped the UTI, but in my case I’d rather feel UTI symptoms than those extreme side effects.

I started taking this medicine January 2nd and it’s now January 4th and I’m absolutely over it. I’m prescribed to take it for a week but I just can’t deal with the side effects. My main issue is vomiting. I could be perfectly fine, then hours later, I’m throwing up. It’s given me a fever, chills, bad fatigue and of course, vomiting. It’s helped with the UTI tremendously. That’ll I will agree. But the other side effects are just too horrible. I honestly wouldn’t recommend taking this. Throwing up sucks.

My doctor prescribed this drug for me for a urinary tract infection.  I only took it for one day and then requested a different antibiotic.  I could not tolerate the severe nausea that this drug caused me.  The nausea kicked in about 30 minutes after I took the first pill and it didn't go away until 48 hours after I stopped taking this antibiotic.  Avoid this antibiotic!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Used for: UTI with susceptible E Coli in urine cultureCourse: 100 mg 2x daily for 7 days.I saw the positive effect on the 3rd day, which is later than with other antibiotics. Always took it with food or milk. First 2 days, I had legit migraines. Also, had a mild fever after the very 1st dose. Then, the sleepiness and 'brain tension' (literally, some tension in the brain :) ) kicked in. Unfortunately, the symptoms came back 12 hrs after the last dose, but I don't blame it on the drug. So, it should work for less severe cases and the side effects are tolerable. Go for it.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I read one comment stating that symptoms while taking this med were due to the UTI itself.  I can tell you from hard experience that this med has side effects, maybe not for all, but certainly for me.  This has been my third and last bout with this med. I was encouraged to take it twice, and had the same symptoms - severe headache, body aches, chills, nausea and vomiting, and diarrhea.  The second time, I reported this and was switched to Bactrim, which I have never had a problem with.  This time, I went to a doc in the box and Macrobid was prescribed again because it was the only med not to interact with my other meds. Same problems occurred. I am just recovering after 2 days of hell. This is real.

This medicine made me so sick and I feel horrible. I have body aches, chills, fever, and a headache. Every once in a while I feel nauseous and sick to my stomach. When I first took the medicine my stomach hurts so bad.I took it for two days then I stopped taking it.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was so scared to take this after reading the reviews but I had very little side effects, just a slight headache and a horrible taste in my mouth. I was given 100mg twice a day for 7 days. It seemed to work after a few days but now I’ve finished my course it has came back but just not as severe.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I've read many comments on here which make it sound like this drug is quite scary, but after going through many of the symptoms BEFORE even taking the drug, I've come to the conclusion the symptoms many people speak of are actually the symptoms of the kidney/urinary tract infection itself. It is awful! I am extremely sensitive to the lowest dose drugs but I was given 100mg of the slow release form of this drug. I have had no bad side effects from the drug - maybe a bit of drowsiness but that could also be because I'm pregnant. As predicted, it made my pee a funny colour but that is what is meant to happen. I have one more pill to take, whether it's got rid of the UTI, I'm sure it has as my pee no longer smells horrendous.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took this medicine for only 3 days. It’s is the worse antibiotics I took my whole life. If I could say anything it would be: DONT EVER TRY IT. You will feel almost dead. After 24 hours without this I’m feeling much better, not 100% but 50%. Don’t take this drug! It’s a poison!

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):Excelent for UTI. Especially for E. coli. I had problems with Escherichia coli and ciprofloxacin did not solve it in three consecutive treatments. With Macrodantin the bad smell of urine and fever gone at first dose!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I cannot believe that it's even legal to sell this poison.  Horrible side effects and not worth the risk, only took 3 pills and got extremely sick with body aches, headaches, intestinal problems, etc.
I also have really bad nausea when taking these tablets, try drinking peppermint tea I found it helped a wonder!

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took 2 capsules on day 1 and by evening, time for dose 3, I had joint pain, a  fever, chills and a headache. I thought I was getting the flu. Day 2 I was so weak I could not get out of bed nor eat. Took another capsule as I did not think a medication could cause this. By evening I was so sick I called my doc and he said to go to the ER. Thankfully I did. By the time I got there my Liver function was extremely impaired. Instead of being in the 9-35 range it was 667! After a day in the ER I was admitted to the hospital for 4 days. It took over 8 months for my Liver function to come down under 100. I don't drink or take either medications. The doc said this was a text book adverse reaction in the extreme.

Took one pill and it felt like a miracle. Was put on a dose of 1 tablet twice daily for 3 days. By the 5th tablet I was feeling flu like symptoms and dizziness. Not sure if I’m just feeling under the weather or it’s a side effect of taking this medication. Urine has also been bright yellow as many others have also stated. I would rather have this flu like symptom than feeling like I’m urinaring out razor blades. It definitely worked quickly and that worked for me.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Can't even explain how bad this made me feel.  SERIOUSLY thought I was dying.  Chills...Sweating ...throwing up...I actually passed out on my bathroom bath. My chest pain was so bad I thought I was having a heart attack. No desire to eat...I've never had a problem with meds like this before in my life. Never again. I took it for 2 days and stopped.  Be cautious.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Extreme drowsiness. Never felt quite this drowsy from taking a medication. I’m vomiting every hour or so, I feel so sick, I don’t even want to leave my bed. It seems to be working for my UTI however so that’s good. Maybe it’s meant to flush your system out which is why most people puke? Who knows.

Had 3 doses of nitrofurantoin/MacroBID (100mg) now after being diagnosed with a UTI.Symptoms of UTI seem to have decreased a lot already. However, a few hours after taking my dose, even with/after a meal, I feel nauseous and exhausted. Plus I get stomach, leg and headaches. My concentration when these antibiotic symptoms hit is also terrible. The course is only 3 days (2 doses twice a day) thankfully, but I would definitely ask for a different antibiotic if I ever get a UTI again!My advice is to take time off work/school, because personally I would not be able to cope. Ginger biscuits/tea/etc. and plain food helps with the nausea. Keep drinking lots and take painkillers if you need. Doctor also recommended OTC cystitis symptom relievers:)

I feel extremely nauseous. Have not been able to keep anything down, every part of me aches and I have been in bed all day. Pretty sure I have been hallucinating at points today. However, my UTI seems to be on the mend. I would recommend using an antibiotic without these awful side effects. This is the first time I have ever written a review, I just feel others should be warned. Also, not that this matters...but my urine is bright yellow!

First. Thank goodness I didn't read these reviews or I wouldn't have tried it. Interesting that the side effects everyone  is describing are the same side effects I had on Ciprofloxicin.  I was very worried taking this antibiotic because I lately don't do well. Also  I have gotten hives from Bactrim so I got nervous taking any antibiotic. The difference this time I'm eating yogurt and taking a probiotic so I wonder if that made a difference. No pain at all in body no tiredness  no dizziness. I don't even feel like I'm on a drug. I'm beginning to wonder if sometimes when we take these drugs it depends on our bodies at the time. When I got hives from Bactrim and told the doctor she said I had been on it before.  Definitely eat yogurt and take probiotics.

Had a painful UTI, after about 24 hours on the Nitrofurantoin, the UTI wasn’t as intense. I am extremely sensitive to medications and haven’t had much of an issue so far. Mind you, I drink about 65-80 oz of water every day, maybe that helps.Have had a little headache and I am sort of fatigued, otherwise no issues.

Macrodantin (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this to be taken 4 times daily for 3 days. My UTI symptoms were gone by the first day. I have now finished the course and my UTI is gone. This medication worked great for the infection. I did not experience any serious side effects except some tiredness, 'spaced out' feeling, and on the 2nd day I did feel very 'down' not sure if that was because of the medication. However on the third day I feel fine.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have been so ill for days I get sick a lot so I tried to brush it off but it’s to the point I was considering going to the hospital. I’m vomiting so bad it’s painful. I think about recently being prescribed this med and notice that oh it’s this damn pill that has me so violently ill. I’m still vomiting violently that’s not even right.  Omg someone save me  lol also tired achy skin blisters feel off like speedy light headed. Def no longer taking them

Within 24 hours I experienced muscle pain and spasms in my back and diarrhea. Within 48 hours I was experiencing respiratory issues (shortening of breath and a nasty cough) and the start of a yeast infection.

I was prescribed this for a UTI. Took 1 dose (100 mg) in the morning as directed and within 4-6 hours was exhausted and lethargic. Later that night I was experiencing chills (woke up in a delirious fever like state), exhaustion, nausea (can't eat), severe joint pain everywhere (especially in my spine and knees), tightness in my lungs, I feel like crying because the the show must go on and I feel like I have the flu! I'm hoping by tomorrow (48 hours after 1 dose) I start to feel better. I've taken other antibiotics along with probiotics and never had a problem. This is an awful feeling!!! Seems like it works for others, but must not mix with my body chemistry, never again, would rather take penicillin and deal with getting hives again.

Don't let people on this website scare you. I've taken lots of different antibiotics (amoxicillin, cipro, bactrim, etc) and I almost never have any issues. Same with Nitrofurantoin. I was on it for 7 days for a UTI. It worked. UTI gone. No side effects that I ever noticed (and I'm a total anxious hypochondriac, so I would have noticed).If you're sensitive to antibiotics, maybe it would help to eat a big meal before you take this (or any) antibiotic. I took mine sometimes with just eating one boiled egg on my way out the door and was always fine. You'll be fine. Really. It's not a big deal.

I was prescribed this medication 6 days ago. I am 8 weeks pregnant and I went in to the ER for hydration due to severe morning sickness. They always do a urine specimen on pregnant women. Discovered I had a trace of bacteria so he said he would go ahead and treat it. I'm allergic to sulfa drugs and cephlasporins. Usually I take amoxicillin. I was good for the first few days but now my nausea is almost unbearable also committing more, I'm tired and my back hurts. Only 4 more pills to take. I figured my morning sickness just peaked but after reading these reviews I'm not so sure but I do have nausea meds so I'll be taking those.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Macrobid did nothing to eliminate my UTI. It was a failure just like amoxicillian. I was a bit nauseous at first but nothing that affected me. I took it for ten days.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Under no circumstances use this if you have a lung complaint.  Long term use can cause serious lung reactions

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Awful medication. I was only prescribed 6 tablets to take and if I'd read on here about them, I would have stopped after the first 1.Horrific headaches straight away, constantly nausea so much so I could barely eat to take my next tablet, drowsiness where I'm bumbling about my flat constantly, heat sweats, skin sensitivity. My neck is unbelievably sore making my headaches much worse.

49 year old female. I was not showing any signs of a UTI. My doctor tested my urine and "thought there maybe a possiblity of a UTI." Therefore, as a precaution I was prescribed 100 mg twice a day for 5 days. I was extremely tired, a bit dizzy at times, mild headache. Within 24 hrs. I had severe chills temp jumped up to 103, sweated out all night. Seem to be a bit better this morning, temp returned to normal 95.8.  But still very tired and headache.  I felt better prior as I had NO symptoms.  Trying to stick it out for another 2 days. Sign.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was extremely hesitant about taking this drug because of all the negative reviews. This drug worked great for my UTI for a few weeks. No real side effects except a headache here and there. I would definitely take it after a meal. Even with all of the negative reviews, just remember that each person is different and everyone reacts differently to drugs. I was so afraid of trying this drug because of the horrible side effects, however I am so glad that I did! I would have rated it a 10, however I now have to take something stronger due to the type of bacteria that showed up in my urine that is hard to treat.

This is a serious antibiotic.  I have never had such adverse side-effects to a medication than I have with nitro.  I had a UTI that kept coming back for about 5 month.  Doc finally put me on Nitro after cipro and everything else didn't work.  I am on day 9 of a 10 day dose and feel like I am dying.  I can't get a good rest.  My lungs feel congested but I can't cough up anything and my cough is dry.  I get panicky and frustrated very easily.  I have ZERO energy.  My hair is thinning.  I am freezing constantly.  Overall I feel like I am getting over the flu.  Unlike those who complain of diarrhea, I have severe constipation.  I am only one day away from the end... I just need to tough it out one more day....

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I had a UTI not too long ago, and I was prescribed Macrobid. I did not have any crazy side effects. Unfortunately I get them frequently and just started a new round of Macrobid, and this time has been nothing but bad news. I am on day 5 of 7 and I have been extremely nauseous, dizzy, and tired along with sharp abdominal pain. The UTI isn't as severe anymore but I feel like it hasn't been as effective and that it's still lingering. I made sure to eat a decent meal before and drink plenty of water, I think that it's just not reacting well with my system. I am definitely stopping after today and going to the doctor to figure out a new solution.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I have been to scared to use the bathroom all day. After one dose of Macrobid (3ish hours after) I already have relief! I seriously can't believe it's working this fast.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):So, Macrobid can certainly have some uncomfortable side effects. Most of these are preventable/treatable with headache pills, taking it with lots of food, and probiotics. If you are allergic, that is not the fault of the medicine, nor is it yours. That's just the way the cards were dealt.Macrobid, or nitrofurantoin, is very good for UTI treatment and the methods it does so makes bacteria unlikely to build resistance to it. Macrobid should be the first option before general antibiotics for this reason.Macrobid works very well and usually is taken twice daily (breakfast, dinner). For me, I had fatigue and headaches but they left after two days. After that, I felt fine for the remaining 8 days. And it worked!

This med is HORRIBLE!!  I am a very happy well-rounded person. After taking this for two days I was a wreck! It gave me panic attacks, which I've never had before. It made me cry which I don't do often. It also gave me numb lips and crawly scalp. DON't take it! Take Over the counter Cystex or AVO products and drink lots of water. Rest and stay near the bathroom. You'll be fine without this.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Prescribed this after recurrent UTI. I am very prone to them and if you are too try to listen to your body and know your triggers. I know it sucks to not be able to drink soda, or having to jump up after sex to pee but it's well worth it in the long run. Macrobid like sulpha and cipro make me feel uneasy but there's no getting around that but I would rather feel a little uneasy then peeing what feels like fire and sitting on the toilet for hours crying thinking how unfair it is to be born with a short urethra. I'm shocked how many people would rather have a UTI than the uneasiness of an antibiotic. Not for me. Obviously my symptoms of painful urinating makes it so worth just a little   tummy ache to feel better.Take with food. Take all reviews with a grain of salt.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed this for a UTI and while it did help with that, it ended up giving me the worst yeast infection of my life that I am still treating 2 months later. I usually don't have too much of an issue with antibiotics but this was awful.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I was prescribed Microbid for a UTI that I had for about 2 weeks. I took 2 pills so far 100mg each. I have stomach issues so I took mine with vanilla yogurt and had no nausea or vomiting. I highly suggest yogurt when taking antibiotics. It works like a charm. I have had no bad issues or side effects. I already feel better after 2 pills. Give the medication a chance it's working to kill bad bacteria which can make anyone feel yucky. Good luck!!!

Alright, so in terms of this medication, it did its job. One thing I know after having UTI's here and there on occasion that antibiotics are downright AGGRESSIVE. Even with other antibiotics, I had experience similar side effects. But I'd say for those who are not big on side effects this is not the greatest. Everybodys bodies are different, but in my case I had some of the side affects posted: hard time sleeping, soreness,  headaches, oddly colored diarrhea, you name it. In general nitrofuranctoin means business and really buckle up for the side affects, but it did the job for me and I saw improvement with my UTI in 2 days so far on my 4th day and no UTI!
username: At least the uti is gone

review: I used this medication for 2 days and I had widespread pain all over my body. When asked to discontinue the med I hurt for 2 to 3 days. My experience was not a good one however I know it may work for  others.
Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I took 1 pill...4 hours later and I was vomiting like crazy. Ridiculous.
These things are all true, but it is also a very urinary specific drug that does the job when a lot of broad-spectrum antibiotics won't.

Was prescribed 3 days of trimethoprim for a UTI and they didn't touch it. I'm now on day 6 of a 7 day course of nitrafurantoin and I have had terrible diarrhea and stomach cramps. My wee has also turned a bright yellow which I'm concerned about since I thought it only turned dark yellow or brown on these tablets. Anyway, my UTI symptoms don't seem to have gotten any better.
Worse antibiotic I have ever taken. This is the first time I've ever take an antibiotic and felt worse than the infection.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Been on 200 mg day for 3 of 4 weeks. Restarted after first 2. Have my doubts I am winning the battle on this one. Test does not show resistance built up but when it comes toward time for the next pill the soreness and all start kicking in. Of course I think there is a stone a hiding some where - we will see

I have a history of kidney infections and a new doc saw me as an emergency and gave me 7 days worth of Nitro and 4 days later I still felt rough so the doctor gave me a longer dose....it's two days since and I hurt EVERYWHERE!! I feel like my whole body is shaking and I have had hallucinations and nights sweats - went to docs AGAIN just now and been prescribed a new antibiotic as he said that nitro has not worked and my fever is getting higher everyday!! Stupid pills

This medicine is horrid.  I feel 10x's worse after just taking 2 doses of this.  Do not take this med unless you are OK with severe stomach pains, nausea and just feeling terrible and not able to function through the day.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Worst medicine ever!!! Went to the ER & was diagnosed with a UTI so this med was prescribed! I've been in bed now 2 days straight! The headaches & body aches are just ridiculous! Not to mention I don't have an appetite but I've been throwing up off & on! This medicine made me worse than I was in the beginning! This is my first & last time taking this that's for sure!

The day after I started taking this I started having major leakage and had no warning.  I also had diarrhea but thought it was something I ate.   I have been off of it for 5 days and still peeing while I sleep, while I walk. It's annoying. Plus I still have the UTI.  Not a fan of this medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):Was prescribed Macrobid by my physician for UTI.  On the third day of taking this medicine, my hands became numbed. It was so bad that when I was driving to work, my left hand slipped off the steering wheel. Talking about scared. I thought I was going to drive off the bridge. They need to do something about this medicine. Because the severe side effect that I received, this medication is dangerous. I'm still suffering from weakness from both hands. And it's very scary when I have to go somewhere. I never thought that I would get this bad reaction from this medication.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):I've had UTI's before that have been treated with Cipro with no side effects. This last infection was pretty bad and the physician I saw prescribed Macrodantin, which I had never used. The first dose gave me a severe headache and then second dose put me almost under. The leg cramps were so severe my husband wanted to take me to the Emergency room. They were so painful and came so often until I was scared. I had to call in sick from work because they kept coming and I threw up and was very fatigued. I drank tonic water and orange juice which helped the cramps so I'm calling my physician for Cipro first thing in the morning and I'll list this medication as an allergy from now on. The side effects were horrible and outweighed the benefits.

I was diagnosed with a UTI about 2 weeks ago and was put on this medicine for 7 days. The burning and urgency symptoms went away, but I still feel "uncomfortable". I called my doctor and she refilled my prescription, so after another 7 days if I'm not better, I will go back in to see what's going on. I take the pill once in the morning and once at night (with food). Symptoms: I've taken this medication before and maybe it's just me, but I feel like my mood changes when I'm on it. I feel super emotional and just get super upset and even feel angry at times. So ready to be off of it in a few days...

Well like so many others I have to say I had extreme nausea for 3 days while taking this followed by a day of vomiting. I called my GP who told me to stop it immediately. I have never had a reaction to antibiotics before. On the other hand after taking just 3 doses on the first day the burning pain and need to urinate was gone! I also too 400mg ibruprofen for the flank pain. So yes it did work very fast at targeting my UTI symptoms which was great, but it left my lethargic, feeling terribly sick and throwing up after 3 days of doses. Worth trying if you are experiencing a severe UTI, but not as a first try!

I get a couple UTI's a year. I always take Macrobid. If I take 10-20 billion probiotics 2 hours after taking the Macrobid, I'm fine. No yeast infections or nausea. You must replenish your flora after each pill. It is a must! When I didn't, I used to have all the bad symptoms you read about. Even after my course is done I continue to take the probiotics for another week or more.

Macrobid (nitrofurantoin):EVERYONE IS DIFFERENT.  I had a great experience with Macrobid. I am actually allergic to a few meds so I was relieved to have one for a mean UTI I got over the last few days. I actually started taking it Macrobid, 100MG twice daily for 7 days, BEFORE coming to this site to read the reviews. Firstly, it says to take it with food or milk, so many probably didn't follow those directions b/c it will give you nausea/vomiting if you don't. The only side effect I've had is drowsiness. But my doctor also prescribed me with metronidazole 500mg, taken twice daily WITH the Macrobid to offset symptoms that can bring on a yeast infection etc.  I only get UTIs once or twice a year, but this one reared it's ugly head and Macrobid worked wonders for me.
